loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman with 4 children. She describes herself as motivated and ambitious. 

She operates a retail business to sell bananas. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are individuals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be finances. She will use 20,000 KES to buy bananas and sugarcane. 

Her business goal is to increase her stock within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand the business. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy  bananas and sugarcane.

loans.name: Carolina Ernesto

texts.pt:
A Sra Carolina de 47 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 4 filhos dos quais 3 sao independente e 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino secundario, sustenta uma neta e sua mae. Ela è operaria agricola na empresa de producao de banan a mais de 1 ano e 7 meses.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construcao (blocos, cimento, e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construcao da sua casa.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condicoes da habitacao e adieta almentar.
texts.en:
Carolina is 47 years old and single. She has four children, three of whom are independent and one attends secondary school. She supports a granddaughter and her mother. She has been a farm worker for a banana company for over a year and seven months.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (bricks and cement) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.
Her biggest challenge is improving her living conditions and her diet.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks and cement) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a 27-year-old single woman with 1 child. She describes herself as ambitious and patient. 

She operates a M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for 2 years. Her business is located in a busy place and her primary customers are walk-in and permanent customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds and M-pesa delays due to network challenges.

She will use 20,000 KES to add money for customers to withdraw. Her business goal is to expand within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand business and take care of her child. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to expand her money transfer services.

loans.name: Jeanette Del Socorro

texts.es:
Jeanette de  26 años de edad, madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria de Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser  trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente no pudo cursar sus estudio, pero le hubiera  gustado estudiar administración de empresa, en la actualidad luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante, tiene por actividad económica un cafetín ubicado en su casa de habitación. El cual consiste en la venta de  gaseosas, café con leche, café, jugos, refrescos naturales, repostería. Ella dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Jeanette agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recurso y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Jeanette, who is 26 years old, is a single mother of two young children. She is from El Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the region. She is known for being hardworking, responsible, and driven to improve herself. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to get a higher education, but she would have liked to study Business Administration. Currently, she works hard every day in order to give her children a better future.

Her effort and drive enabled her to start her own business, a snack stand located in her home, where she sells sodas, lattes, juice, natural refreshments, and pastries. She dedicates about ten hours a day to her business, offering her products to customers. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock her business, so that she can earn higher income in a not-too-distant future. 

Jeanette is grateful for the help Kiva lenders offer people with limited financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to invest in products like sodas, lattes, juice, natural soft drinks, and pastries.

loans.name: Abdalla

texts.en:
Abdalla is married with 5 children, 4  attend school. He owns a house without electricity and running water. 

He sells bread at the market to his neighbors. He faces a major challenge of seasonality in his business.  He wants to establish a wholesale shop to supply bread in the near future. 

With the 40,000 KES, he wants to purchase 8 crates of bread to sell. He decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase 8 crates of bread to sell.

loans.name: Baraka Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwamini est membre dans le groupe de credit Baraka. Femme dynamique, elle est âgée de 29 ans, mère de 3 enfants non encore scolarisés. Elle est mariée à un homme sans emploi.  Commerçante expérimentée, elle sollicite le nouveau credit pour acheter 2 bassins de fretins à revendre au marché public de la place.  Elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires et améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de les soutenir.
texts.en:
Mwamini is a member of the loan group, Baraka.  She is a dynamic, 29-year-old woman with three children.  Non of her children is yet at school.  She is married to a man who is currently out of work.

Mwamini is an experienced trader, and will use this new loan to buy two basins of small fish for resale at the local market.  She would like to be successful in her business and improve the living conditions of her family.

Mwamini is grateful to the field partner, Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to buy 2 basins of small fish for resale.

loans.name: Heri Kwetu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Furaha, femme entrepreneur est présidente du groupe de credit Heri kwetu. Mariée à  un pasteur d’une église du village, elle est âgée de 45 ans et  mère de 8 enfants  (6scolarisés, 2mariés). Commerçante depuis 1987, elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter 10 paires de souliers qui constitue son activité principale. Son objectif est d’assurer une vie meilleure à ses enfants et prospérer dans ses activités.  Elle remercie Hekima  de soutenir les femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en:
Furaha is a woman entrepreneur and president of the loan group, Heri Kwetu.  She is 45 years old, married to the pastor of the village church and has eight children.  Six of her children currently attend school and two are already married.  

Furaha has been working as a trader since 1987, and will use this new loan to buy ten pairs of shoes for resale.  This is the principal activity of her business.  Her objective is to secure a better standard of living for her children and to be successful in her business.

Furaha is grateful to the field partner, Hekima for the support which they offer to women entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to buy 10 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase  rice, vita, candles, toothpaste, flour, sugar, oil, and peppers for her business.

loans.name: José Noe

texts.es:
José de 42 años de edad, es un agricultor, él  no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, es soltero, tiene dos hijos los cuales están con la abuela ya no estudian en ocasiones le ayudan a trabajar. José vive con la mamá y dos sobrinos.

José  se dedica a la agricultura desde que tenía 15  años de edad, este trabajo se lo enseño  el papá que decidió enseñarle este trabajo, ya que es importante aprender a la agricultura porque en esta situación no se consigue trabajo,  alguien que no ha aprendido a leer y  escribir, por ese motivo manifiesta que decidió trabajar de lleno a la agricultura,  en un horario de 6 am a 11 pm.

Con el préstamo solicitado le servirá, para pagar el alquiler de la tierra donde cultiva el maíz,  ya  que el año pasado cultivo 7,000 metros cuadrados y gracias a Dios le fue bien y hoy quiere cultivar 10,500 metros cuadrados, ya que le dan la oportunidad y se la alquilan barata entonces quiere aprovechar esa oportunidad esto le ayudara mucho porque el año pasado que cultivo  menos saco buena cosecha.

Los sueños que tiene es que siempre Dios le preste vida, para seguir cultivando la tierra y tener como llevar el sostén de la casa, poder darle a su mamá todo lo necesario.
texts.en:
José is a 42-year-old farmer who did not have the opportunity to attend school. He is single and has two children who live with a grandmother. They are not in school, but they occasionally help him with his work. José lives with his mother and two nephews.

José has been farming since the age of 15. He learned this trade from his father, who thought it would be best to teach him this type of work. His father figured it would be important to learn agriculture in case José was in a situation in which he could not find work, especially for someone who did not learn to read or write. For this reason, José says that he works full time in agriculture and has a daily schedule from 6:00 A.M. to 11:00 P.M.

The loan he is requesting will be used to pay the rent on some land where he will plant corn. Last year, José cultivated 7,000 square meters and did very well thanks to God. Today, he wants to cultivate 10,500 square meters since he was given this opportunity. He was also offered lower rent, so he wants to take full advantage of this opportunity since last year’s harvest was less than successful.

José dreams that God will always provide him with life so that he can continue cultivating the land and sustain his household, which would allow him to provide everything that his mother needs.

loans.use: to rent a plot of land for growing corn.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en:
Linda is a 19-year-old woman living in the Gokwe South district of Zimbabwe. Linda has been successfully operating a grocery shop at the local business center for over two years in order to raise fees for her young sisters who depend on her to provide for their needs. With the success of her business, Linda employed one person to assist her. While she is proud of the progress she has made so far at such a young age, Linda knows she has the potential to grow the business even more.

With the requested Kiva loan, she intends to make bulk purchases of sugar, cooking oil, matches, chips, macaroni and flour to boost her profits. With the additional profits, she hopes to expand her business into a large supermarket and create employment for other young people in the community. To give back to her community and as a member of Cama, Camfed’s alumnae network, Linda does voluntary work guiding and counseling children in her community.

loans.use: to make bulk quantities of groceries for her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more soft drinks and cold water for her business.

loans.name: Pastoritas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “PASTORITAS” iniciará el tercer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Nery es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de fruta, elaboración de pasteles, venta de api, venta de condimentos, cosméticos, venta de faldas, venta de artefactos electrónicos.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Nery es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es socia de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de api (bebida boliviana); da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años conjuntamente sus padres, ya que tenían el mismo negocio, con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse y tener su negocio propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de api por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta área de capacitación en salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The community association "PASTORITAS" will begin their third cycle in Pro Woman, as part of Focal Center of the Andes. It is made up of 8 members and is headed by a board of directors where Nery is the President. The businesses with which the members of the community association are engaged in are varied. Among them are: fruit sales, pastries, api sales, spice sales, cosmetics, skirt sales, electronics sales.

The loan that they are taking out will benefit small microenterprises where Nery is a member. She says that it is the first time that she joined Pro Mujer, joining by invitation of a friend that is a member of the institution. Today she has a business selling api (a Bolivian drink); She discloses that she learned this business many years ago together with her parents, as they had the same business. After some time she decided to go independent and start her own business.

The loan that they will now take out is to increase the capital (purchase of api wholesale) that she will acquire from the wholesale stores in the city of El Alto and then sell it in her retail space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to maintain her family, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has a son.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she responds that she like the healthcare training that the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase api (a breakfast drink) wholesale.

loans.name: Aida Lourenco

texts.pt:
A Sra Aida de 48 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 4 filhos dos quais 2 estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e 2 nao estão a frequentar a escola mas ainda são dependentes da sua mãe, sustenta sua mae. Ela è empacotador de banana na empresa de produção de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para compra de material de construção (portas, cimento, blocos, janelas, barrotes e chapas de zinco ) para dar continuidade com a  construção da sua casa.
texts.en:
Aida is 48 years old and single. She has four children, two of whom attend primary and secondary school and two are not in school but still depend on their mother. She supports her mother. She's a banana packer for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (doors, cement, bricks, windows, beams and zinc plates) so she can continue building her house.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (doors, cement, bricks, windows, beams and zinc plates) so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Mayerlina Del Socorro

texts.es:
Mayerli de 25 años de edad,  madre soltera con dos hijos menores de edad, es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijos. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica  la compra y venta de cerdos en pie. Actividad que la desempeña en su casa de habitación. Y dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es  invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de cerdo en pie, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Mayerlina agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Mayerlina, who is 25 years old, is a single mother of two young children. She is from El Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the region. She is known for being hardworking, responsible, and driven to improve herself. When she has free time, she enjoys spending it with her children. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to get a higher education because she lacked the financial resources and had to start working at a young age to help with household expenses. 

Her effort and drive enabled her to start her own business selling pigs from her home. She dedicates about eight hours a day to her business, offering her product to customers. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock up on pigs for her business, so that she can earn higher income in a not-too-distant future. 

Mayerlina is grateful for the help Kiva lenders offer people with limited financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to purchase live pigs.

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: Rosa Argentina, madre soltera de tres hijos mayores de edad e independientes, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial y donde existe uno de los ingenio mas grande del país, Rosa es una microempresaria propietaria de una pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo diario como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, leche, pan, leña, productos congelados, detergentes, golosinas, cigarros, huevos, tangs, papel higiénicos, protectores, entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados y distribuidores que les ofrece en la puerta de su casa, sus ventas son al contado, inicia u negocio con fondos propios provenientes de sus ahorros, negocio el cual tiene ya varios años los cuales le ha permitido darse a conocer con sus clientelas, las cuales le brinda el mejor servicio abriendo sus puertas desde muy temprano y cerrando bien tarde, uno de sus sueños es poder mejorar mas el negocio y realizarle ciertas mejoras a su vivienda, el objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en la compra productos de consumo como: granos básicos, productos congelados, detergentes,leña, tomates, cebollas, bananos verdes, golosinas entre otros mas y de esa manera ofrecerles variedades de consumo para sus clientes y obtener mas ingreso.-
texts.en:
Rosa Argentina is a single mother of three adult children who are living on their own. She is from one of the municipalities in Chinandega, located in the western area of the country, which is known for being commercially productive and home to one of the largest sugar mills in the country. 

Rosa is a microentrepreneur. She owns a small grocery store where she sells basic goods like rice, sugar, beans, oil, milk, bread, eggs, firewood, frozen food, detergents, sweets, cigarettes, toilet paper, and other products, which she purchases from markets and distributors and sells for cash at home, at her front door. She started her business with her own funds from her savings and has been in business for several years, which has allowed her to become well known among her customers. She gives them her best service by opening her doors very early and staying open late. One of her dreams is being able to further improve her business and make certain home improvements.

The purpose of this financing is to invest in working capital by purchasing groceries like basic grains, frozen food, detergent, firewood, tomatoes, onions, plantains, sweets, and other products so that she can offer her customers more variety and obtain more income.

loans.use: to purchase groceries like basic grains, frozen food, sweets, and other products.

loans.name: Mugisho Group

texts.fr: Madame Mwavita est une femme dynamique,trésorière du groupe de credit Mugisho. Elle est âgée de 47 ans, mère de 9 enfants (5 scolarisés)  et mariée à un cultivateur. Elle commença le commerce à partir de la vente de  ses produits agricoles en 2005. Deux ans après, elle installa chez elle un Moulin de traitement de manioc pour rendre plus professionnel son travail. Elle sollicite ce nouveau credit pour acheter un 2ème Moulin et renforcer son dépôt avec 1000kg de manioc. Les obstacles qu’elle rencontre pour son entreprise ce sont les coupures intempestives du courant electrique et la panne du moulin. Ainsi, son objectif est de devenir une grande fournisseur de manioc dans le milieu urbain et rural et de se doter d’un grand moulin résistant à mazout. Elle remercie grandement Hekima et ses agents pour les services rendus.
texts.en:
Mwavita is a dynamic woman and treasurer of the loan group, Mugisho.  She is 47 years old, married to a farmer and mother to nine children.  Five of her children currently attend school.  She began her business in 2005 by selling agricultural products.  Two years later she installed a cassava grinding mill in order to improve the quality of the service that she offers.

Mwavita has requested this new loan in order to buy a second grinding mill and reinforce her stock holding with 1,000 kg of cassava.  The biggest obstacles that her business faces are unpredictable and frequent power cuts, and break downs of her grinding mill.  Therefore, her objective is to become a large-scale supplier of cassava in the town and countryside, and to purchase a sturdy mill powered by oil.

Mwavita is grateful to the field partner, Hekima and their colleagues for the services which they offer.

loans.use: to buy a second grinding mill and reinforce her stock holding with 1,000 kg of cassava.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more palm oil, bread, sugar, charcoal, onions, soft drinks, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Om-Rmzi Group

texts.en:
This group is called Om-Rmzi and consists of four women who are all hardworking. They live in Hodeidah, Yemen. They have taken a loan of 80,000 YER.

Jomaa is 22 years old and a single woman. She lives with her parents in a simple house in a poor family in her area. Despite of that, she has a strong determination to improve her standard of living and assist her parents with the expenses of the family. For three years, she has been in the business of door-to-door selling accessories and perfumes for her customers in the streets. She makes modest profits, but most of what she earns goes to assist her parents. On other side, she wants to enlarge her business, so she has requested a loan of 20,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase accessories and perfumes and resell them.
	
Jomaa expects a boost in her income and providing her parents with necessary needs.

loans.use: to purchase accessories and perfumes and resell them

loans.name: Mishi

texts.en:
Mishi is a married woman and staying together with her husband and five children. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, she has operated a firewood-selling business. She sells from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding her business to a wholesale supplier of firewood in the village. 

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase bundles of firewood for resale. She decided to join to Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of firewood for resale

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity but not piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past year, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, and wheat flour.

loans.name: Moises Elias

texts.es: Moisés Elias, mayor de edad, padre soltero de tres hijos menores de edad, originario de uno de los municipios de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona donde predomina el comercio, y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, Moisés se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable,honrado y con muchos deseos de superación personal, es un microempresario que se dedica a la compra y venta de cerdos en pie, la igual que destaza y vende sus derivados del cerdo, pepenas, frito, morongas, charrasca, carnes entre otros, sus compras son al contado a vecinos y sectores aledaños a su su localidad, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos que son los destazadores los cuales recupera semanal lo invertido, hoy en día Moisés esta solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertir en capital de trabajo en al compra de un lote de cerdo y comidas  para los animales. Moisés agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
Moisés Elias is a single father of three young children. He is from one of the municipalities in Chinandega, located in the western area of the country, which is known for its trade and for having one of the largest sugar mills in the country. 

Moisés is known to be hardworking, responsible, honest, and very driven to improve himself. He is a microentrepreneur, and works buying and selling pigs. He also butchers them and sells pork products like different cuts of meat, bacon, blood sausages, pork rinds, and other products. He makes his purchases in cash and buys from neighbors and nearby areas. He charges cash, but his regular customers, who are the butchers, buy on credit. He recovers his investment from them every week. 

Today Moisés is requesting a new loan to invest in working capital by purchasing more pigs and animal feed. Moisés is very  grateful for the support that Kiva lenders offer people with limited financial resources.

loans.use: to buy pigs and animal feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Filimao Estevao

texts.pt:
O Sr Filimao de 28 anos de idade, casado  e è pai de 2 filhos que estao a frequentar a escola no ensino primário, sustenta sua irma e sua mãe. Ele é empacotador de banana numa empresa de produção de banana e é tambem negociante informal de vestuaário actividade que esta a exerer junto com a sua esposa as suas vendas são feitas pelas encomendas.
Com o presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (chapas de zinco, cimento, janela ) para a cobertura da sua casa.Seu maior desafio é concluir sua residencia de forma a garantir uma melhor comodidade a familia
texts.en:
Filimao is 28 years old and married. He has two children who attend elementary school. He supports his sister and his mother. He's a banana packer for a banana company. He's also an informal trader of apparel, a business he runs alongside his wife. He sells on demand.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (zinc plates, cement and windows) in order to put a roof over his house. His biggest challenge is finishing his house in order to ensure more comfort for his family.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (zinc plates, cement and windows) in order to put a roof over his house.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en: Maurice is a 64-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 15 to 34 years. He describes himself to be visionary. He operates a transportation business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His primary customers are regular customers. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft and security. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy a motorcycle. His business goal is to be the best within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will improve the living standards of his family. This is his second loan with SMEP DTM. His previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more sugar and fish for her business.

loans.name: Collins

texts.en: Collins is a 26-year-old married man. He has two children aged 2 and 4 years. He describes himself to be energetic. He operates a retail business where he sells polythene bags. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are vegetable sellers, shops etc. He describes his biggest business challenge to be theft and shortage of stock. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of polythene bags. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will achieve his business goals. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of polythene bags

loans.name: Benigno Ricardo

texts.es: Benigno Ricardo, soltero con 8 hijos los cuales solo una  está  aún bajo su responsabilidad y aun no estudia, originario del municipio de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística, Benigno es un hombre que ha venido luchando día tras día para sacar adelante a su familia, ya que desde muy joven comienza a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, hoy en día es propietario y administrador de un taller de calzado, donde elaboran distintos estilos de calzados, sandalias, botines, zapatos ortopédicos, al igual que ofrece el servicio de reparación, también comercializa materia prima con otros zapateros de mercados de esta localidad, su negocio está ubicado en uno de los mercados, sus compras las realiza en talabarterías de otros municipios, uno de sus sueños es poder tener su propia casa, establecer un buen negocio grande, en esta ocasión  Benigno Ricardo está solicitando financiamiento para capital de trabajo ya que tiene encargos por cumplir, adicional a estos encargos está estudiando la posibilidad de entregar al por mayor a un  comerciante del mercado. Benigno agradece mucho el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en: Benigno Ricardo is single with 8 children, only one of which is still his dependent, and isn’t in school yet. He is from the municipality of Chinandega, which is located in the west of the country and is known to be commercial and touristy. Benigno is a man who fights day to day to get his family ahead:  He began working at a very young age to help with household expenses, and now owns and manages a shoe workshop. In the workshop he makes different styles of shoes, sandals, boots, orthopedic shoes, offers repair services, and also sells raw materials to other cobblers in the area. His business is located in one of the area’s markets. His purchases are made in saddleries in other municipalities. One of his dreams is to own his own home and to have a successful, large business. At this time Benigno Ricardo is requesting funding for working capital, seeing as he has orders to fulfill. In addition to these orders he is evaluating the possibility of buying wholesale from a market trader. Benigno greatly appreciates the support that the Kiva investors offer to low-income people.

loans.use: for working capital to buy raw material for shoemaking

loans.name: Ines Mundau

texts.pt:
A Sra Inês de 34 anos de idade, solteira e mae de 1 filha que esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primário sustenta sua mãe e uma sobrinha. Ela é negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necessidade frutas produtos que tem como origem Swazilande, seus produtos vende no seu estabelicimento comercial na sua casa ou por encomenda, actividade que esta a ser acompanhada junto com sua sobrinha.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necissidade(acucar, refregerante, cerveja, oleo, arroz,feijão, caldos, sabao, rebuçados e mais diversos produtos ) para aumentar o volume do seu negócio e poder espandir as suas vendas.
texts.en:
Inês is 34 years old and single. She has a daughter who attends elementary school. She supports her mother and a niece. She's an informal trader of products that are household staples, fruits and products that come from Swaziland. She sells her merchandise at the store located in her house or on demand. She runs this business alongside ner niece.
The current loan will be used to purchase products that are household staples (sugar, soft drinks, beer, cooking oil, rice, beans, broths, soap, candy and various other items) so that she can increase turnover in her business and expand her sales.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (sugar, soft drinks, beer, cooking oil, rice, beans, broths, soap, candy and various other items).

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a 42-year-old married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a marketable place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the 10,000 KES loan to buy more fish. Her business goal is to have a bigger store within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will be financially stable. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fish

loans.name: Sikuku

texts.en:
Sikuku appreciates the support of the previous loan. With the KES 50,000 loan Sikuku is requesting, she wants to purchase for her business, bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. 

Sikuku decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Mali

texts.en:
Mali appreciates the help of the Kiva loan which helped her to grow her business.

Today, again, Mali comes to you, requesting a loan of KES 30,000 to buy stocks of soap, sugar, salt, maize flour, rice, and wheat flour to sell.

loans.use: to buy stocks of soap, sugar, salt, maize flour, rice, and wheat flour to sell.

loans.name: Leylah

texts.en:
Leylah is a married woman and she has two children. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

For the past one year, Leylah has operated a cereals shop business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. Her potential customers are neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. She dreams of establishing a wholesale cereals shop business in the future. 

With the loan of KES 20,000 that she is requesting, Leylah wants to purchase for the business, stocks of wheat, maize, beans, and rice. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase for the business, stocks of wheat, maize, beans, and rice.

loans.name: Naima Estevao

texts.pt:
A Sra Naima de 31 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 4 filhos dos quais 3 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino secundário e primário e a outra e menor de idade para frequentar a escola. Ela è operária agricola numa empresa de produção de banana.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção(janelas, porta, pedra, cimento, chapas de zinco e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construçãoo da sua casa.
Tem como desafios liquidar a dίvida no prazo pre-estabelecido e solicitar mais empréstimo, insuficiência de fundos.
texts.en:
Naima is 31 years old and single. She has four children, three of whom attend primary and secondary school and the other one is below school age. She's a farm worker for a banana company.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (windows, a door, rocks, cement and zinc plates) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.
Her challenges are repaying the loan within the scheduled time frame and applying for another loan. She also faces the lack of funds.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (windows, a door, rocks, cement and zinc plates) and to pay for labor so she can continue building her house.

loans.name: Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “EMPRENDEDORAS” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Los Andes, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Modesta es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de calcetines, venta de deportivos, tejido de alfombras, venta de comida.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Modesta es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de un promotor de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de calcetines; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió hace varios años de una amiga que comercializaba el mismo producto,  con el pasar del tiempo decide independizarse y tener su negocio propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de calcetines por mayor) que adquirirá de las tiendas mayoristas de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para mantener a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta área de salud que le ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank, "Emprendedoras" is entering its first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of its Los Andes regional office.  The group is made up of eight members, and it is led by a board of directors of which Modesta is the president.  The members of the group are involved in a variety of businesses including: selling socks, selling athletic clothing, weaving rugs, and selling food.  

The loan that they are seeking will be used to help the small businesses of which Modesta is a member.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago after receiving an invitation from a sponsor of the institution who visited her at her home.  Currently, she has a business selling socks.  She states that she learned this trade a few years ago from a friend who also sold socks.  With time, she decided to become independent and start her own business.  

The loan that she will receive will be used to increase her capital (purchasing socks in bulk), that she will acquire from wholesale stores in the city of El Alto, and later sell in her store.  This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her family.  She lives in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she enjoys the health care offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase socks in bulk.

loans.name: Yeceira Araceli

texts.es: Yeceira Araceli, 31 años de edad madre soltera de tres hijos menores de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios del norte de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, localidad donde predomina el comercio, turismo, producción de oro, agricultura, ganadería entre otros, Yeceira es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de una hermosa pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo diario como: arroz, azúcar, frijoles, aceite, shampoo, detergentes, productos congelados, golosinas, productos de limpiezas leña, sardinas sopas maggi, entre otros mas productos, Yeceira en la vida ha sido muy luchadora, trabajadora, responsable y con ganas de superación personal, para cumplir cada una de sus sueños y metas. por falta de recursos económicos no pudo estudiar debido a que desde muy joven tuvo que trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar siendo ella la mayor de sus hermanos y que ellos estudiaran, es allí donde ella aprende el negocio de esta pulperia que aprende gracias a su mama luego se independiza y pone su propia pulperia con ahorros propios, Hoy en día su sueño es ver formados a sus hijos en todos unos profesionales, y ver que su negocio crezca mas para asi obtener mayores ingresos, por lo tanto el objetivo de este crédito es para invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como: granos básicos, productos congelados, golosinas, detergentes entre otros mas.
texts.en:
Yeceira Araceli is 31 years old. She is a single mother of three young children. She is from one of the municipalities in northern Chinandega, which is located in the western area of the country and is known for its trade, tourism, gold mining, and agriculture. 

Yeceira is a microentrepreneur. She owns and manages a beautiful grocery store where she offers basic goods like rice, sugar, beans, oil, shampoo, detergent, frozen food products, sweets, cleaning products, firewood, sardines, instant soup mix, and other items. Yeceira has been a hard worker and a fighter in life. She is responsible and driven to improve herself and to achieve each of her goals and dreams. Because she lacked enough financial resources, she wasn't able to go to school, since she was the oldest of her siblings and had to start working when she was very young to help with household expenses and so that the younger children could go to school. That is how she learned the business of running a grocery store. She learned from her mother and later became independent and started her own grocery store with her own savings. 

Today her dream is to see her children have a career and for her business to grow so that she can make more income. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock up on groceries for her business, like basic grains, frozen food products, sweets, detergent, and other items.

loans.use: to buy grocerues like frozen food products, sweets, basic grains, and other items.

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en:
Jacob is a 36-year-old man. He has six children, with ages ranging from 5 years to 15 years. He describes himself as being creative. 

Jacob operates a carpentry business where he makes furniture. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a populated area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be the high price of timber. 

Jacob will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stocks of timber for making furniture. His business goal is to have a full workshop, well equipped, within five years. He hopes that, in the future, he will have a good lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy stocks of timber for making furniture.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy blouses, shirts, t-shirts, skirts, and men and women's underwear.

loans.name: Kanaiym

texts.ru: Канайым 29 лет, замужем, двое детей дошкольного возраста. У Канайым высшее образование, имеет очень хорошую репутацию, как в торговле, так и в межличностных отношениях. В деловых отношениях проявляет  терпение и трудолюбие. Канайым в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2008 года занимается торговлей мыло-моющими средствами, начав этот бизнес с 10,000 сомов (KGS). Помещение магазина принадлежит ее семье, поэтому арендную плату Канайым не платит. Благодаря упорному труду Канайым, она смогла развить и расширить свой товар, ее деятельность приносит около 20,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. Доходы от бизнеса позволили Канайым расширить свой товарооборот, на сегодняшний день он составляет в среднем 100,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Канайым обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку мыло-моющих средств для увеличения товарооборота. Доходы от кредита помогут Канайым расширить бизнес, а также полученная прибыль поможет вырастить и обучить детей.
texts.en: Kanaiym is 29 years old. She is married and has two toddlers. Kanaiym has a higher education and has a very good reputation both as in her retail business and in her interpersonal relationships. In her business relationships, she is patient and hardworking. As the main source of income for her family, Kanaiym started selling soaps and personal cleaning products. She started this business in 2008 with 10,000 som (KGS). The shop premises is owned by her family which is why Kanaiym does not need to pay rent for the shop. Thanks to Kanaiym's hard work, she has been able to develop and expand her merchandise. This business brings in about 20,000 som (KGS) per money, which serves to cover her family's expenses on food and everyday necessities. The income from the business allowed Kanaiym to expand her sales turnover. It is currently 100,000 som (KGS) on average. For the purpose of further developing her business, Kanaiym turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy soap and personal cleaning products to increase her sales turnover. The earnings from the loan will help Kanaiym expand her business. The received profits will also help her raise and educate her children.

loans.use: to buy soap and personal cleaning products for retail sale.

loans.name: Sungane

texts.pt:
O Sr Sungane de 64 anos de idade, casado e pai de 7 filhos dos quais 2 estão afrequentar a escola no ensino secundário e 5 são independente e que se encontram na vizinha Africa do Sul, sustenta 2 irmãos seus. Ele é pensionista militar e é agricultor informal nos regadios de Boane actividade que esta a ser acompanhada junto com a sua esposa e um dos seus filhos.
O presente empréstimo será aplicado para comprar material de construção (barrotes, janelas, chapas de zinco pedra e pagamento de mão-de-obra) para dar continuidade com a construção da sua casa.
Tem como desafios liquidar a dίvida no prazo pre-estabelecido e solicitar mais empréstimo, insuficiência de fundos.
texts.en:
Sungane is 64 years old and married. He has seven children, two of whom attend high school and five are independent and live in neighboring South Africa. He supports two of his siblings. He's a military pensioner and an informal farmer on the irrigated lands of Boane. He does this type of work alongside his wife and one of his children.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (beams, windows, zinc plates and rocks) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house.
His challenges are repaying the loan within the scheduled time frame and applying for another loan. He also faces the lack of funds.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (beams, windows, zinc plates and rocks) and to pay for labor so he can continue building his house.

loans.name: Kevin

texts.en:
Kevin is a married man. He has one child. He operates a retail business where he sells electronics and also repairs electronics. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be power outages. 

Kevin will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of electronics. His business goal is to be prosperous within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of electronics

loans.name: Felicidade Francisco

texts.pt:
A Sr Felicidade de 39 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario 1 e independente. Ela è negociante informal de produtos da machamba e produtos da 1ª necissidade, actividade que esta a explorar a mais de de 12 anos.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar material de construção (blocos, cimento, varoes e pagamento de mao-de-obra) para dar continuidade com as obras.
texts.en:
Felicidade is 39 years old and single. She has three children, two of whom attend primary and secondary school and one is independent. She's an informal trader of farm produce and products that are household staples, a business she has run for over 12 years.
The current loan will be used to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement and rods) and to pay for labor so she can move forward with the construction work.

loans.use: to purchase construction supplies (bricks, cement and rods) and to pay for labor so she can move forward with the construction work.

loans.name: Estrellas De Tarapaca Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “ESTRELLAS DE TARAPACA” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por nueve  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Lourdes es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de dulces y gelatinas, venta de sopa de fideo, venta de coca, venta de comida, tejido de mantas y chompas a máquina, taller de chapería, pensión, agricultura, venta de sucumbe (licor casero).

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Lourdes es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de comida; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al observar a las señoras comerciantes de este producto, observado la forma de venta, manejo y comidas más vendidas, posteriormente decide independizarse y emprender un negocio propio.
 
El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de víveres por mayor) que adquirirá de las ferias de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente a la elaboración lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella es casada y tiene tres hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta las capacitaciones en salud que ofrece el personal de la institución.

En la imagen no se encuentra una de las señoras del grupo, ya que por razones de fuerza mayor se fue a su negocio.
texts.en:
The "Estrellas de Tarapaca" communal bank is entering is first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of its Senkata regional office.  The group is made up of nine members, and is led by a board of directors of which Lourdes is the president.  The members of the group are involved in a variety of businesses including: selling candy and jellies, selling noodle soups, selling coca, selling food, sewing blankets and sweaters, car repair shops, boardinghouses, farming, selling moonshine.  

The loan that they are requesting will benefit the small businesses in which Lourdes is a member.  She states that this is her first time joining Pro Mujer, having joined after being invited by a sponsor of the institution who visited her at her home.  Currently, she has a business selling food.  She learned this trade from observing other women who sold this product, watching how it was sold, how the business was run, and which foods sold most.  She later decided to open her own business.  

This loan will be used to increase her capital (purchasing food in bulk), which she will acquire in the markets of the city of El Alto, and after preparing them, she will sell them in her restaurant.  This form of work allows her to earn an income to support her family, as she is married and has three children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she states that she enjoys the health training that the institution's staff offers. 

In the picture, one of the members of the group is not shown because she had to go to her business.

loans.use: purchase food in bulk.

loans.name: Genesis 5 Group

texts.es: El Grupo solidario Génesis 5, está conformado por cinco integrantes Alicia Carolina, Juana Rosa, Luisa Amanda, Maria de los Ángeles y Paula Magdalena, todas casadas originarias de uno de los municipios del norte del departamento de Chinandega, ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, ganadería, agricultura, entre otros más, estos integrantes se conocen muy bien porque son de la misma zona motivo por el cual deciden forma un Grupo Solidario para ayudarse económicamente e invertir en sus diferentes negocios, Juana Rosa quien es la coordinadora del Grupo Solidario es quien se encargara de la responsabilidad  y cumplimiento de pagos en tiempo y forma es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de una librería y venta de ropa, donde ofrece productos como: cuadernos, lápices, marcadores acrílicos y permanentes, cartulinas, pegas, papelillos, mochilas, reglas, tajadores, borradores, blocks, entre otros también variedades estilos de ropa, como: camisetas, short, pantalones, camisolas, chinelas, gafas, sombreros, bloqueadores solares, entre otros más para aprovechar las ventas en esta temporada de semana santa, que es donde más se vende estos productos, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de mayoreo de otro municipio, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito a clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales recupera semanal lo invertido, negocio que lo inicia con fondos propios como un medio para salir adelante, ya son varios años de dedicarse a este negocio, el cual su clientela la conoce muy bien por la variedades de productos y la buena atención que le brinda a sus clientes, El objetivo de este financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo para surtir más sus negocios y satisfacer las necesidades y demandas de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The solidarity group Génesis 5 comprises five members: Alicia Carolina, Juana Rosa, Luisa Amanda, Maria de los Ángeles, and Paula Magdalena. They are all married and are from one of the municipalities in the northern area of the department of Chinandega, which is located in western Nicaragua and is known for its highly productive trade and agriculture, as well as other things.

The members of this group know each other very well because they are from the same area, which is why they decided to form a solidarity group to help each other financially and invest in their different businesses. Juana Rosa is the group coordinator and is in charge of checking everyone's responsibilities and making sure payments are made on time. She is a microentrepreneur. She runs a store where she sells school supplies as well as clothing. She offers notebooks, pencils, acrylic and permanent markers, construction paper, stickers, backpacks, rulers, scissors, erasers, steno pads, and other items. She also sells different styles of clothing like t-shirts, shorts, pants, camis, and hats, as well as sun glasses, sunscreen, sandals, and other items, in order to make the most of the Easter season, which is when these products sell the most. She makes her purchases in cash, buying from wholesale markets in a different municipality. She has regular and occasional customers, and they pay her in cash or on credit, in which case she recovers her investment from them weekly. She started her business with her own funds as a way to get ahead and has been in business for several years now. She is well known among her customers for the variety of products she offers and the great service she provides. 

The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and further stock her business so that she can meet her customers' needs and demands.

loans.use: to invest in school supplies, assorted clothing, and other products.

loans.name: Nestor Francisco

texts.es: Nestor Francisco, acompañado con dos hijos menores de edad, originario del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, Nestor se caracteriza por ser un hombre trabajador, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera universitaria terminado solo la primaria por lo que se vio obligado a trabajar desde muy joven para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. Por tanto lucha día a día para brindarle un futuro mejor a sus pequeños hijos para que sean profesionales, Nestor es un microempresario propietario y administrador de su propio negocio que consiste en la compra venta de cerdos en pie, y sus derivados como: menudos, posta de cerdo, lomo, chorizos, pepenas, frito, charrasca, moronga entre otros mas, sus compras las realiza al contado en comarcas aledañas a su localidad, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal lo invertido, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales sus clientes son comerciantes y destazadores, inicia su negocio con fondos propios producto de ahorros de su trabajo anterior como un medio digno de salir adelante junto con su familia. El objetivo de este financiamiento es para la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie y alimentos para los animales.
texts.en: Nestor Francisco is married and has two children. He is from the town of Chinandega, located in the western part of the country. Nestor is described as being a hardworking, responsible man who is very eager to get ahead personally. He was unable to go to college and only finished primary school because he had to work since he was very young to help with the household expenses. Because of that, he fights day to day to offer a better future to his young children so that they can graduate from college. Nestor is a micro- businessman. He is the proprietor and manager of his own business, which is buying and selling live pigs and pork products such as chitlings, pork chops,  pork loin, sausage, pork rinds, fried pork, moronga and more. He makes his purchases in the areas surrounding his town and pays for them up front. He sells and collects payment up front and on credit. He has regular and occasional customers who are merchants and butchers. He started his business with his own money from savings he had from a previous job in order to have a dignified way to get ahead with his family. The purpose of this loan is to buy a lot of live pigs and feed for the animals.

loans.use: to buy a lot of live pigs and feed for them.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

She has operated a poultry-selling business for over threes years. She mentioned disease outbreak causing losses as a challenge in the business. She dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed

loans.name: Riziki

texts.en:
Riziki is a married woman and has been blessed with two kids who attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is school fees. 

Riziki operates  a poultry-selling business to earn a living. Riziki dreams of becoming a wholesaler of poultry in the future. 

With the Kshs 50,000, Riziki wants to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business continuity. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase chicks and poultry feed for her business continuity

loans.name: Tuvumiliane Group

texts.fr: La cliente Konkwa  est  présidente de la banque villageoise Tuvumiliane. A  41 ans, elle mariée à un homme sans emploi et ensemble ils ont 10 enfants qui vont tous à l’école. Femme d’affaire depuis 1999, elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Avec ce  nouveau crédit, elle va acheter 2 sacs de haricots et 2 sacs de riz. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une jolie maison et remercie Hekima d’appuyer les femmes à bas revenu.
texts.en: This client, Konkwa, is the president of the ’banc villageois’ called Tuvumiliane. She is 41 years old  and married to a man who is unemployed. Together they have ten children, who all go to school. A business woman since 1999, Konkwa is a vendor of grocery items. With this new loan, she is going to purchase 2 sacks of beans and 2 sacks rice. Thus, she would like to build a nice house, and she thanks Hekima for supporting low-income women.

loans.use: to purchase 2 sacks of beans and and 2 sacks of rice

loans.name: Tucukuliane Group

texts.fr: Madame Ntakwinja  est présidente dans Tucukuliane, un groupe de crédit. Femme forte et entrepreneur, elle est âgée de 25 ans et mère de 3 enfants qui étudient tous. Elle est mariée à un chauffeur de taxi. La cliente est une vendeuse de divers articles  depuis 2001. Le nouveau prêt va faciliter  l’achat de 20 paires de soulier en plastique. Son objectif est d’acheter une parcelle.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de soutenir les femmes.
texts.en: Ms. Ntakwinja is the president of Tucukuliane, a loan group. A strong woman entrepreneur, she is 25 years old and a mother with children, who are all in school. Ntakwinja is married to a taxi driver. This client has been a vendor of a variety of goods since 2001. This new loan will facilitate the purchase of 20 pairs of plastic shoes. Her goal is purchase a parcel of land. So, she thanks Hekima for supporting women.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pairs of plastic shoes

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Al caminar por las calles de Estelí, nos encontramos con la tienda de ropa usada y  de joyas de Aracely, la cual nos daba la bienvenida cordialmente. Esta madre de tres hijos menores de 20 años, quienes le han ayudado desde el comienzo de su negocio. La sonriente  comerciante, se siente motivada por su trabajo, pues gracias a este pequeño negocio ha logrado sacar adelante a sus herederos.
Aracely inició con el apoyo de su familia, quienes le ayudaron con una pequeña cantidad de ropa, a la cual no dudo en sacarle provecho, además de unas remesas que de vez en cuando le envían sus hermanos, quienes han perseguido el sueño americano. Actualmente comercializa en Estelí, pues la gente está contenta con la tienda y con la amabilidad con la cual les reciben. Además, es de admirar la disposición que tiene la propietaria para salir a vender a las calles.  Esto la hace ser una mujer con visión de crecimiento, pues sus metas son hacer una tienda completa, con todos los productos necesarios. Por esta razón, sabe que con el préstamo MiCrédito-KIVA podrá comprar más joyas, ropa nueva y de segunda, entre otros accesorios, cuya demanda ha sido alta; lo que le permitirá seguir brindándoles una educación estable a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Walking the streets of Estelí, we find Aracely's used clothing and jewelry store, where she kindly welcomed us. She is mother of three children under 20 years old who have helped her since the start of her business. The smiling merchant feels motivated by her job, as thanks to this small business she has been able to raise her children.
Aracely began with the help of her family, who have helped her with a small quantity of clothes, which she did not hesitate to take advantage of as well as the occasional remittance sent by her brothers who have pursued the American dream. Today she markets in Estelí, as the people are happy with the store and the kindness with which she receives them. Also it is admirable that she has the motivation to go out and sell to the streets. This is the making of a woman with a vision of growth, as her goals are to have a complete store, with all the products necessary. For this reason, she knows that with the loan from Kiva she will be able to buy more jewelry, new and secondhand clothing and other accessories whose demand have been high. With this, she will be able to continue providing a stable education to her children.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry, new and secondhand clothing and other accessories.

loans.name: Aida Manuel

texts.pt:
A Sra Aida de 28 anos de idade, casada mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 sao menor de idade para frequentar a escola e 1 esta a frequentar a escola no ensino primário. Ela é negociante informal de produtos basicos na sua casa, actividade que esta a exercer a mais de 5 anos 
Com o valor do emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar (bebidas, refregerantes, farrinha de milho, amendoim, acucar, sabao, arroz e mais diversos produtos ) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio para garantir a sua reforma.

Diz que espera crescer no negócio para poder sustentar seus filhos menores e melhorar as condições de sua loja para melhor responder as necessidades de seus clientes e construir mais dependências para arrendar.
Tem como desafios liquidar a dίvida no prazo pre-estabelecido e solicitar mais empréstimo, insuficiência de fundos.
texts.en:
Aida is 28 years old and married. She has three children, two of whom are below school age and one who attends elementary school. She's an informal trader of household staples at her home, a business she's run for over five years.
The amount of the loan will be used to purchase beverages, soft drinks, cornflour, peanuts, sugar, soap, rice, and various other products. That way she'll increase turnover in her business and ensure that she'll be able to do repairwork.
She states that she hopes to make progress in her business so she can support her underage children; improve the conditions of her store so she can better meet her customers' needs; and build more rooms for renting out.
Her challenges are repaying the loan within the scheduled time frame and applying for another loan. She also faces the lack of funds.

loans.use: to purchase beverages, soft drinks, cornflour, peanuts, sugar, soap, rice, and various other products.

loans.name: Cochalitas Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “COCHALITAS” iniciará el cuarto ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Senkata, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Danitza es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de autopartes, venta de comida, venta de deportivos, salón de belleza, venta de fruta y verduras, taller de costura, venta de cerveza, tejido.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Danitza es integrante, ella indica que hace un año que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una promotora de la institución que fue a visitarle a su casa. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de autopartes; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió al apoyar en su negocio a sus padres, quienes trabajaban constantemente con este negocio, con un poco de ahorro decide independizarse y emprender un negocio propio.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de autopartes por mayor) que adquirirá de Chile y posteriormente lo comercializara en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia, ya que ella vive en unión libre y tiene dos hijos.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta los ahorros que ofrece el personal de la institución.
texts.en:
The "Cochalitas" communal bank is entering its fourth cycle in Pro Mujer as part of their Senkata regional office.  The group is made up of eight members, and is led by a board of directors of which Danitza is the president.  The members are involved in a variety of businesses including: selling car parts, selling food, selling athletic clothing, beauty salons, selling fruits and vegetables, tailoring, selling beer, and weaving.

The loan will be used to help small businesses of which Danitza is a member.  She states that she joined Pro Mujer one year ago after being invited by a sponsor of the institution who visited her at her home.  Currently, she has a business selling car parts, a trade that she learned from helping her parents in their business.  They worked in their business constantly, and with some savings, she decided to open her own business.  

The loan that she is receiving will be used to increase her capital (purchase car parts in bulk), which she will acquire in Chile, and later sell in her store.  This form of work allows her to generate an income to support her family, as she lives in a common-law marriage and has two children.  When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she states that she likes the savings that are offered by the institution.

loans.use: purchase car parts in bulk.

loans.name: Sofia Elface

texts.pt:
A Sra Sofia de 33 anos de idade, solteira e mãe de 3 filhos dos quais 2 estão a frequentar a escola no ensino primario e secundario e a outra è menor de idade para frequentar a escola, sustenta sua mãe e 3 seus irmãos que vivem com ela. Ela é negociante informal de produtos da 1ª necisssidade e é tambem modista, actividade que esta a exercer no seu estabelicimento comercial na sua casa e esta a ser acompanhada com sua mãe e seus irmãos, isto por que e deficiente dos menbros inferior.
Com o presente emprestimo pretende comprar produtos da 1ª necissidade (farrinha de milho, omo, refregerante, bebidas, massa,tomate, bolachas, rebusados e mais diversos produtos) para aumentar o volume do seu negocio.
Tem como grande desafio melhorar as condições de habitação e a dieta alimentar.
texts.en:
Sofia is 33 years old and single. She has three children, two of whom attend primary and secondary school and the other daughter is below school age. She supports her mother and three of her siblings who live with her. She's an informal trader of products that are household staples, and she's also a dressmaker. She runs this business from her store located in her house and she does this alongside her mother and her siblings, because she has a disability on her lower limbs.
With the current loan she intends to purchase products that are household staples (cornflour, laundry detergent, soft drinks, beverages, noodles, tomatoes, crackers, candy and various other items) so she can increase turnover in her business.
Her biggest challenge is improving her living conditions and her diet.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (cornflour, laundry detergent, soft drinks, beverages, noodles, tomatoes, crackers, candy and various other items).

loans.name: Antonio Magaiza

texts.pt:
O Sr Antonio de 59 anos de idade, casado e pai de 2 filhos 1 esta a frequentar a escola e outro e independente. Ele è negociante informal de produtos basicos a mais de 15 anos, actividade que esta a explorar  junto com sua esposa no seu estabelecimento comercial na sua casa.
Com o presente emprestimo sera aplicado para comprar produtos da 1ª necissidade (arroz,amendoim, refregerante, omo, acucar, bebidas e mais diversos produtos ) para aumentar o volume do  seu negocio no seu estabelicimento comercial e espandir para os outros mercados.
texts.en:
Antonio is 59 years old and married. He has two children, one of whom is in school and the other one is independent. He has been an informal trader of household staples for over 15 years, a business he runs alongside his wife at the store located in his house.
The current loan will be used to purchase products that are household staples (rice, peanuts, soft drinks, laundry detergent, sugar, beverages and various other items) so he can increase turnover in his store and expand his business into other markets.

loans.use: to purchase products that are household staples (rice, peanuts, soft drinks, laundry detergent, sugar, beverages and various other items).

loans.name: Leidy Johana

texts.es:
Ella es Leidy Johana, una joven llena de sueños, desde niña siempre  le han gustado los libros que hablan de ilusiones, sueños y realidades pero que a través del tiempo estas ilusiones y sueños se han ido acercando mas a la realidad, porque hoy que ya es  toda una mujer entiende con claridad que la misión y objetivo para la vida es alcanzar las metas propuestas, tiene claro que se debe luchar por lo que le gusta y por lo que siente  y ese sentir es la pasión por la enfermería, porque quiere estudiar esta carrera  para ser una mejor persona, ayudar a la población y además de todo, la mejor recompensa de ser enfermera es ver que los pacientes recuperen la salud gracias a los cuidados,  ya que es un paso fuerte para el futuro verse como toda una enfermera, ayudando a los paciente, a los amigos y todas las personas del entorno, la vida le ha enseñado todo lo bueno y lo malo, porque por cosas del destino toda la vida  ha vivido lejos del papa, pero con la bendición de un dios que todo lo puede y siempre ha estado reflejado atreves de una madre maravillosa, incomparable y luchadora  que ha hecho el papel de padre y madre sacando adelante los hijos por el mejor camino un camino sano, inculcándoles  los mejores valores y buenas costumbre que caracterizan un ser humano con éxito y metas a cumplir. 
Sabe que cuando  haya logrado escalar los peldaños del éxito y los logros propuestos en todos los aspectos es un buen momento para ayudar  con creces a los hermanos, familia y a esa hermosa madre que lucho con fuerza para sacarla adelante y ser una mejor persona en la vida cotidiana y salir adelante día a día.  Solo pide tener las herramientas para cumplir los sueños, logros y metas sin importar los obstáculos, pues el gran sueño es ser la mejor  y demostrar a quienes no creyeron en el que si es posible ser feliz  y los que no cree que si es posible llegar a las estrellas con apoyo de la familia, haciendo el sueño realidad. 
Este subsidio de kiva ella lo necesita como base fundamental, ya que no tiene los recursos necesarios, gracias a este subsidio puede pagar más cómodamente la  carrera para poder salir adelante y cumplir las metas para lograr llegar a ser una gran enfermera.
texts.en:
Her name is Leidy Johana.  She is a young woman who is full of dreams.  From a young age, she has enjoyed books about illusions, dreams and reality, but through time, these dreams and illusions have become closer to reality because now that she is a woman, she understands clearly that the mission and objective of life is to reach your goals.  She knows clearly that she must fight for what she wants and feels, which is her passion for nursing.  She wants to study for a career in order to become a better person, help the public, and above all else, the greatest reward of being a nurse is seeing patients regain their health based on your treatment.  It would be a big step to see herself as a nurse, helping patients, her friends, and everyone else.  Life has taught her everything good and bad, because for some act of fate, she has lived her whole life far from her father.  However, through God's blessings, she has always had a mother who is wonderful, unparalleled and a fighter who has played the role of father and mother, getting her children ahead through the best path.  She has instilled in them the best values and good habits that characterize them as successful people with goals.

She knows that when she has managed to climb the ladder of success and has achieved all of her accomplishments, she will be in a good position to help her siblings, her family, and her wonderful mother who fought to get her ahead and molded her into a better person.  She is only asking to have the tools to reach her dreams, desires and goals regardless of the obstacles.  Her biggest dream is to be better and to show those who did not believe in her that it is possible to be happy and it is possible to reach the stars with the support of your family.

She is in need of the loan from Kiva as she does not have the necessary funds.  Thanks to this loan, she will be able to pay for her education more comfortably so that she can be able to get ahead and reach her goals of becoming a nurse.

loans.use: pay for a semester of school.

loans.name: Rhudosanye Group

texts.fr: La cliente Namunene, femme entrepreneur est présidente du groupe de credit Rhudosanye. A l’âge à de 51 ans,  elle est mariée à  un commerçant de la place. Mère de 8 enfants  (7 scolarisés), elle est vendeuse des poissons salés depuis plus de 17 ans. Elle sollicite ce crédit pour acheter 200 poissons salés. Son rêve est de scolariser ses enfants et leur garantir une bonne alimentation.  Au final, elle remercie Hekima  de soutenir les femmes entrepreneurs.
texts.en: This client, Namunene, is a women entrepreneur and the president of the loan  group Rhudosanye. She is 51 years old and married to a local merchant. A mother of eight children (seven in school), she has been selling salted fish for over seventeen years. She is requesting this loan to purchase 200 salted fish. Her dream is to educate her children and guarantee they are well-fed. In conclusion, she thanks Hekima for supporting women entrepreneur.

loans.use: to purchase 200 salted fish

loans.name: Zubyda Al- Hodeidah Group

texts.en:
Zubyda Al- Hodeidah is a group consisting of four women, living in Hodeidah, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 180,000 YER from AL- Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB).

Zubyda is a 37-year-old married woman, with six children. Her oldest child is 20 years old and the youngest one is 10 years old. She is the leader of the group. Despite her miserable condition, she didn't surrender to her condition, but she decided to help her husband in the expense of the family. Zubyda has had her business for three years, selling door-to-door; she sells perfumes, cosmetics, accessories, and women's clothes, but this business needs to bring in a lot of money in order to purchase more of items. Her money, which she accumulates, is not enough for that and most of what she earns goes to the expenses of her family. Therefore, she is asking a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase perfumes, accessories, cosmetics, and women's clothes.

Zubyda looks forward to expanding her business through buying more items and reselling them to her customers. Her dream is to support her family with a lot of money.

loans.use: To purchase perfumes, accessories, cosmetics, and women clothes.

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Vive maritalmente, conta com ajuda do esposo trabalhador da Africa do Sul, tem 31 anos de idade, mãe de 2 filhos menores que estudam, ela é negociante com mais de 2 anos de experiencia, vende numa barraca perto de sua casa, produtos alimentares todos os dias e esta a tomar pela primeira vez o credito com a Hluvuku.
Ela pretende comprar produtos alimentares como: farinha, feijão, peixe, açúcar, arroz, bolachas, sumos, refrescos, bebidas alcoólicas, etc, para reforçar o seu negocio.
Ela tem sonho de progredir no seu negócio e com os lucros terminar a construção de sua casa.
Tem como dificuldade o capital que actualmente usa, não é suficiente para cobrir os seus planos.
texts.en:
Ana is married and gets help from her husband who works in South Africa. She's 31 years old and has two underage children who are in school. She's a vendor with over two years od experience. She sells foodstuffs from a booth located near her home on a daily basis. This is her first loan with Hluvuku.
She intends to purchase foodstuffs such as flour, beans, fish, sugar, rice, crackers, juices, refreshments, alcoholic beverages, etc. in order to strengthen her business.
Her dream is to make progress in her business and use the profits to finish building her house.
Her difficulty is the capital she currently disposes of, which is not enough to cover her projects.

loans.use: to purchase foodstuffs such as flour, beans, fish, sugar, rice, crackers, juices, refreshments, alcoholic beverages, etc. in order to strengthen her business.

loans.name: Sophea

texts.en:
Sophea is 33 years old. She is a widow who has two children in Takeo Province, Cambodia.
