She has been a garment factory labor since 2011. She earns around $8 per day. 

Now, she would like to apply for loan of $700 to open a beauty salon for her sister. In the future, she hopes that she can build a gate of her house and her two children get high school diplomas.

loans.use: To open a beauty salon

loans.name: Elizabeth Abigail

texts.es: Elizabeth Abigail, mayor de edad casada con tres hijos menores de edad y bajo su responsabilidad, originaria de uno de los municipios de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, turística y donde existe uno de los ingenios mas grande del país, donde produce la azúcar, es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de su propio negocio que consiste en una hermosa pulperia donde ofrece productos de consumo diario como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, detergentes, papel higiénicos, papas, chiltomas, tomates, cebollas, plátanos, leña, productos congelados, golosinas, entre otros negocio ubicado en su casa de habitación, al igual que vende mercadería en general como: variedades estilos de ropa para damas, caballeros, niños, productos de cosméticos, zapatos, entre otros mas estos los vende por encargos o en su casa, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales los cuales ofrece sus productos de forma de contado y al crédito los cuales recupera semanal lo invertido, sus compras las realza al contado en mercados y distribuidoras de esta localidad y en otros municipio, uno de su sueños es poder ver formados profesionalmente a sus hijos, el de mejorar su vivienda para ofrecerles techo digno a sus hijos y el poder crecer mas en su negocio, el objetivo de este nuevo financiamiento es para invertir en capital de trabajo en su mercadería en general como: chort, camisetas, chinelas, gafas, bolsos y en su pulperia surtir un poco mas y aprovechar que se acerca la temporada de semana santa cuando es donde tiene mas demanda en ambos negocios. Elizabeth Abigail, eta muy agradecida con el apoyo que los inversionistas kivas les ofrece a personas de bajos recursos económicos.-
texts.en:
Elizabeth Abigail is married and has three young children under her care.  She is a native of one of the municipalities of Chinandega, which is located in the west of the country, a zone that is known for being productive in business and tourism, and has one of the largest mills in the country, where they produce sugar.  

She is a small business owner, and runs her own business that consists of a beautiful grocery store where she sells everyday products such as: rice, beans, oil, sugar, detergents, toilet paper, potatoes, bell peppers, tomatoes, onions, plantains, wood, frozen foods, and snacks among others.  The store is located in her home.  She also sells general merchandise such as: clothing for women, men and children, cosmetics, and shoes among other items.  She sells these either by order or in person.  She has regular customers and occasional customers to whom she offers her products in cash and by credit, which she collects on a weekly basis.  She purchases her products in markets and from distributors in her city and other municipalities.  

Her dreams are to see her children be professionals, to fix up her home in order to give her children a proper house, and to grow her business.  The goal of this new loan is to invest in working capital with general merchandise such as: shorts, shirts, slippers, glasses, bags, and to stock her grocery store, so that she can take advantage of holy week, when she has the most demand in both businesses.  Elizabeth Abigail is very grateful for the support that the Kiva lenders offer to people of few economic means.

loans.use: purchase bags, slippers, shirts, bathing suits, glasses, and consumer products for the grocery store among others.

loans.name: Suleyman

texts.en: Suleyman is living in Baki region with his family. He is 23 years old and not married. Four years ago Suleyman decided to open a food store. His father helped him to implement this idea. Now he has a lot of regular customers. A while ago he applied to Komak company for a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). With this loan Suleyman wants to buy more products for selling and to repair a fridge. He offers much thanks to Kiva organization for supporting business development. İn the future he wants to increase his business and to get married.

loans.use: to buy more products for selling and to repair a fridge

loans.name: Ausenda

texts.pt:
Viúva a 17 anos, mãe de 3 filhos 2 maiores e 1 menor ainda a estudar, tem 44 anos de idade, estudou ate 7ª classe, vive na casa própria que construiu sozinha apos ter perdido marido, vive a base de negocio de venda de carne de vaca a mais de 10 anos, sua única fonte de renda e esta a repetir o credito pela 5ª vez na Hluvuku:
Com  o empréstimo pretende comprar cabeças de gado para abater e fornecer aos seus clientes em Moamba e Maputo.
Seu maior sonho é poder comprar uma viatura que facilite o transporte da carne ate aos seus clientes.
Tem como desafio, o facto de neste momento não ter dinheiro com o qual possa comprar a viatura.
texts.en:
Ausenda has been a widow for 17 years. She has three children, two of whom are adults and one is underage and still in school. She's 44 years old. She completed 7th grade and lives in the house that she built on her own after losing her husband. She has earned a living through her meat sales business for over 10 years and it's her only means of livelihood. This is her 5th loan with Hluvuku.
With the loan she intends to purchase cattle for slaughtering and selling to her customers in Moamba and Maputo.
Her biggest dream is to be able to buy a vehicle which makes it easier for her to carry the meat towards her customers.
Her challenge is the fact that she currently doesn't have the money to buy the vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase cattle for slaughtering and selling to her customers in Moamba and Maputo.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 38-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 2 years to 9 years. She describes herself to be visionary and committed. 

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, bananas and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area and her primary customers are loyal customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of sugar, bananas and other items she sells. Her business goal is to yield more returns within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will open another business branch. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stocks of sugar, bananas and other items she sells

loans.name: Lucien Idalia

texts.es: Lucien Idalia, 21 años de edad casada con un bebe de seis meses de edad, originaria de uno de los municipios del norte del departamento de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país zona que se caracteriza por ser productivamente comercial, donde existe la ganadería, agricultura, y la explotación de oro bruto, Lucien se caracteriza por ser una mujer trabajadora, honrada, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, por falta de recursos económicos no logra terminar sus estudios debido a que desde muy joven comienza a trabajar para ayudar con los gastos del hogar, es por lo tanto que ella decide a tener su propio negocio con fondos propios productos de sus ahorros, es que pone una hermosa pulperia en la cual ofrece productos de consumo del hogar como:  sobre de café, sobre de shampoo, sobre de salsa de tomate, arroz, frijoles, jugos, pan, huevos, sal, azúcar, leche, detergentes, pamperes, papel higiénicos, sopas maggi, productos congelados, gaseosas, golosinas entre otros mas, su jornada diaria de trabajo empieza desde muy temprano abriendo las puertas de pulperia ofreciendo sus productos a sus clientes actividad que la desempeña con mucho gusto, sus compras son al contado en mercados y distribuidores de esta localidad, tiene clientes fijos y eventuales. El objetivo este financiamiento es para capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles como: arroz, frijoles, aceite, productos congelados, golosinas, leña, pan, huevos, gaseosas, jugos, entre otros mas,ya que su clientela ha incrementado desde que traslado su negocio a su casa de habitación el cual es por eso que necesita surtir su inventario y de esa manera ofrecerle variedades de productos a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Lucien Idalia is 21 years of age, married, and has a 6-month-old baby. She originally came from a municipality in the north of Chinandega Department, which is located in the west of the country, a zone characterized by its commercial productivity, including cattle raising, agriculture and gold mining. 
Lucien is a hard-working, honorable and responsible woman with a great desire for personal advancement. Due to a lack of economic resources, she failed to complete her studies. When Lucien was very young, she began working to help with household expenses. 

That's why she decided to have her own business, using her own funds, the product of her savings. This is why she established a beautiful grocery store that offers consumer items for the home, such as: coffee, packets of shampoo, tomato sauce, rice, beans, juices, bread, eggs, salt, sugar, milk, detergents, pampers, toilet paper, Maggi soups, frozen products, soft drinks, and candy, among other items.

Her work day begins very early, opening the doors of her grocery store, an activity she enjoys. Her purchases are made from merchants and distributors in this local in cash. She has both fixed and casual customers.

The objective of this financing is to re-stock her business, purchasing home products such as: rice, beans, oil, frozen goods, sweets, firewood, bread, eggs, soft drinks, and juices, among other things. Her customer base has grown since she transferred her business to her home, which is why she needs to re-stock her inventory and, thus, offer a variety of products to her customers.

loans.use: to buy household consumer products, such as rice, beans, detergents, frozen goods, sweets, and milk, among other items.

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is married with four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a timber selling business, selling at the market to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a rental house in the near future. 

With the 50,000 KES loan she wants to purchase timbers in wholesale and sell in retail to earn a living. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase timbers in wholesale and sell in retail to earn a living

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a 54-year-old married woman. She has three children with ages ranging from 15 years to 32 years. She describes herself as an entrepreneur and determined. 

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows and grows crops for sale. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area ideal for the business and her primary customers are hotels and other farmers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital to expand business. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to expand and create employment within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy seeds, fertilizer, and other farm inputs

loans.name: Linet

texts.en:
Linet is a 42-year-old married woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be ambitious and committed. 

She operates a retail business where she sells bananas, oranges, mangoes and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a business-friendly area and her primary customers are loyal customers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate finances. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of fruits. Her business goal is to yield more returns within five years. She hopes that in the future, the business will enable her family buy a house. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stocks of fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more used clothing for her business.

loans.name: Nigongo

texts.en:
Nigongo is a married woman with two children who both attend school. She owns a house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

She operates a kiosk business, selling household consumables of wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar from home to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of stiff competition in her business.  Her dream is to establish a wholesale shop business in the near future. 

With the KES 30,000 loan, she wants to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and rice.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a widowed woman and has been blessed with seven kids who finished school. She lives at her own house that has no electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food. 

She operated a poultry selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She dreams of becoming a  poultry farmer in the future. 

With the KES 40,000 loan, she wants to purchase poultry feed for her chicks. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase poultry feed for her chicks

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more nails, locks, hinges, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more fish for her business.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a 52-year-old, married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as being visionary and focused. 

Eunice operates a farm where she grows cabbages and tea leaves and also keeps dairy cows, which produce milk to sell. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a fertile and productive place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. 

Eunice will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy animal feed and other farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a large-scale farmer within five years.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Nurbubu

texts.ru: Нурбубу, 50 лет, замужем, мать четверых детей. Образование-среднее. Нурбубу на протяжении 14 лет ведет собственное хозяйство, начав свою деятельность с 4,000 сомов (KGS), благодаря ее целеустремленности, трудолюбию и ответственности, Нурбубу смогла увеличить свое хозяйство до 3 дойных коров, 1 лошади и 20 овец. Ежемесячная прибыль ее семьи составляет около 10,000 сомов (KGS). Взрослые дети, проживают отдельно, по хозяйству помогают муж и младший сын. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Нурбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом на покупку овец. Доходы от кредита Нурбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота и сделать ремонт в доме.
texts.en: Nurbubu is 50 years old, married, and has four children. She has a high school education and has had her own farm for 14 years, which she started with 4,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her dedication, hard work, and sense of responsibility, Nurbubu was able to increase her herds to include three dairy cows, one horse and 20 sheep. Her family earns around 10,000 som (KGS) per month. Her grown children live on their own and her husband and her youngest son help her around the farm. In order to continue expanding her business, Nurbubu requested a loan with the bank Bai-Tushum to purchase sheep. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and make repairs to her house.

loans.use: to buy sheep

loans.name: Chirindo

texts.en:
Chirindo is married and blessed with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

Chirindo cooks food for sale at the market and sells to town-dwellers and passersby. She cites price fluctuations as a challenge in the business. She dreams of establishing a café business in the future.

With the KES 50,000 loan, Chirindo wants purchase to food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access financial support to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase food ingredients, such as beans, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Lydia Junieth

texts.es: Lydia Yunieth, mayor de edad madre soltera de tres hermosos niños, los cuales aun están bajo su responsabilidad, originaria del municipio de Chinandega ubicado en el occidente del país, zona que se caracteriza por productivamente comercial,en la vida ha sido muy luchadora, trabajadora, responsable y con muchos deseos de superación personal, para cumplir cada una de sus sueños y metas. por falta de recursos económicos no pudo continuar estudiando el cual solo termina la secundaria, pero hoy en día su sueño es ver formado a sus hijos en todos unos profesionales, Lydia es una microempresaria propietaria y administradora de dos negocios que son la compra venta de cerdos en pie y la venta de sus derivados, al igual que la venta de ropa nueva y cosméticos como: pantalones jeans, faldas, blusas, short, camisas, ropa de cama, ropa de niño jugos de toallas, perfumes, labiales, rubor, sombra de ojos, lápiz delineador, marbelline, sus compras las realiza al contado en mercados de esta localidad y los cerdos en comarcas aledañas a su vivienda, sus ventas son al contado y al crédito recuperando semanal lo invertido,tiene clientes fijos y eventuales, poco a poco ha ido incrementando ambos negocios el cual le dejan buenos ingresos para ella y su familia, hoy en día esta solicitando nuevamente financiamiento para invertir en la compra de un lote de cerdos en pie y surtir un poco su mercadería. Lydia agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lydia Yunieth is an adult single mother of three beautiful children who are still in her care. She is from the municipality of Chinandega, which is located in the west of the country, characterized as a commercial area. Throughout her life she has been very determined, hardworking, and responsible, with a desire for self-improvement to achieve all of her dreams and goals. Due to a lack of economic resources she could not continue studying and was only able to finish high school, but now her dream is to see all of her children become professionals. 

Lydia is a micro-entrepreneur, and owns and operates two businesses which are buying and selling live pigs and pork products, and selling new clothes and cosmetics such as: jeans, skirts, blouses, shorts, shirts, bedding, baby clothes, towels, perfumes, lipsticks, blush, eye shadow, eyeliner, and more. She purchases these products in the town markets, and the pigs in the surrounding counties, paying for them up front. She sells and collects payment up front or on credit, collecting weekly payments. She has regular and occasional customers. She has been gradually growing both businesses, which will provide good income for her and her family. 

She is currently requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a batch of pigs and to increase her merchandise a bit. Lydia thanks the Kiva lenders for the help they provide to people with scarce resources in poor countries like Nicaragua in order for them to have a decent means of working.

loans.use: to invest in working capital by purchasing a batch of pigs and to increase her general merchandise

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 32-year-old, married man. He has two children. He describes himself as being sincere and visionary. 

John operates a retail business where he sells shoes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a busy and productive area and his primary customers are of all types. 

John will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of shoes. His business goal is to expand within five years. 

This is John's third loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM). His previous loans were successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of shoes.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a 73-year-old married man. He has 10 children. He describes himself to be forward-thinking and productive. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows and also grows cabbages to sell. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. His business is located in a productive and promising place. He describes his biggest business challenge to be price fluctuations. He will use the Kes 15000 loan to buy animal feed and farm inputs. His business goal is to be a successful farmer within 5 years.

loans.use: buy animal feed and farm inputs.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.en:
Raphael is a 53-year-old married man. He has six children with ages ranging from 5 years to 19 years. He describes himself to be energetic, visionary and optimistic. 

He operates a retail business where he sells milk, cakes, etc. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. 

Raphael will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more milk and cakes to sell. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, the business will grow and yield benefits. This is his first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more milk  and cakes to sell

loans.name: Akonkwa/panzi Group

texts.fr: Madame Vumiliya  est présidente de l’association d’affaire  Akonkwa/Panzi. A 35 ans, elle est mariée à un chômeur  et ensemble ils ont 6 enfants scolarisés. Elle est vendeuse de la viande de bœuf au marché central depuis 1993 grâce à ses parents. Elle sollicite un nouveau prêt qui servira à acheter 15kgs de viande. Son objectif est de subvenir au besoin de sa famille et de lui construire une très belle et grande maison.  Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima de la soutenir.
texts.en:
Vumiliya is president of the Akonkwa/Panzi business association. At 35, she is married to a husband who is unemployed, and together they have six children who are in school.

She has been selling beef at the central market since 1993 thanks to her parents. She is requesting a new loan that she will use to buy 15 kg of meat. Her objectives are to meet the needs of her family and to build them a big and beautiful house. She thanks Hekima for their support.

loans.use: to purchase 15 kg. of meat

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 32-year-old married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be creative. 

She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a viable place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Pamela will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM. She also does farming to earn extra income.

loans.use: buy fabric, thread, and other tailoring materials

loans.name: Tuhimizane Group

texts.fr: Madame Kasinamutu, présidente dans le groupe de credit Tuhimizane est mère de 5 enfants scolarisés.  Agée de  50 ans, elle est mariée à un homme sans profession. Elle exerce l’activité de  commerce depuis 2006 au marché  central. Le credit demandé va  acheter les produits pharmaceutiques (10 boites de novalgines, 20 boites d’ampicillines, etc..). Elle souhaite prospérer dans ses affaires et devenir grossiste. Ainsi, elle bénie Hekima et le remercie.
texts.en:
Kasinamutu is the president of the credit association, Tuhimizane Group. She is the mother of five children who all attend school. At 50 years of age, she is married to a man without a profession.

Kasinamutu has been running her business at the central market since 2006. She plans to use her loan to purchase pharmaceuticals (10 boxes of Novalgine [painkiller], 20 boxes of Ampicillin [antibiotic], etc.). She hopes to prosper in her business and to become a wholesaler. Kasinamutu sends her blessings and her thanks to Hekima.

loans.use: to purchase pharmaceuticals (10 boxes of Novalgine [painkiller], 20 boxes of Ampicillin [antibiotic], etc.).

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en: Mwanakombo thanks Yehu and Kiva for supporting  her business. She now asks for your help again. She is requesting a loan of Kshs 20,000 to buy feed and drugs for the chicks in order to continue with her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and drugs for the chicks.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase ice and soft drinks for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more chicken by the carton for her business.

loans.name: Akonkwa/bagira Group

texts.fr: La cliente Baderha est membre de l’association d’affaire Akonkwa/Bagira. Femme  entrepreneur, elle est âgée de 40 ans et mère de 7 enfants qui étudient. Son conjoint est un enseignant dans un établissement de la place. La cliente est une vendeuse de divers produits alimentaires dans la rue depuis 1992. Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter quelques kilos de tomates, de sel, de sucre et d’arachide pour renforcer son activité. Son objectif principal est la croissance  de son entreprise. Au final, elle remercie Hekima.
texts.en:
The client Baderha is a member of the Akonkwa/Bagira business association. A woman and entrepreneur, she is 40 years old and the mother of seven children who attend school. Her spouse is a teacher in a local institution. 

The client has been selling various food products on the street since 1992. This new loan will enable her to buy several kilos of tomatoes, salt, sugar and peanuts to strengthen her business. Her main objective is the growth of her business. Finally, she sends her thanks to Hekima.

loans.use: to buy several kilos of tomatoes, salt, sugar and peanuts

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La clienta de 27 años de edad vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida, ella se dedica  a la agricultura su principal siembra es el maíz, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la clienta quiere mejorar su vivienda cambiando el techo de la misma y construyendo un pared, pero con lo que obtiene de sus ventas no le alcanza para poder realizarlo , por esa razón solicita un crédito para poder comprar los materiales necesarios como: arena, cemento , ladrillos, hierro, laminas y pago de mano de obra y así ella y su esposo puedan vivir cómodos y seguros.
texts.en:
The client, at 27 years of age, lives in her own house with her life companion. She is dedicated to agriculture, her main crop is corn. She sells her products in the different markets that are found near her house. With what she obtains from her sales she is able to take care of some of her home expenses. 

The client wants to improve her home by changing the roof and building a wall, but she cannot afford to do so with what she makes from her sales, and so she is requesting a loan in order to be able to purchase the necessary materials such as: sand, cement, bricks, iron, overlay and the workers' payment. This way she and her husband can live comfortably and safely.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, bricks, iron, overlay and payment for the workers.

loans.name: Mwanaharusi

texts.en:
Mwanaharusi is a 61-year-old married woman. She has four children with ages ranging from 21 to 30 years. She describes herself to be focused and God fearing. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be customers not buying all the food cooked in a day. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing the food she cooks. Her business goal is to have a permanent place for doing business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ingredients to prepare the food she cooks.

loans.name: Rehema

texts.en:
Rehema, aged 47 years, is married and lives at a rental house that has electricity but not piped water. 

For over two years, Rehema has operated a poultry business selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. In addition, she also operates a farming business which earns her another source of income. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to buy medication for the chicks and additional chicks for her business.  She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to buy medication for the chicks and additional chicks for her business.

loans.name: Karina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Karina de 23 años de edad, es bachiller, esta acompañada, su pareja trabaja (empleado) como técnico instalador; tiene un niño de 2 ½ años que vive con ella. 

Karina trabaja con ganado de repasto duarante dos años se ha dedicado a este negocio, lo aprendió de su padre y decidió trabajar con ganado para tener ingresos económicos extras, su pareja es empleado, la distancia de donde realiza su trabajo de agricultura esta como a 3 km de su casa y viaja a pie o en carreta con bueyes, le ayuda su padre y el compañero de vida los fines de semana. Su horario es variado. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar ganado de repasto y alquilar el terreno para cultivar maíz y maicillo; el préstamo le mejorara porque puede tener ganado y a la vez tener granos básicos para la alimentación de su familia. La satisfacción es tener ganado y terreno para trabajar. Sus sueños son que su hijo crezca y que estudie y tener mas ganado. Las ganancias las utiliza para pagar su préstamo y así poder salir muy bien para que Credicampo le siga prestando.
texts.en:
Karina is 23 years old. She has a high school eduaction and lives with her partner, who is employed as an installation technician. She has a two-and-a-half-year-old little boy that lives with her. 

Karina has been working with beef cattle for two years. She learned the business from her father and decided to work with cattle in order to supplement her household income. She lives about three kilometers from where she works and travels on foot or by oxcart. Her father helps her as well as her life partner on the weekends when he is not at his job. Her schedule varies. 

The loan she is requesting is to purchase beef cattle and rent land to grow corn and sorghum. The loan will benefit her because she will be able to have cattle and also grow basic grains to feed her family. She will be proud to have both cattle and land to work on. Her dreams are for her son to grow up and get an education, and to have more cattle. She will use the profit to pay off this loan so that everything works out and she can continue borrowing from Credicampo.

loans.use: to buy beef cattle and pay rent on the land she will farm.

loans.name: Widjai

texts.en:
Widjai is 28 years old and lives with his parents, wife, and child. Formerly, he lived in Paramaribo for his studies. After his studies in 2012, he came back to Nickerie but could not find a job to his level. This lead him to take over the business of his father. 

It's been two years since he got engaged in planting rice and Widjai wants to expand his rice plots. For this, he needs a loan of SRD 10,000 for the purchase of fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and pesticides.

loans.name: Dúo Las Margaritas De Peronia Group

texts.es: DUO LAS MARGARITAS DE PERONIA este dúo esta integrado por la señora Gilda Karina de 34 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace varios años, le da gracias a Dios por haberle dado la oportunidad de tener esta negocio, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de cosmeticos para la venta esperando que le puedan ayudar ya que el sueño de ella es crecer aun mas en su negocio.
texts.en: Gilda Karina is one of the two members that make up Duo las Margaritas de Peronia. She is 34 years old and has been working selling cosmetics for several years. She is thankful to God for having given her the opportunity of running her business. This time she is requesting a loan to purchase cosmetics to sell. She hopes she can get the help she needs because her dream is for her business to keep growing.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is a 39-year-old married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells water. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more water storage containers. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more water storage containers.

loans.name: Pamela

texts.en:
Pamela is a 30-year-old woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be responsible. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inflation of prices. 

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing the food she sells. Her business goal is to have a hotel (restaurant) within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM. Previous loan of KES 20,000 was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy stocks of ingredients for preparing the food she sells.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en:
Rosemary is a 29-year-old, married woman. She has two children, ages three years and five years old. She describes herself as being persistent. 

Rosemary operates a retail business where she sells hair products. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are good. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. 

Rosemary will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of hair products. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will improve her standard of living. This is her first loan with SMEP Deposit Taking Microfinance Limited (SMEP DTM).

loans.use: to buy more stocks of hair products.

loans.name: Vanessa Elizabeth

texts.es:
Vanessa de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta 9º grado, esta acompañada; su compañero de vida trabaja de albañil, no tiene hijos y viven solamente los dos en el hogar. Vanessa se dedica a la agricultura junto a su mamá, ella tiene solamente dos años de dedicarse a la agricultura y lo hizo aprendiendo de su mamá; además su compañero de vida es albañil y por lo tanto tiene ese ingreso económico adicional, no ha tenido otro negocio, la distancia que hay desde la vivienda al lugar de trabajo es de 6 cuadras y viaja a pie; se involucra su compañero de vida y un sobrino. Su horario es variado puede ser de 6:00 am a 11:00 am. 

El  préstamo lo utilizara para alquilar un terreno y trabajar la agricultura, le mejorara la calidad de vida, ya que tendrá granos básicos para su familia y para poder comercializarlo. La necesidad satisfecha es de  poder seguir trabajando la agricultura. Sus sueños son seguir trabajando y poder tener hijos para tener más motivos para trabajar, el préstamo le ayudara porque tendrá terreno para trabajar. Las ganancias las utiliza para pagar el préstamo para que Credicampo siga confiando en ella.
texts.en:
Vanessa is 22 years old. She has a 9th grade education and lives with her partner, who works in construction. She doesn't have any children, so only the two of them live in the home. 

Vanessa works in agriculture alongside her mother. She has only been farming for two years, but she learned from her mother. Her work allows her to supplement her partner's income from his construction work. She has never had another business. She lives six blocks from where she works and travels there by foot. Her life partner and a nephew are also involved in her business. Her schedule varies, but it can be from 6:00 am to 11:00 am. 

She will use this loan to rent a plot of land to farm. This will improve her quality of life because she will be able to grow basic grains for her family and to sell. This will meet her need to keep farming. Her dreams are to keep on working and have children, which would give her even more reason to work. She will use the profit she makes to pay off this loan so that Credicampo continues to have trust in her.

loans.use: to pay for rent on the land she will farm.

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is a 35-year-old single woman. She has two children with ages 14 and 17 years. She describes herself to be honest and focused. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a residential area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low sales. 

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to pay school fees for her children. Her business goal is to have a permanent place for doing business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to pay school fees for her children.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cartons of soap for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, soap, and cooking oil to expand her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasoning, to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María de los  Ángeles de 44 años de edad, soltera, con cuatro hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera, y se vieron obligados a trabajar desde temprana edad. En la actualidad lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias  a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas 12 horas diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito e  invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. María de los Ángeles agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
María de los  Ángeles is 44 years old and single. She has four children that depend on her. She is from El Sauce, which is located in the northern area of the region. She is known for being hardworking, responsible, and driven to improve herself. Unfortunately, she wasn't able to get a higher education because she lacked enough financial resources and had to start working at a young age. Currently, she works hard every day in order to give her children a better future.

Her effort and drive enabled her to start her own business, a small grocery store selling retail amounts of basic groceries like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice, and soft drinks. She dedicates about twelve hours a day to her business, offering her products to customers. The purpose of this loan is to invest in working capital and stock up on groceries for her business, so that she can earn higher income in a not-too-distant future. 

María de los Ángeles is grateful for the help Kiva lenders offer people with limited financial resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to stock up on groceries for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farming supplies for her coffee plantation.

loans.name: Jose Noe

texts.es:
José, tiene una familia que está integrada por su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos, en edades de 3 años de edad y un bebe de 6 meses, su actividad económica es ofrecer el servicio de peluquería desde hace 10 años, lo emprendió por cuenta propia, en sus inicios lo instalo en su casa, en busca de mejores ingresos se traslado a la zona urbana de su municipio y es ahí en donde actualmente se encuentra ubicado.
Invertirá en la compra de una máquina para cortar pelo, gel para el cabello, talco, una silla, entre otros materiales que le ayuden a mejorar el servicio y tener nuevos ingresos, los que utilizara para cancelar las cuotas puntualmente y cubrir sus gastos familiares.
Su sueño es contar con los recursos económicos suficientes para comprar un lote y construir su casa.
texts.en:
José has a family, which includes his life partner and their two children, a three-year-old and a six-month-old baby. He has been working as a barber for ten years. He started his business on his own. At first he set it up at home, and eventually moved it to a more urban area of town looking for better income. That is where it is currently located.

He will invest in purchasing hair clippers, hair gel, talcum powder, a chair, and other materials that will help him improve his service and make new income, which he will use to make each repayment on time and to cover his family's expenses.

His dream is to have enough financial resources to buy a lot and build a house.

loans.use: to buy hair clippers, hair gel, talcum powder, a chair, and other items.

loans.name: Esmeralda Yaneth

texts.es:
Esmeralda, solicita un nuevo crédito con el que comprara abono, herbicida, plaguicida, pagara mozos, gasolina para la achicadora, prepara a tiempo el terreno para la próxima siembra de maíz.
El capital que se le facilito anteriormente le dio los recursos económicos con los compro de manera inmediata todo lo necesario para la siembra de maíz y pipían, con las ganancias pago la deuda, mejoro el estilo de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Esmeralda is requesting a new loan, which she will use to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide, and pay for labor and gasoline for the drain pump. All of this will allow her to prepare her land for planting corn this new season.

The capital she borrowed last time gave her the financial resources to immediately purchase everything she needed to plant her corn and squash. She used the profit to pay off the debt and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, herbicide, and pesticide, and pay for labor and gasoline.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy spare parts for his mototaxi and fish to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase for her business more rice, pepper, fish, Maggi cubes, dried bush meat, etc.

loans.name: Weder Emigdio

texts.es:
Weder, está soltero, vive con su mamá y sus hermanos, fue empleado de una venta de comida rápida, ahí aprendió a elaborar diferentes platillos, ya tiene su propio negocio de venta de comida ubicado en el mercado municipal la cual es una ventaja y reconoce la delincuencia de la zona como una desventaja.
Con el capital comprara verduras, pollo, carnes, pecado, bebidas, aceite, arroz, frijol, gas propano, condimentos, platos, cubiertos, etc., para mantener el buen servicio hacia sus clientes, mejorar la variedad de las comidas que prepara, aumentar su clientela y sus ganancias.
Su sueño tener un negocio reconocido por la calidad de su servicio y aportar para que su familia tenga una vida más confortable.
texts.en:
Weder is single, he lives with his mother and his siblings. He was employed at a fast food stand where he learned to make different plates. He already has his own business selling food located in the municipal market which is a benefit. He recognizes the crime in the area as a disadvantage. 

With the capital he will purchase vegetables, chicken, meat, fish, beverages, rice, beans, propane gas, condiments, plates and utensils in order to maintain the good service for his customers, improve the variety of foods that he will prepare, increase his clientele and his income. 

His dream is to have a business recognized for the quality of its service and to contribute so that his family can have a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables, chicken, meat, fish, beverages, oil, rice, beans, propane gas, condiments, plates, utensils, etc.

loans.name: Rosa Edelmira

texts.es:
Rosa, afirma que con la ayuda del crédito anterior tuvo a tiempo los pedidos de la mercadería que necesitaba para tener a sus clientes satisfechos, las ventas y ganancias aumentaron, las circunstancias familiares han mejorado.
Por la facilidad de pago que tiene a través de los créditos Kiva, nuevamente se ha disidido por más capital, con el que comprara lociones, cremas, labiales, esmaltes, polvos, desodorantes, etc., tendrá debidamente surtido el negocio.
texts.en: Rosa affirms that with the last loan she was able to fill her customer's orders and keep them happy. Her sales and profits increased and her family's circumstances have improved. Because of the ease of paying the loans from Kiva Rosa has decided once again to obtain more capital to buy lotion, cream, lip-stick, nail polish, deodorants, etc. to properly stock her business.

loans.use: to buy lotion, cream, lipstick, nail polish, deodorants, etc.

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en:
Meet 67-year-old Rosaline from Goderich area Freetown. She is married with five children.  Her children are currently attending school. One year ago, Rosaline established her cookery business. She began her business because she wants to contribute in taking care of their home. She works at the business from 8:00 A.M. until 7:00 P.M. seven days per week.  She says that the main challenge to her business is a transportation problem within her operation area.

Rosaline requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasons to expand her cookery business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, Rosaline plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, rice, and cooking seasons to expand her cookery business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer among other things to treat her coffee crop.

loans.name: Hannah

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Hannah from Goderich, in the western area of Freetown. She is married with three children.  For the past five years, Hannah established her general stock business. She began her business because she wants to develop her standard of living. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 6:00 pm, 6 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is price inflation.

Hannah requires a loan in order to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits to expand her business. 

She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Hannah plans to expand her business more than ever. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cigarettes, assorted drinks, and biscuits to expand her business.

loans.name: Masina

texts.en: Masina is a 37-year-old woman, who is married with three children. She runs an Elei printing business in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Masina has requested a loan to buy fabric materials, fabric paint, brushes, and design stencils for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric materials, fabric paint, brushes, and design stencils for her business.

loans.name: Luaipou

texts.en: Luaipou is a 20-year-old single lady. She prints and sells Elei materials to the public and within her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Luaipou has requested a loan to buy fabric materials, fabric paint, design stencils, and brushes for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric materials, fabric paint, design stencils, and brushes for her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more underclothes for her business.

loans.name: Zhypar

texts.ru: Жыпар 59 лет, вдова, есть 2 детей. У Жыпар - высшее образование, она работает учительницей младших классов. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Жыпар занимается животноводством, в этой сфере деятельности она приобрела большой опыт, стартовав больше 40 лет назад с покупки скота на 5,000 сомов (KGS). Трудолюбие и целеустремленность Жыпар позволили увеличить хозяйство до 1 коровы, 2 телят и 15 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет в среднем 12,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Жыпар обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку коров для дальнейшей реализации молока и молочной продукции. Доходы от кредита Жыпар планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на строительство нового помещения для скота. Одной из целей Жыпар на будущее является ремонт ее дома.
texts.en: Zhypar is 59 years old, a widow, and has two children. Zhypar has a higher education. She works as an elementary school teacher. As the main source of income for her family, Zhypar practices livestock breeding. She has a lot of experience in this field of business. She started this business over 40 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Zhypar's hard work and diligence, she was able to increase her farm to include 1 cow, 2 calves, and 15 sheep. Her monthly income is on average 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Zhypar turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows for the future sale of milk and dairy products. Zhypar plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She is also determined to save money to build a new barn for her cattle. One of Zhypar's goals for the future is to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Mariama

texts.en:
Meet 37-year-old Mariama from the Goderich area of Freetown. She is married with six children; two of her children are currently attending school. 

Three years ago, Mariama established her cookery business. She began her business because she wants to contribute in taking take of the home. She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is the increase in the price of commodities.

Mariama requires a loan in order to purchasing more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business. 

She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Mariama plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchasing more cooking oil, rice and cooking seasoning to expand her cookery business

loans.name: Yeabu

texts.en:
Meet 24-year-old Yeabu from Goderich, in the western urban area in Freetown. She is married with four children.  

Four years ago, Yeabu established her fish business. She began her business because she wanted to improve her standard of living. She works at the business 8 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that her major problem to her business is sometime there is a shortage of fish.

Yeabu requires a loan in order to purchase more fish and cooking seasoning to sell. 

She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to buy a piece of land and increase her business. 

In the future, Yeabu plans to open a fish factory. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchasing more fish and cooking seasoning to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more clothes and shoes for her business.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Meet 30-year-old Edna from the Goderich area in Freetown. She is married with four children; they are currently attending school. 

Four years ago, Edna established her (Acheke) local food business. She began her business because she wants to generate income to educate her children. She works at the business 10 hours per day, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is a transportation problem within her operation area.

Edna requires a loan in order to purchase more cooking oil, cassava, and cooking seasoning to expand her food business. 

She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. 

In the future, Edna plans to expand her business to a higher level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more cooking oil, cassava, and cooking seasoning to expand her food business.

loans.name: Muaaroimoana

texts.en: Muaaroimoana is a 21-year-old, single lady. She runs a small business selling ice blocks and pancakes in her community, and has been doing this for two years. Muaauroimoana has requested a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, sugar, plastic cups, cordial, mango skins, vanilla, baking powder, cooking oil and plastic bags for her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital.  Muaauroimoana will use her earnings to support her family.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, plastic cups, cordial, mango skins, vanilla, baking powder, cooking oil, and plastic bags for her business.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 48 лет, не замужем, воспитывает дочь. У Венеры среднее образование, с 1996 года Венера стала заниматься сельским хозяйством, в качестве стартового капитала у нее было  всего 15,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня в хозяйстве у Венеры есть дойная корова и бычок, а также земельный надел размером 2,44 ГА, где она ежегодно выращивает картофель, сеет зерновые культуры.  Ежемесячный доход составляет свыше 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку коровы. А остальную часть заемных средств планирует потратить на полеводство, а именно закупить высококачественные семена и минеральные удобрения. Данные мероприятия позволят увеличить доход  и дадут возможность накопить сбережения на образование дочери.
texts.en: Venera is 48 years old, unmarried and is raising a daughter. Venera has a secondary education. In 1996, Venera began practicing agriculture with initial start-up capital in the amount of 15,000 som (KGS). Currently, Venera has a milk cow and a bull calf on her farm, as well as a 2.44 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows potatoes and sows grains. Her monthly income is more than 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her farm, Venera turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai-Tushum." She requested a loan to buy cows. With the remainder of the loan, she plans to spend it on crop farming, specifically to buy high quality seeds and mineral fertilizers. These actions will allow her to increase her income and will afford her the opportunity to save money for her daughter's education.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Maria Rasela

texts.en: Malia is a 49-year-old woman, who is married with four children. She runs a flea market business where she sells dresses and shirts, which she sews from home. She has many years of experience with this business. Malia has requested a loan to buy an overlock sewing machine, threads, needles, and scissors for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric, an overlock sewing machine, threads, needles, and scissors for her business.

loans.name: Mate

texts.en: Mate is a 23-year-old woman who is single. She runs an Elei printing business in her community. She has three years of experience with this business. Mate has requested a loan to buy fabric materials, fabric paint, rubber designs, stencils, and brushes for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric materials, fabric paint, rubber designs, stencils, and brushes for her business.

loans.name: Saili

texts.en: Saili is a 33-year-old, married woman with five children. With the assistance of her husband, they operate a lawn mowing business; they have been doing this for quite a while. She is requesting a loan to buy a new lawn mower, petrol, two-stroke oil, and lawn mowing string for her lawn mowing business. Saili joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a lawn mower, petrol, two-stroke oil, and lawn mowing string for her business.

loans.name: Macadamia Group

texts.en:
The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Macadamia” located in Quetzaltenango, Guatemala and is composed of eight ladies who have an excellent track record of making their payments on time! They have decided to apply for another loan with Friendship Bridge and are hopeful that Kiva investors will fund the loans. 

Olga is a 38-year-old married mother of four children and works hard to meet their needs. At a young age she learned about tailoring and has perfected her skills throughout the years. She mainly sews blouses. This is the second loan cycle for this industrious woman. Olga plans to use the funds to purchase materials for her business including all kinds of thread, yarn and fabric. She wants to be able to complete all her current orders and increase her business. In order to meet the demand of her customers, Olga works along with four of her family members in the business. Additionally, she employs three other ladies from the community. This hard-working group is able to produce 120 blouses each week! The benefit of the loans has had a huge impact on Olga and her family as her children is able to attend school. She wants to see them graduate from high school and attend college. Her husband shares this dream as well. The couple wants to make improvements on their home as well. 

All of the women of the Trust Bank enjoy the educational trainings given at their monthly meetings by a Friendship Bridge Loan Officer. They look forward to learning new information in this new loan cycle. Some of the topics covered include nutrition, health and personal hygiene, effective business practices (accounting, budgeting, money management, sales) as well as self-esteem. Olga especially enjoyed the training about women’s identity and leadership.

The entire “Macadamia” Trust Bank extends greetings and appreciation to KIVA investors. Armed with the loans and education, they are able to create a better and more prosperous future for themselves, their families and their community. Thank you KIVA investors!

loans.use: to purchase all kinds of thread, yarn, and fabric.

loans.name: Leilani

texts.en:
Leilani is 29 years old and married with 4 children. She runs a small canteen business selling bongos and sodas, and also lei printed lavalava (traditional Polynesian cloth) in her community. She has been doing this for 1 year. 

Leilani has requested a loan to purchase 1 large cooler, crates of canned soft drinks, ice, snacks, fabric paint, designed rubber, and rolls for her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Leilani will help provide her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy one large cooler, crates of canned soft drinks, ice, snacks, fabric paint, designed rubber, and rolls.

loans.name: Joan

texts.en:
Joan is a 25-year-old woman with 3 children. She runs a sewing business in her community. She has 1 year experience with this business. 

Joan has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, fabric materials, locks, scissors, and oil for her sewing business. She plans to use her profits to support her family. 

Joan joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, fabric materials, locks, scissors, and oil.

loans.name: Ofa

texts.en: Ofa is 42 years old and married with eight children. She wants to start a small business selling ice pops in her community and also set up a pool table business. To do this, she needs a loan to buy ingredients for her ice pop business such as sugar, plastic cups, cordial, mango skins and a pool table. In the future, Ofa hopes to provide more business to the community. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a pool table, sugar, plastic cups, cordial, and mango skins.

loans.name: Faauliuli

texts.en: Faauliuli is a 20-year-old woman, with one child. She wants to start a small business making and selling pancakes in her community. To do this, she needs a loan to buy ingredients such as flour, baking powder, sugar, cooking oil, a wok, pots, utensils for cooking, and a cooking stove. In the future, Faauliuli hopes to expand her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as flour, baking powder, sugar, cooking oil, a wok, pots, utensils for cooking, and a cooking stove.

loans.name: Bellarina

texts.en:
Bellarina is a 21-year-old woman. She makes and sells printing lavalava (traditional Polynesian cloth) and sells ice pops to earn a living and has been doing this for 3 years. 

Bellarina has requested a loan to buy cordial, sugar, plastic bags, mango skins, fabric, fabric paints, designed rubber, and roll brushes for her business. She plans to use her profits to support her little family. 

She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy cordial, sugar, plastic bags, mango skins, fabric, fabric paints, designed rubber, and roll brushes.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a 28-year-old woman who is married with 2 children. She operates a bus transportation business has been doing this for 5 years. Gloria needs a loan to buy new tires, oil, and pay for her taxi registration. She will use her profits to support her family. 

Gloria joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy new tires, oil, and taxi registration.

loans.name: Armida Del Carmen

texts.es:
Armida de 32 años de edad,  estudio hasta 9º grado, es madre soltera; solamente tiene un hijo de 8 años que estudia en el centro escolar. Nadie mas vive con ella. 

Ella trabaja con ganado de repasto y lo hace desde hace tres años, lo aprendió de su papá y con impulso de una prima decidió dedicarse a este negocio; además tiene una pequeña tienda. Antes solo tenia la tienda en su casa y el ganado se mantiene en el potrero y esta como a 2 km de su casa y viaja a pie, le ayuda su hermano. Su horario es variado a las 6:00 am va a dejar al ganado y a las 4:00 pm va a traer el ganado del potrero y el resto del día se lo dedica a su hijo y a la tienda. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una yunta de terneros (ganado de repasto) y esto le mejorara su negocio ya que tendrá mas ganado y en cuanto a su vida tendrá una mejor calidad. La necesidad satisfecha es de comprar de una vez y con el préstamo se puede hacer. 

Sus sueños son ampliar mas la tienda y tener mas ganado y así poder darle un mejor fututo a su hijo, el préstamo le ayudara mucho ya que puede comprar de una vez; las ganancias de sus negocios las utiliza para el sostén de su hijo y además para ir pagando su crédito, desea ampliar mas su negocio y dice que esto lo lograra con su buena administración y con los préstamos de Credicampo y espera poder pagar muy bien para que se le siga prestando.
texts.en:
Armida is 32 years old and studied up to Grade 9. She is single mother of a 8 year old son who studies at school. No one else lives with her. She has been raising cattle for 3 years, something her father taught her and with the persuasion of a cousin she decide on this as a business. She also has a small store. Before that she only had the store. The land where the cattle graze is 2 km from her house and she walks there. She has the help of her brother. Her timetable is not fixed but at 6 am she takes the cattle out and at 4 pm she brings them back to the pasture. The rest of the time she takes care of her child and the store.

The loan Armida is requesting is to buy a pair of calves which will improve her business as she will have more cattle and so she can have a better life. The best way is to pay for them at once and the loan will allow her to do this.

Her dreams are to expand her store and have more cattle. Then she can provide a better future for her child. The loan will help her as she can buy the calves right away. She will use the profits from her businesses to support her child and pay off the loan. She wants to expand her business with good administration and the loans from CrediCampo. She hopes to pay off the loan well so she can continue to get loans.

loans.use: to buy a pair of calves.

loans.name: Elvira

texts.ru: Эльвире 33 года. Совместно с супругом воспитывают двоих детей. В 2008 году, Эльвира начала бизнес в торговле продуктами питания в арендованном магазине, используя в качестве стартового капитала сумму в 50,000 сомов (KGS). Сумев развить свой бизнес и обретя постоянных клиентов, Эльвира имеет среднемесячный доход до 80,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего увеличения и расширения своего бизнеса, Эльвира обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом для оптовой покупки продовольственных товаров для последующей розничной торговли. Доходы от кредита Эльвира планирует вложить в увеличение товарооборота и накопить деньги на ремонт квартиры и покупку легкового автомобиля.
texts.en: Elvira is 33 years old. Together with her husband, she is raising two children. In 2008, Elvira began her own business of selling food products in a rented shop.  She began this business with initial start-up capital in the amount of 50,000 som (KGS). Having been able to develop her business and attract loyal customers, Elvira has an average monthly income of 80,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further increasing and expanding her business, Elvira turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy groceries wholesale for future retail sale. Elvira plans to use the earnings from the loan to increase her sales turnover. She also intends to save money to repair her apartment and buy a car.

loans.use: to buy groceries wholesale for future retail sale.

loans.name: Maria Romilia

texts.es:
María, vive en una casa familiar con sus dos hijos de 20 y años de edad, también su madre de 65 años de edad, se dedica a la venta de comida, tortillas, tostadas, turrones, yuca frita y otros antojitos, su negocio está ubicado en el mercado municipal de su ciudad. Trabaja todos los días.
El crédito lo utilizara para comprar aceite, verduras, condimentos, carnes, embutidos, pollo, maíz, bolsas, bebidas, depósitos desechables, etc., dicha compra le ayudara  a fortalecer el negocio con la materia prima para elaborar la venta , espera atraer nuevos clientes y estabilizar su economía.
Su sueño es mantenerse trabajando para tener recursos económicos con los cuales ayudar a sus hijos a terminar una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Maria lives in her family home with her two sons in their twenties and her mother of 65 years of age. She is dedicated to the sale of food, tortillas, tostadas, nougat candies, fried yucca and other snacks. Her business is located in her city's municipal market and she works everyday. 

She will use this loan to purchase oil, vegetables, condiments, meat, cold cuts, chicken, corn, bags, beverages, and disposable tanks. She says that this purchase will help her to strengthen her business with the raw materials to develop her business. 

She hopes to attract new clients and stabilize her economic state. Her dream is to support herself working in order to have economic resources with which she can help her children finish a university degree.

loans.use: to purchase oil, vegetables, condiments, meat, cold cuts, chicken, corn, bags, beverages, disposable tanks, etc.

loans.name: Maria Ester

texts.es: María tiene 34 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos de 16 años y 7 años de edad. María tiene una pequeña tienda en donde vende variedad de productos de primera necesidad. Además, también se dedica a la venta de tortas las cuales son muy demandadas por sus clientes. María ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la construcción de un pequeño cuarto para su hijo de 16 años para lo cual necesita material como: madera, clavos, cemento, arena y grava. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento y así poder proceder a la construcción del cuarto para dar mayor comodidad a sus hijos.
texts.en:
María is 34 years old and lives in her own house with her life partner and their two children ages 16 and 7. María has a small shop where she sells a variety of basic necessity products. As well, she sells cakes which are in high demand by her clients. 

María has made the decision of requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in the construction of a small room for her 16-year-old son and she needs materials such as wood, nails, cement, sand and gravel. She hopes to have this financing and proceed with the construction of the room to provide her sons with better comfort.

loans.use: to purchase wood, nails, cement, sand and gravel to build a bedroom.

loans.name: José Gabriel

texts.es:
José de 58 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado, se casó a la edad de los 25 años, a procreo cinco  hijos con su pareja, quien se dedica a los quehaceres de la casa.

É es agricultor,  tiene más de 20 años de trabajar la tierra, su padre fue quien le enseño el respeto a los de más y que solo trabajando duro se puede salir adelante, por el tipo de actividad en la zona no le queda más que dedicarse a la agricultura, también se encarga de la administración del proyecto de agua potable de la comunidad, la distancia que recorre es un aproximado de 500 metros diarios, el recorrido lo hace a pie, sus hijos le apoyan cuando es la época de siembra, el horario de trabajo es de 6 am a 12 md.
    

El préstamo será invertido en la construcción de una habitación a su casa, por hoy es de lámina.  Dice sentir pena  cuando lo visitan a su casa los familiares, y no tener un espacio donde poderse quedar cómodamente. El crédito utilizara en la compra de materiales de construcción, cemento, hierro lamina etc. La necesidad satisfecha será el  poder construir una parte más a la casa.

Preparar bien su casa, es su sueño para que en un futuro tener mejor valor de adquisición, para sus hijos espera dejarles una herencia digna donde al vender pueda cada quien obtener una buena parte, ya que con la construcción tendrá un mejor valor la propiedad.
texts.en:
José, 58, studied until second grade. He married at the age of 25 and had 5 children with his partner who is a homemaker. He is a farmer. He has been working the land for over 20 years. His father was the one who taught him to respect others and that you can only get ahead by working hard. The only type of work in the area is farming. He is also responsible for administration of a potable water project in the community. He travels approximately 500 meters daily which he walks. His children help him when it’s harvest time. He works from 6 am to 12 noon.

The loan will be invested in the construction of a room in his house, for now its made of sheet metal.  He says he feels embarrassed when his relatives come to visit him at his house and he doesn't have space to accommodate them. He will use the loan to purchase building materials; cement, iron, sheet metal etc... The unmet need will be able to build another part of the house.

His dream is to prepare his house well so that in the future he can have a better purchase price so that he can leave his children a decent inheritance. When they sell it each one can obtain a good amount since with the construction it will have better property value.

loans.use: to purchase cement, iron, sheet metal etc... to build a room in his house.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гульзат 27 лет, замужем, двое детей дошкольного возраста. Гульзат имеет средне-специальное образование, она заканчивала техникум по легкой промышленности. Гульзат по характеру: пунктуальная, темпераментная, аккуратная и трудолюбивая. Супруг помогает по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается животноводством, начав этот бизнес с 5,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Гульзат, в хозяйстве имеется: 2 дойная корова, 2 лошади и 55 овец, а также есть земельный надел размером 2,80 ГА. Ее деятельность приносит в среднем около 12,000 сомов (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Гульзат обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку коров. Доходы от кредита Гульзат планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение своего хозяйства, а также, в будущем хочет увеличить площадь сарая и приобрести для своей семьи автомобиль.
texts.en: Gulzat is 27 years old, married, and has two toddlers. Gulzat has a secondary-specialized education. She graduated from a vocational school for consumer goods manufacturing. Gulzat is punctual, emphatic, neat and hardworking by nature. Her husband helps her with her business. As an additional source of income for her family, she has been practicing livestock breeding for many years already. She started this business with 5,000 som (KGS). Thanks to Gulzat's hard work, she currently has 2 milk cows, 2 horses and 55 sheep on her farm, as well as a 2.80 hectare plot of land. This business brings in on average 12,000 som (KGS) per month, which mainly serves to cover the family's food expenses and daily living needs.  For the purpose of further developing her business, Gulzat turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows. Gulzat plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to increase the size of her barn in the future and to buy a car for her family.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Dúo Exodo Group

texts.es: Dúo Exodo, este dúo esta conformado por la señora Alba de Jesus de 46 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de cosmeticos desde hace varios años, en esta oportunidad ella esta solicitando este credito para la compra de mercaderia (cosmeticos)para su negocio esperando que le úedan ayudar con el credito solicitado ya que el sueño de ella es agrandar mas su negocio y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante.
texts.en:
Dúo Exodo. This group is comprised of 46-year-old Alba de Jesus. She has been selling cosmetics for several years. 

At this time she is requesting this loan to purchase merchandise (cosmetics) for her business. She is hoping you can help with the loan requested as her dream is to expand her business and help her family come out ahead.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: Ainagul

texts.ru: Айнагул 23 года, замужем, мать одного ребенка. Образование у Айнагул среднее, уже 4 года занимается животноводством и полеводством, развитие своего бизнеса начала с 15,000 сомов (KGS). Сегодня, благодаря ее ответственности и трудолюбию у нее в хозяйстве есть уже 3 коровы и земельный надел, размером 0,84 ГА, где она выращивает в основном кукурузу, картошку, хлопок. Все условия для содержания скота имеются. Также Айнагул продает молочные продукты. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айнагул обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота, также для увеличения ежемесячного дохода от продажи молочных продуктов. Доходы от кредита Айнагул планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и планирует накопить средства на расширение сарая и проведение ремонта в доме.
texts.en: Ainagul is 23 years old, married, and is a mother to one child. Ainagul has a secondary education. Ainagul has been practicing livestock breeding and crop farming for four years already. She started this business with 15,000 som (KGS). Today, thanks to her responsibility and hard work, she currently has 3 milk cows on her farm, as well as a 0.84 hectare plot of land on which she primarily grows corn, potatoes, and cotton. She has all of the necessary conditions for housing cattle. Ainagul also sells dairy products. Her monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Ainagul turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd as well as to increase her monthly income from selling dairy products. Ainagul plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She also intends to save money to expand her barn and to carryout renovations on her house.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy steers

loans.name: Sakina

texts.ru: Сакина 48 лет, замужем, мать четверых детей, младший сын учится в школе, старшие живут самостоятельно. У Сакины - среднее образование, она знает конкретно чего хочет и добивается всего своими силами. Сакина знает как правильно использовать и планировать денежные средства для достижения поставленных целей. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, стартовав 25 лет назад с покупки скота на 5,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Сакины, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова и 20 овец. Для содержания скота имеются все условия: сарай и отгонные пастбища. Сено и корма для скота заготовлены в достаточном количестве. Ежемесячный доход составляет 12,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Сакина обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум"  за кредитом на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Сакина планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, также она давно планировала накопить средства на свадьбу сына.
texts.en: Sakina is 48 years old, married and has four children. Her youngest son attends school; the older children live independently. Sakina has a secondary education. She concretely knows what she wants and goes after it with all of her strength. Sakina knows how to appropriately use and manage her finances in order to achieve her desired goals. As the main source of income for her family, she practices livestock breeding. She started this business 25 years ago with an initial purchase of cattle in the amount of 5,000 som (KGS).
