Thanks to Sakina's hard work, she currently has 1 milk cow and 20 sheep on her farm. She has all of the conditions necessary to house cattle: a barn and a pasture to graze on. Hay and feed for the cattle have been gathered in sufficient quantities. Her monthly income is 12,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Sakina turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy cows to increase the size of her herd. Sakina plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock. She has also been planning for a long time to save money for her son's wedding.

loans.use: to buy cows.

loans.name: Gulzat

texts.ru: Гулзат 45 лет, разведена, имеет 1 сына. Образование-высшее, по специальности педагог русского языка и литературы. С 2010 года Гулзат начала заниматься торговлей женской одежды, стартовав с суммы в 5,000 сом (KGS), Гулзат сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в среднем 10,000 сомов (KGS). На сегодняшний день товарооборот составляет 250,000 сомов (KGS). В целях обновления ассортимента товаров, а именно закупить весенне-летнюю одежду, Гулзат обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом. Она планирует вложить доходы от бизнеса в дальнейшее увеличение ассортимента товара и улучшение жилищных условий.
texts.en: Gulzat is 45 and divorced with one son. She has a higher education with a major in the teaching of Russian language and literature. Since 2010, Gulzat has been working in the sale of women's clothing, a business she began with 5,000 KGS. She has been able to develop her business and now has a monthly income of about 10,000 KGS, with a current turnover of 250,000 KGS. With the goal of renewing her assortment of merchandise, specifically of buying spring and summer clothing, Gulzat has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan. She plans to invest profits into further increasing her selection of goods and improving her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Sobohon

texts.ru: Собохон 57 лет, замужем, есть 5 детей. У Собохон - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Собохон занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав более 30 лет назад с 50,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду, целеустремленности и ответственному подходу к работе, Собохон на сегодняшний день имеет: дойную корову с теленком и 0,96 ГА земельной доли, на которой Сабохон ежегодно выращивает картофель,кукурузу, хлопчатник для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ежемесячный совокупный доход составляет 14,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Собохон обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку овец.  Собохон намерена расширить свое хозяйство, что непременно приведет к увеличению капитала семьи. Доходы от кредита Собохон планирует вложить в приумножение количества домашней скотины, и на постройку большого сарая.
texts.en: Sobohon is 57 years old, married and has five children. Sobohon has a secondary education. As the main source of income for her family, she practices crop farming and livestock breeding. She started this business more than 30 years ago with 50,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, persistence and responsible operating procedures, Sobohon currently has 1 milk cow and 1 calf on her farm, as well as a 0.96 hectare plot of land on which she annually grows potatoes, corn and cotton for personal consumption and sale. Her monthly combined income is 14,000 som (KGS). For the purpose of further developing her business, Sobohon turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan to buy sheep. Sobohon is determined to expand her farm which will fundamentally increase her family's capital. Sobohon plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further acquisition of livestock and to build a large barn.

loans.use: to buy sheep.

loans.name: Pedro Antonio

texts.es:
Pedro, vive con su esposa y sus dos hijos de 10 y 8 años de edad, se dedica a sembrar maíz y árboles  de café que luego vende a las fincas de la zona, con este negocio obtiene los ingresos con los cueles cubre las necesidades básicas de la familia.
Requiere capital para comprar abono, fertilizantes, herbicidas, bolsas y otros materiales importantes para la preparación del terreno en el que sembrara, espera aumentar la producción, cubrir la demanda de sus clientes y mejorar la su situación económica.
Su aspiración es mantener su negocio funcionando y apoyar a que sus hijos culminen una carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Pedro lives with his wife and their two children, ages 10 and 8. He plants corn and coffee trees, which he then sells to the farms in the zone. With this business, he obtains income with which he covers the basic needs of the family.

He needs capital to buy compost, fertilizer, herbicides, bags, and other important materials to prepare the land in which he will plant. He hopes to increase production, meet the demand of his customers, and improve his economic situation.

His goal is to keep his business functioning and support his children in completing their university studies.

loans.use: to buy compost, fertilizers, herbicides, bags, and other materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: maintain his pineapple crop

loans.name: Tooto Academy

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Olive. She is the Director at Tooto Academy, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namugongo town, Wakiso Distrct with 176 students. Tooto Academy, has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Tooto will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Olive ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Namugongo Parents School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Juliet. She is the Head teacher at Namugongo Parents Primary School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namugongo town, Wakiso Distrct with 300 students. Namugongo Parents Primary School, has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Namugongo Parents will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Juliet ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Tooto School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Olive. She is the Head teacher at Tooto Day care & Nursery School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Namugongo town, Wakiso Distrct with 335 students. Tooto Day care & Nursery School, has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Tooto Day care & Nursery will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Olive ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Midland School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Francis. He is the Head teacher at Midland High School, a mixed school in the Peri-urban area of Mbogo town, Wakiso Distrct with 800 students. Midland High School, has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 750 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Midland High will repay this loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. This will be supplemented by the sale of carbon credits, which the school will generate from using the water tank. Francis ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Elva Luz

texts.es: Elva tiene 37 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañero de vida, su hijo de 14 años y su hija de 9 años de edad. Elva es una mujer emprendedora, sencilla y trabajadora. Desde hace dos años Elva se dedica  a la prestación de servicios domésticos lo cual le permite apoyar con los gastos del hogar. Desea mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo repello de paredes y para encementar el piso de la vivienda. Con el monto solicitad comprará cemento, arena, polines y grava.
texts.en: Elva is 37 years old.  She lives in her own home with her life partner and her children, aged 14 and 9.  She is an unassuming and hardworking entrepreneur.  For two years, Elva has been providing housekeeping services, which has enabled her to support the household expenses.  She wants to improve the condition of her home, and so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to repair her roof, plaster the walls, and put a cement floor in her home.  With the sum she has requested, she will buy cement, sand, beams, and gravel.

loans.use: to buy materials to repair the roof and floor of her home, and to plaster the walls

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 11 years. Her business is located in a viable place and her primary customers are of all types. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sapina

texts.en:
Sapina is a 36-year-old woman with two children. She has a small plantation, and grows taamu, taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for four years. 

Sapina has requested a loan to buy equipment and tools for her plantation, such as a mist blower, a chain saw, chemicals, fertilisers, vegetable seeds and taro roots. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

 With her profits, Sapina hopes to support her family and assist with her business.

loans.use: to buy equipment and tools for her plantation, such as a mist blower,  a chain saw, chemicals, fertilisers, vegetable seeds and taro roots

loans.name: Pereise

texts.en:
Pereise is a 33-year-old woman with one child. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for many years. Pereise has requested a loan to buy tools and equipment for her plantation business such as a mist blower, fertilizers, bush knives, spades, crowbar and knife sharpener. 

She has just joined SPBD to gain access to financial assistance. With her profits, Pereise hopes to support her family and assist with her business.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment for her plantation business such as a mist blower, fertilizers, bush knives, spades, crowbar and knife sharpener

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth is a 29-year-old woman. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community and has been doing this for a year. Elizabeth has requested a loan to buy a large pot, cooking stove, flour and mutton flap for her business. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Elizabeth is hoping to improve her family's financial situation and assist with their daily needs.

loans.use: to buy a large pot, cooking stove, flour and mutton flap

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn is 47-years-old and lives in Rizal, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  He is single with no dependents.

Arlyn is engaged in operating a convenience store, eatery and refreshment and lodging house business for 15 years already and earns approximately PHP 20,000 each month doing this type of work. At the present time, he is also an elected Barangay Official in his community.  He has requested a loan to be used for purchasing a commercial lot for future building construction to be used for his existing businesses. Arlyn has been a member of PMPC since last year.  In the future, Arlyn hopes to re-engage in an internet café business.

loans.use: To purchase a commercial lot for future building construction

loans.name: Celso

texts.en:
Celso is 64 years old, and lives in Sta. Cruz, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental.  He is married with three children, who are now adults. 

Celso has been engaged in farming, particularly rice production activity, for 15 years already, and earns approximately PHP10,000.00 on each crop from doing this type of work. At present, he is also receiving a monthly pension from the services he rendered previously as an employee.

He has requested a loan to be used to purchase commercial fertilizers for his rice production activity. Celso has been a member of PMPC for almost three years. In the future, Celso hopes to save more in our cooperative for future needs.

loans.use: to be purchase commercial fertilizers.

loans.name: Rujim

texts.en:
Rujim, a hard working man, is single and earns an income from his transportation services aside from his salary. He has been employed by a private institution for more than seven years. Aside from this, he also has invested in a farm. With his generated income, his previous loan, which was used for motor repair, was successfully repaid. 

Recently, Rujim took a new loan to buy fertilizer such as manure to improve the farm and be able to increase his income. In the future, he wants to improve the general living situation of the entire family.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer such as manure.

loans.name: Lucila

texts.en:
Lucila operates a business providing transportation services to local community members. She has earned well from this, so that she has been able to provide for her family.  With her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loan, which was used for purchasing tires. Aside from this, she cooks food and sells it in the village to earn more income.

To improve sales, she took a new loan from GDMPC micro credit to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale.   She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients to prepare food for sale.

location.town: Carmen Annex, Ozamis City, Misamis Occidental

loans.name: Bindja Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bitondo est  présidente du groupe d’affaire Bindja à 52 ans. Entrepreneur expérimentée, elle est veuve et mère de 7  enfants tous scolarisés. Grande commerçante à ce jour, après 30 ans d'experience; elle sollicite ce crédit pour  acheter des assiettes, casseroles et bassins en plastic. Elle souhaite rehabiliter sa maison et scolariser ses enfants jusqu'à finir les études universitaires. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima et prie Dieu de le bénir.
texts.en: Our client Bitondo is the leader of the Bindja business group. She is 52 years old. An experienced entrepreneur, she is a widow and the mother of seven children, all in school. By now she has become a well-know vendor, with 30 years of experience; she is seeking this loan to buy dishes, pots and plastic tubs. She would like to repair her house and  finance her children's education through the university level. She thanks Hekima and prays for God to bless it.

loans.use: to buy two dozens of dishes, pots and plastic tubs.

loans.name: Ujamaa Group

texts.fr: La cliente Marcelline est une commerçante et membre du groupe d’affaires «Ujamaa», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 31 ans et mère de 8 enfants, dont 6 étudient et 2 autres sont encore gosses. La cliente est une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises dans un dépôt dans le quartier commercial de la ville, la ou, elle a su gagner sa clientèle. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de son mari. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 9 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 1 sacs de sorgho, 1 sac de mais, ½ sac d’haricots et 2 sacs de soja. Ainsi, elle souhaite scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs exclues de système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile  post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en: Our client Marcelline is  a vendor and member of the Ujamaa business group. She is an energetic entrepreneur, 31 years old, with eight children, six of whom study and two are still small. This client sells staple foods. She displays her merchandise in a warehouse in the business district of the city, where she has been able to develop a customer base.  She launched her business with a starting capital received from her husband. Later on, she obtained a loan from the Hekima microfinance institution. Marcelline has been in business for nine years. This new loan will allow her to buy one bag of sorghum, one bag of corn, half a bag of beans and two bags of soya. She would like to pay for her children's food and schooling. She sincerely thanks Hekima for helping female entrepreneurs without access to traditional banking become financially independent, especially at this difficult time following armed conflicts in the east of the country.

loans.use: to buy one bag of sorghum, one bag of corn, half a bag of beans and two bags of soya.

loans.name: Florencio

texts.en:
Florencio operates a service-based business providing motor transportation services. He has been doing this for years and he earns enough from this to support his family. With his income, his previous loan used for license renewal and motor accessories has been successfully repaid.
In 2007, he joined GDMPC micro credit and gained access to micro finance services. He took a new loan to finance a renovation of his home. In the near future, he wants to procure another vehicle to be used to expand his business. He wants to provide his family with a comfortable and a better living situation in the future.

loans.use: to finance the expense of a house renovation.

loans.name: Hoa

texts.en:
Hoa is 37 years old and married with one daughter. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a worker for a factory in their local community. She earns income by running a business selling cellphones. 

Hoa has been running her business for four years. She intends to take a loan to buy more cellphones and accessories to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more cellphones and accessories to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Venera

texts.ru: Венере 37 лет, замужем, 3 детей. Венера имеет среднее образование. Она спокойная, уравновешенная и трудолюбивая. Супруг и дети помогают по бизнесу. В качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, уже много лет занимается сельским хозяйством, в частности животноводством и полеводством, выращивает хлопок и арбузы. Начав этот бизнес практически с нуля, на сегодняшний день Венера имеет в хозяйстве 2 коровы, 1 теленка и 5 овец. На 3,5 ГА земли Венера выращивает хлопок и арбузы, свой земельный надел составляет 1,05 ГА, остальная земля- в аренде. Деятельность Венеры приносит около 10,000 сом (KGS) в месяц, что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Венера обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку минеральных удобрений и семян элитных сортов для весенних посевных работ. Осенью на вырученные деньги Венера хочет купить скот для откорма и реализации. Постепенное увеличение поголовья скота позволит расширить хозяйство и построить ограждение дома.
texts.en: Venera ["Venus"] is 37 years old, married,  and has three children. She has received secondary education. She is calm, and hard-working. Her husband and children help her in her business. As an additional source of income for her family, Venera has been doing farmwork, namely raising livestock and growing produce: cotton and watermelons. Having launched this business basically with nothing, now Venera has two cows, one calf and five sheep. She has 3.5 ha of land, where she grows cotton and watermelons; her own land is 1.05 ha and the rest is leased. Venera's business brings in about 10,000 KGS per month, which serve as the base for covering the cost of food and everyday needs of her family. In order to develop her farm further, Venera has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance institution for a loan to buy mineral fertilizers and premium seeds for the spring planting season. In the fall, Venera will use her revenue to buy livestock for fattening and resale. The gradual increase of livestock will allow her to expand her farm and build a fence.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers.

loans.name: Daniel Santos

texts.es:
Daniel, está satisfecho por los buenos resultados que tuvo al invertir el capital anterior en la compra de repuestos para motocicletas y bicicletas, su negocio se ha mantenido funcionando, las nuevas ganancias le ayudan a salir adelante con los gastos de su familia y brinda apoyo en el negocio que está iniciando su esposa, el cual consiste en una sala de belleza.
Para fortalecer su taller y continuar ayudando a su esposa, solicita un nuevo crédito que utilizara para comprar cadenas, pedales, focos, frenos, llantas, tintes, maquillaje, cremas, etc.
texts.en:
Daniel is happy with the positive results he has seen following his previous loan; he used the loan to buy spare parts for motorcycles and bicycles, his business remained operational, and the increased income helped him to cover his family's expenses and support his wife who is starting her own beauty salon. 

To stock up his workshop and continue supporting his wife, he is requesting a new loan in order to buy chains, pedals, headlights, brakes, tires, hair dyes, makeup, creams, etc.

loans.use: to buy chains, pedals, headlights, brakes, tires, hair dyes, makeup, creams, etc.

loans.name: Giau

texts.en:
Giau is 56 years old and married with four children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a food stall to earn a living. 

She has been running her business for 15 years. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different foods to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different foods to sell to her customers

loans.name: Phuong

texts.en:
Phuong is 44 years old and married with one son. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband supports his family by raising pigs. Phuong earns an income by running a business distilling alcohol. 

She has been running her business for 12 years. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying rices and ingredients for making alcohol. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rices and ingredients for making alcohol

loans.name: Xuan

texts.en:
Xuan is 42 years old and married with two children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband have been running a food stall to earn a living. 

She has been running her business for 10 years. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a variety of different foods to sell to her customers. 

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a variety of different foods to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Triet

texts.en:
Triet, 36, is married and has two children. He lives with his family in Ho Chi Minh City. His wife earns a living working in the health care field. 

Triet has been running a drinking water shop in front of his house for eight years. He is requesting a loan to expand his business by buying new drinking water products to better satisfy his customers.

He hopes his business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist him in improving his family's living conditions and sending his children to school.

loans.use: to buy new drinking water products to sell from his store

loans.name: Thanh

texts.en:
Thanh is a 53-year-old married woman. She lives with her two children and husband in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns money as a security guard for a company. For 10 years, she has run a general store selling basic products to people in her community.

Thanh would like a loan to purchase a stock of basic consumer products and drinking water containers to sell from her store. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that with her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of basic products and drinking water containers to sell from her general store

loans.name: Tuyet

texts.en:
Tuyet is a 54-year-old widowed woman. She lives with her two children in Ho Chi Minh City. For eight years, she has run a business selling beverages to people in her community.

Tuyet would like a loan to purchase beverages and furniture for her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that with her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase beverages and furniture for her shop

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is a 46-year-old married woman. She lives with her three children in Ho Chi Minh City. For 10 years, she has been running a business selling beverages to people in her community.

Nga would like a loan to upgrade the shop and to purchase beverages for her shop. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and to attract additional customers. 

She also hopes that with her loan she will be able to increase her income and to save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to upgrade the shop and to purchase beverages for her shop

loans.name: Xiem

texts.en:
Xiem is 38 years old and married with two daughters. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income by running a business selling cellphones. 

She has been running her business for 10 years. She intends to take a loan to buy more cellphones and accessories to sell to her customers. 

She hopes that her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy more cellphones and accessories to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anh

texts.en:
Anh, 52, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children. Anh and her husband earn their living running a general store which they started 20 years ago.  

Anh is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying instant noodles, biscuits, cooking oils, and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the profits from her business. 

She hopes that with the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest into her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy instant noodles, biscuits, cooking oils, and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her store

loans.name: Solidario Las Victoria Group

texts.es:
SOLIDARIO LAS VICTORIAS
La señora María Cristina de 39 años, casada,  desde hace 1 años posee una Venta de frutas  ubicada frente a la  Escuela de la Colonia, que a base de esfuerzos logro establecer y mejorar su vivienda, a través de su negocio ella  ha mantenido y  a sacado adelante a su familia.
El sueño de doña María  es poder mejorar la calidad de su vida y la de su familia a través del microcrédito que está solicitando a FAPE; con el préstamo quiere comprar más frutas para seguir creciendo con su venta.
texts.en:
María Cristina is 39 years old and married. A year ago she started a business selling fruit. It is located across the street from the neighborhood school. She put all her effort into establishing it and now, thanks to her business, she has been able to improve her housing and provide for her family.

María's dream is to be able to improve her and her family's quality of life with the loan she is requesting from FAPE. She wants to use this loan to buy more fruit so that her business continues to grow.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Cang

texts.en: Cang, 42, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children. She supports her family by running a food stall that she started 10 years ago. Cang is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying furniture and food to satisfy her customers. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities, and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and food to satisfy her customers

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah plants and harvests corn to earn a living, which she has been doing for many years. With her generated income, her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid.

To improve her farm, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer.

In 2004, she joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Sarah wants to make improvements to her house and enable her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase organic  fertilizer

loans.name: Len

texts.en:
Len, 44 years old, is widowed and has one daughter. She runs a food stall selling pork to people in her community. She started this business 16 years ago. They live in Ho Chi Minh City.

Len intends to take a loan to increase her working capital and buy good quality pork to better satisfy her customers' needs. The additional capital will enable her to increase her income from this business. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a larger quantity of pork to sell at her stall

loans.name: Nga

texts.en:
Nga is requesting a new loan to buy a range of new products, such as food and beverages, to restock her general store. This purchase will help her to better meet the needs of her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business and offer her customers a greater variety of products.

She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her store and increase sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a greater variety and quantity of food products to sell at her store.

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien is 38 years old and married with three children. She lives with her family in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City. She and her husband earn income through running a shop selling electric products.

She started her business 17 years ago. She intends to take a loan to gradually expand her business by buying a larger better quality of products to sell to her customers.

She hopes her business runs smoothly and will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a larger better quality of products to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Hanh's Group

texts.en: Hanh is 50 years old and lives with her children, one son and one daughter, and her husband. Her husband is a driver for hire. For the past 16 years Hanh has been running a business selling salt to earn an income to support her family. She is the group leader of a four-member loan group from Ho Chi Minh City. In the picture she is the first from the left. Each of the other group members is requesting loans to fund income-generating activities. Hanh is requesting a loan to increase her working capital to purchase a larger quantity of salt to sell to her customers. She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional ones. She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to buy salt to sell

loans.name: Bon Samaritain Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nhonzi est une commerçante depuis 14 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires «Bon Samaritain»,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 50 ans et mère de 8 enfants, tous  étudient. Elle est vendeuse des articles divers et sociétaire d’une boutique chez lui a Domicile. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un professionnel de la craie(Enseignant). Elle va acheter 40 litres huiles, 1 carton de lotion, 1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos, 1 sac de farine formant, les allumettes, 1 carton de savons, un sac de sucre, des bonbons, biscuits, sel iodé, etc. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Nhonzi has been a retail merchant for the past 14 years and is a member of the "Bon Samaritain" business association. She is a dynamic entrepreneur, aged 50, and the mother of eight children, all in school. She sells sundries and is shareholder in a shop located at her residence.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She started out with funds received from her husband, who is a chalk professional (teacher). She will buy 40 liters of oil, one box of lotion, one box of notebooks, five boxes of pens, one bag of self-rising flour, matches, 1 carton of soap, a bag of sugar, sweets, biscuits, iodized salt, etc.

In the future, she wants to increase her activity, educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy 40 liters of oil, 1 carton of lotion , 1 carton of notebooks, 5 boxes of pens, 1 bag of self-raising flour, matches, 1 carton of soap, a bag of sugar, sweets, biscuits, iodized salt, etc.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en: Hanh, 44, is married and has three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband earns an income as a worker for a local company. Hanh started a printing shop 20 years ago.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater variety of materials, such as paper and ink, to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy materials, such as paper and ink, for her printing shop.

loans.name: Fidélité Group

texts.fr: La cliente Muteba est une vaillante commerçante depuis 3 ans, président et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Fidélité», entrepreneur, âgée de 42 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants qui tous, étudient. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés au marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 70 paires de souliers.Son conjoint, est un militaire de la force loyaliste de la Repubilque. Elle débuta  avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite progresser dans son business,  accroitre son capital, scolariser, nourrir  ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en  apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Muteba has been a courageous merchant for the past three years, the president and member of the "Fidelity" business group. She is a 42-year-old entrepreneur, married, and the mother of eight children who are all in school.

She sells second-hand shoes at the city's central market. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her activities. She will buy 70 pairs of shoes.

Her spouse is a soldier in the Republic's loyal forces. She started out with funds received from her husband. In the future, she wants to improve her business, increase its capital, educate and feed her children.

She thanks Hekima to have well chosen its target, by providing support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, while granting them loans without collateral, especially during the post-conflict period in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: buy 70 pairs of shoes

loans.name: Panorama Group

texts.fr: La cliente Muhindo est une brave commerçante depuis 2 ans et membre d’une association d’affaires « Panorama»,  entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 45 ans et mère de 3 enfants, tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des articles divers et sociétaire d’un magasin. Elle sollicite un crédit  auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son décompte final. Son conjoint est un agent de développement. Elle va  acheter des cartons de bombons, des biscuits, savons en poudre, produits cosmétiques, 1 carton de cahiers, 5 boites de stylos, les allumettes, sel iodé, etc. Dans l’avenir,elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes  entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique.
texts.en:
Muhindo has been a courageous merchant over the past two years, and is a member of the  "Panorama" business partnership. She is a dynamic 45-year-old entrepreneur, the mother of three children, all attending school. She sells sundry items and is shareholder of a general store.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She started out with funds received from a previous financial settlement. Her spouse is a development agent.

She will buy cartons of sweets, biscuits, powdered soap, cosmetics, one box of notebooks, five boxes of pens, matches, iodized salt, etc.

In the future, she wants to expand her activity, educate and feed her children. She thanks Hekima for its support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system.

loans.use: buy cartons of sweets, biscuits, powdered soap, cosmetics, 1 box of notebooks, 5 boxes of pens, matches, iodized salt, etc.

loans.name: Chanthou

texts.en: Chanthou is 34 years old. She is a married woman who has three children in Oudong, Kampong Speu Province, Cambodia. She is a farmer and her husband is a solider. Now, she would like to apply for loan of $600 to buy a Tuk-Tuk to provide transportation for her clients. This loan helps her make more income for her family as well as make a better living. In the future, she hopes that she can renovate her house and her children can get a high school diploma.

loans.use: To purchase a Tuk-Tuk to provide transportation for clients

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza owns farmland and operates a farm, harvesting and planting corn to sell. Aside from corn farming, she also plants bananas on her farm in order to gain additional income for the family. With her generated income, her previous loan, which she used for farming, was successfully repaid.
 
In 2011, Analiza joined GDMPC and she gained access to financial services that help improve her living situation and her ability to engage in business activities. 

Analiza took a new loan to purchase fertilizer and planting materials. She plans to use the additional revenue generated with this loan to expand her farm.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and planting materials

loans.name: Yesu Anaweza Group

texts.fr: La cliente Judith est une commerçante et membre d’une association d’affaires « Yesu Anaweza», entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 42 ans, responsable et mère de 4 enfants dont 2 étudient et 2 sont gamins. Elle est  sociétaire d’un restaurant dans le  centre ville. Elle sollicite un crédit auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle commença avec de fonds reçu de son mari (lors de son vivant).Il ya 11 ans, qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle va acheter 1 sac du riz, de haricots, de braises, de pommes de terre, 20 litres huiles, du sucre, du lait, de la farine de manioc, etc. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son activité, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Ainsi, elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux homme et femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique. Il sied de signaler, qu'au dos une cliente porte son bébé.
texts.en:
Judith is a merchant and a member of the "Yesu Anaweza" business association. She is a dynamic 42-year-old entrepreneur, and the responsible mother of four children, of whom two attend school and two are under school age. She is shareholder of a restaurant in the center of the city.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to increase her business. She started with funds received from her husband (while he lived). She has been in business for the past eleven years.

She will buy one bag of rice, beans, charcoal, potatoes, 20 liters of oil, sugar, milk, cassava flour, etc. In the future, she wants to increase her activity, educate and feed her children.

She thanks Hekima for its support to men and women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system. It should be pointed out that one of the members is carrying a baby on her back.

loans.use: buy one bag of rice, beans, charcoal, potatoes, 20 liters of oil, sugar, milk, cassava flour, etc.

loans.name: Toan

texts.en:
Toan, 44, lives in a small house in Ho Chi Minh City with his family, including two sons, one daughter and his wife. His wife supports the family by selling rice. Toan earns money through his business washing vehicles. He started this business 16 years ago. 

Toan would like to get a loan to buy an elevated platform and an oil removal pump for his business of washing vehicles. He hopes his business will ensure that his family members, and especially his children, will have a better education and a better future.

loans.use: To buy an elevated platform and an oil removal pump.

loans.name: Yen

texts.en: Yen, 44, is married and has two children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is a driver for hire. She earns an income by running a shop selling many kinds of cakes.  She is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying a greater quantity of sugar, flour and other materials to increase her production of cakes to better satisfy her customers. She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy sugar, flour and other materials to make cakes to sell

loans.name: Paulina

texts.en:
Paulina owns and operates a coconut plantation to earn a living. She has been in her business for many years and she earns enough income to provide for her family. With her farm, she has successfully repaid her previous loan, which she used for farming. In addition to this, she is engaged in retailing grocery goods in her general store, which contributes much to their daily needs expenditures.

To improve sales, she took a new loan to buy additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: Thomas

texts.en:
Thomas is 40 years old and runs a general store in Tala town. He is married and together with his spouse, has been blessed with two children aged 14 and 4 years old. He has been in this business for 10 years and has a hotel as his secondary business. 

Currently, his monthly income is KES 45,000 and he will be using the loan to purchase more stock like sugar, salt and cooking oil for his general store.

He will use the anticipated profits from his expanded business to repay the loan and to save. This is his fifth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and he has successfully repaid all his previous loans. In the future, he hopes to be a successful businessman.

loans.use: to buy stock of goods like salt, sugar and cooking oil

loans.name: Tom

texts.en: Tom is 45 years old and married with four children residing in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He mostly sells cocoa at wholesale. He has a store of cocoa sacks. Tom buys cocoa in small quantities, dries, packs and sells it to big companies like Esco Uganda. He works hard as seasonal changes affect him negatively by reducing the income he earns from cocoa. Tom hopes to start operating his business from village level to town. He needs the loan to buy cocoa to sell.

loans.use: To buy cocoa to sell

loans.name: Jose Rudys

texts.es:
José, opta por un nuevo préstamo para comprar plywood, clavos, barniz, pegamento, lijas, golosinas, bebidas, aceite, arroz, frijol, etc., fortalecerá su negocio con suficiente mercadería para cumplir con las peticiones de sus clientes.
El crédito anterior le ha permitido mantener su negocio activo y generando los recursos económicos para salir adelante.
texts.en: Jose is requesting a new loan to buy plywood, nails, varnish, glue, sandpaper, sweets, beverages, oil, rice, beans, etc. to strengthen his business with enough merchandise to fill customer demand.  The previous loan allowed him to keep his business going and to generate enough income to get ahead.

loans.use: To buy plywood, nails, varnish, glue, sandpaper, sweets, beverages, oil, rice, beans, etc.

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es:
Reina, se caracteriza por luchar día a día para obtener ingresos que le permitan colaborar en los gastos de su hogar, vive con su compañero de vida y dos hijas de 28 y 17 años de edad, ella inicio por su cuenta la venta de comida, antojitos, y pan, sus labores son de 5:00 a.m. a 4:00 p.m., en dichas actividades recibe el apoyo de sus hijas.
Comprará harina, azúcar, levadura, huevos, bebidas, leña, gas propano, carnes, embutidos, verduras, aceite, entre otros materiales para elaborar la venta, espera vender productos de mayor calidad, atraer nuevos clientes e incrementar sus ganancias.
Su visión es mantener su negocio funcionando para que su economía mejore y poder ofrecer a su familia una buena educación, salud, vestuario y salud.
texts.en:
Reina is known for struggling daily to earn an income to help cover household expenses.  She lives with her husband and two daughters, ages 28 and 17, and runs a business selling food, snacks and bread.  Her work schedule is from 5:00 a.m. to 4:00 p.m. and her daughters help out in the business.

She will buy flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, beverages, firewood, propane gas, meats, sausages, vegetables, oil and other items for her work.  She hopes to sell quality products to attract new customers and increase her profits.

Her long-term goal is to keep business running so her economy will improve in order to giver her family a good education, clothing and a healthy lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy flour, sugar, yeast, eggs, beverages, firewood, propane gas, meats, sausages, vegetables, oil and other items.

loans.name: Olga Rubirian

texts.es:
Olga es una mujer de 43 años de edad con un feliz matrimonio del cual nació un hijo que hoy en día tiene trece años, es una mujer pujante, soñadora ambiciosa que gracias a su madre aprendió del negocio de venta de mercancía, las cuales las hace por pedido.
Vende pijamas, bluejeans, camisetas y alcochados, trabaja independiente, vende en las tardes y en las mañanas se ocupa de su hogar.
Solicita el crédito para comprar mercancía mas enfocada en una línea propia que ya empezó y le ha traído muy buenos resultados, pues sus productos son económicos y de muy buena calidad, lo que la ha hecho reconocer en le sector, tener recomendaciones positivas de sus productos, generando poco a poco clientes nuevos.
Su principal problema es la falta de capital para comprar mercancía y dar abasto a los pedidos que tiene, pues tiene un buen volumen de clientes mas no un capital para satisfacerlos a todos.
Olga es el claro ejemplo de una mujer emprendedora que siempre busca una manera de salir adelante, de darle una mejor calidad de vida a su hijo, de dejarle un legado una enseñanza de siempre perseguir una meta, para beneficiar a su seres queridos y ella misma.
texts.en:
Olga, 43, is happily married and has a 13-year-old son.  She is a dynamic, fanciful, ambitious woman who thanks to her mother learned to sell merchandise for which she receives orders.  She sells pijamas, bluejeans, t-shirts and comforters.  She works independently in the afternoons and takes care of household activities during the morning.  

The loan she is requesting is to buy merchandise more in line with her business that makes a good profit.  Her products are inexpensive and top quality, which has given her a name in the sector.  The positive reviews of her products have generated new customers little by little.

Her main problem is a lack of capital to buy the merchandise to have stock to fill all the orders,  She has many customers but not enough capital to satisfy everyone.

Olga is a clear example of a woman entrepreneur who is always looking for ways to get ahead and to give her son a better quality of life and a legacy of setting an example to pursue one's goal for oneself and her loved ones.

loans.use: To buy merchandise more suited to her line of business, which has given her good results.

loans.name: Edelma Rubi

texts.es:
El sueño de Edelma está a punto de cumplirse. Sus viajes  diarios, desde Corinto al centro de Chinandega, donde  estudia, han valido la pena, ya que  se encuentra a un paso de culminar sus estudios superiores. Gracias a su esfuerzo y  al de sus padres,  logró llegar al cuarto año de la carrera.  Para su último  año de licenciatura, Edelma solicitó un préstamo con el fin de cancelar todo su año lectivo.
Los proyectos de Edelma no concluyen al obtener su título universitario,  más bien empiezan. Planea  ayudar  en el pequeño negocio de sus padres, como una forma de retribuir el apoyo que ellos  le han brindado durante su período de estudio. Su  objetivo es que  siga creciendo y aumentado las ganancias para el beneficio de toda la familia. Edelma se siente muy agradecida con la institución, ya que sin el financiamiento sus sueños estarían en el aire.
texts.en:
Edelma's dream is about to come true.  Her daily trips from Corinto to downtown Chinandega, where she studies, have paid off since she is in the last phase of her university studies.  Thanks to her efforts and those of her parents, she was able to make it to her fourth year of studies.  For the last year of undergraduate studies, Edelma is requesting a loan to pay for tuition.

Edelma's projects will not be over once she gets her degree, rather they will have just begun.  She plans to help out at her parents' business in an aim to pay them back for their support while she was getting an education.  Her goal is to continue expanding it and increasing profits for the benefit of the entire family.  Edelma is very grateful to the institution, because without the loan her dreams might still be up in the air.

loans.use: To pay a year's tuition.

loans.name: Susana Del Rosario

texts.es: Susana tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto  a su compañero de vida y su pequeña hija de 5 años de edad. Susana es comerciante de detergentes y desinfectantes los cuales  comercializa en las principales zonas de su localidad desde hace 5 años. Su deseo es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y las de su familia para lo cual solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la reparación del techo de uno de los cuartos dormitorios de sus hijos dado que se encuentra dañado y desea repararlo antes que el invierno se haga presente. Con el monto solicitado comprará lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos.
texts.en:
Susana is 45 years old and lives in her own house with her partner and five-year-old daughter.  She is a merchant and sells detergents and disinfectants in the main areas of her town, and has been in business for five years.

In an effort to improve the living conditions of her family, she is requesting a loan through FUSAI to repair the roof of one of the four bedrooms.  It is damaged and she wants to repair it before winter comes.  The loan will be used to buy metal sheeting, wood and nails.

loans.use: To buy metal sheeting, wood and nails to repair the roof of one of her bedrooms.

loans.name: Cuc's Group

texts.en:
Cuc, 32, is married and has one child.  She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City.  Her husband is a driver for hire.  Cuc has been running a coffee shop in front of her house for six years. 

Cuc is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group who live in Ho Chi Minh City.  In the picture she is in the centre wearing a dotted jacket.  Each of the other group members are requesting loans to fund income-generating activities.

Cuc is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying new furniture and different coffee products to better satisfy her customers.  She hopes her business runs smoothly and will generate a higher income to assist her in improving her family's living conditions and sending her child to school.

loans.use: To buy new furniture and different coffee products to better satisfy her customers

loans.name: Quyen

texts.en:
Quyen, 44, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two sons.  Quyen supports her family by running a food stall that she started 8 years ago.  Quyen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying good quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall. 

She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.  She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy good quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall

loans.name: Mai

texts.en:
Mai is a 44-year-old divorced woman.  She lives with one son in Ho Chi Minh City.  For 3 years she has run a general store that sells many different products for people in her community.

Mai would like a loan to purchase a greater variety and quantity of confectionery and softdrinks to sell for her customers.  She hopes this will enable her to better meet the needs of her customers and attract additional customers.  She also hopes that through her loan she will be able to increase her income and save money for any future difficulties facing her family.

loans.use: to purchase a greater variety and quantity of confectionery and softdrinks to stock her store

loans.name: Chi

texts.en: Chi, 45, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children.  Chi supports her family by running a food stall that she started 5 years ago by selling rice to people in her community.  Chi is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying good quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall.  She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy good quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall

loans.name: Tuyen

texts.en: Tuyen, 45, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two children.  Tuyen supports her family by running a food stall that she started 7 years ago by selling vegetarian food to people in her community.  Tuyen is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying good quality vegetarian food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall.  She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business.  She hopes that through the loan she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: To buy good quality vegetarian food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall

loans.name: Jose Amado

texts.es: José tiene 45 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su comapñera de vida, su hija de 23 años y su pequeña nieta de 3 años de edad. José tiene un pequeño taller de enderezado y pintura el cual tiene mucho tiempo de tenerlo por lo que cuenta con experiencia y clientes que cada día lo prefieren más. José habita en condiciones muy humildes por lo que ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la mejora del techo y en la construcción de las paredes de la vivienda dado que se encuentran en mal estado y no es seguro para su familia. Con el monto solicitado comprará cemento, arena, ladrillo, hierro y lámina galvanizada. Espera poder contar con este financiamiento dado que no puede hacer la inversión por su cuenta pero tiene la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en: José is 45 years old. He lives in his own house with his life's companion, their 23 year old daughter and their little 3 year old granddaughter. José has a little paint and body workshop. He has had it for a long time and that is why he has experience and customers that prefer him more and more every day.  José lives in very humble conditions and has decided to ask for this loan from FUSAI to invest in improving the roof and in building walls in the house. It is in very poor condition and not safe for the family. With the amount he has asked for, he will buy cement, sand, bricks, iron rods and galvanized sheeting. He hopes to have this loan because he can't make the investment on his own but he is able to make the monthly payments that the loan involves.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, bricks, iron rods and galvanized sheeting to repair the roof and  build walls in his house.

loans.name: María Sulena

texts.es: María es una mujer de 38 años de edad, se dedico inicialmente al negocio de las confecciones en el cual duro tres años como operaria, después de pasar este periodo de tiempo inicio manejando un local de peceras, con un amigo el cual le enseño el oficio y la guiaba en todo el proceso para adquirir su propio negocio. Vive con su pareja de la cual tuvieron dos hijos, de 16 y 21 años. Hace poco tiempo es una mujer independiente que gracias a los micro créditos tiene la posibilidad de ser su propia jefe y generar un empleo pues su pecera es reconocida por su buen higiene y excelente servicio al cliente; solicita el crédito para adecuación y surtido del local con más especies de peces, pues tiene un muy buen espacio el cual por la falta de capital no es aprovechado de la mejor manera, su principal sueño es tener un local con muy buen impacto visual, cómodo agradable al cliente en el cual pueda encontrar una gran variedad de especies, crecer día a día como empresaria generando empleo y calidad de vida a los seres queridos que la rodean
texts.en: María is a 38 year old woman. She first worked in the business of sewing clothes. She spent three years as an operator. After that time, she started managing an aquarium fish store with a friend who taught her the trade and guided her in the whole process of acquiring her own business. She lives with her spouse with whom she has two children, aged 16 and 21. She has been an independent women for a short time and thanks to the micro-loans, she has had the possibility to becoming her own boss and generate employment. Her aquarium fish store is well known for its good sanitation and excellent customer service. She is asking for the loan to outfit and stock the locale with more species of fish. She has a very good space but due to a lack of capital she can't take advantage of it in the best way. Her main dream is to have a locale with a very good visual impact that is comfortable and pleasant for the customer where a wide variety of species can be found. She wants to grow day to day as an entrepreneur, generating employment and quality of life for the loved ones that she is surrounded with.

loans.use: to outfit and stock the locale with more species of fish.

loans.name: Albalibia

texts.es:
El desplazamiento forzado es una situación que ha venido afectando a  muchas personas en América Latina, especialmente en Colombia, pero albalibia, una mujer luchadora y constante nunca se ha dejado derrumbar por estos hechos, y por el contrario, ha encontrado la forma de salir adelante con su esposo y sus dos hijos, en los cuales ha encontrado un apoyo y una motivación muy importante.
Ella combina una de sus más grandes pasiones, que es el cuidado del cabello y el tratamiento capilar con la rentabilidad que le genera la venta de cd y películas, por esta razón inicio con su salón de belleza.
Emprendió con su negocio hace ya un tiempo, luego de que la violencia les arrebatara todo a ella y a su familia. Ahora, con sus ganas de progresar está buscando la manera de obtener recursos para comprar un lavacabezas y un computador, que según ella son muy necesarios para su negocio y el aseguramiento de su actividad económica, pero no solo eso, también desea darle un futuro estable a su familia que son el motor de su vida y la razón por la cual se esfuerza día a día.
texts.en:
Forced displacement is a situation that has affected many people in Latin America, especially in Colombia. But Albalibia, a steadfast woman who is a fighter, never has let herself crumble because of this. To the contrary, she has found a way to get ahead with her husband and their two children. In them she has found support and a very important motivation. 

She combines one of her great passions, which is hair care and treatment, with the profitability of selling CDs and movies. That is why she started her beauty salon. She opened this business some time ago after violence snatched everything away from her and her family. Now, with her eagerness to get ahead, she is seeking the way to obtain resources to buy a hair washer and a computer. According to her, they are very necessary for her business and to ensure her financial activity. Not only that, she also wants to give her family a stable future, who are the drive of her life and the reason that she strives day to day.

loans.use: to find a way to obtain resources to buy a hair washer and a computer.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan tiene 23 años de edad y habita  en casa propia junto a su abuela. Él es un joven muy trabajador y responsable quien trabaja como empleado en una empresa cercana a su localidad. Su vivienda es muy humilde y sencilla y desea repararle el techo dado que se encuentra dañado por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada y polines para reparar lo antes posible el techo de la vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan is 23 years old and lives in his own house with his grandmother. Juan is a very hard-working and responsible young man and is employed by a local business. He has a simple and very humble home where he wants to replace the roof as it is damaged. Juan is applying for a loan from "FUSAI" in order to 
uy galvanized metal sheeting and purlins to repair the roof of his home as soon as possible.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheeting and purlins to repair the roof of his home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, iron and gravel to build a dividing wall and to cement a floor.

loans.name: María Beatriz

texts.es:
La Señora María forma parte del grupo de crédito Futuro para un Bienestar, le gusta esta forma de créditos porque existe un gran compañerismo y una amistad solida, vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de clima frió, tiene una arquitectura la que es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.
La Señora María tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido un hijo de 15 años que estudia en colegio, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un bus, la casa en la que vive es arrendada.
Doña María labora a diario como empleada domestica, trabaja de lunes a viernes ocho horas diarias, en su casa se dedica a la crianza de gallinas y vende los huevos. El dinero de su crédito es para invertirlo en la compra de una carreta para vender salchipapas. Este es su primer crédito que realiza y ha sido invitada por una amiga quien es una socia fundadora del grupo. Su meta es que su negocio que va iniciar tenga frutos.
texts.en:
María is part of the "Futuro para un Bienestar" loan group and likes it because there is a great feeling of camaraderie and friendship in the group. María lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca - a city with a cold climate and architecture that, in December 1999, was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

María is 41 years old, married and has a 15-year-old son who is attending school. María's husband is a bus driver. The family rents the house where they live.

María works a domestic servant eight hours per day, Monday to Friday. At home she also raises hens and sells their eggs. This loan will be used to buy a cart in order to sell sausages and chips. This is María's first loan - she was invited to the group by one of its founding members. María hopes that her new business will have positive results.

loans.use: to buy a cart.

loans.name: Carmen Eloina

texts.es:
La Señora Carmen forma parte del grupo de crédito Futuro para un Bienestar, este es su segundo crédito que esta realizando ya que en el primero le fue muy bien y espero continuar creciendo en su negocio. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de un clima frió, tiene una arquitectura la que es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.
La Señora Carmen tiene 36 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 15 y 12 años que están estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo ha migrado en busca de un mejor y futuro para su familia, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive arrendando.
Doña Carmen se dedica a la atención de un bar desde hace 3 años, labora de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo. Este trabajo le da la oportunidad de de mejorar su situación económica y sacar adelante a su familia.
 Su crédito anterior lo invirtió en productos para su bar,  este nuevo crédito es para implementar colas, papas fritas, golosinas y otros bocadillos para su negocio.
texts.en:
Carmen is part of the "Futuro para un Bienestar" loan group. This is her second loan - taking out her first loan went very well and she hopes to continue expanding her business. Carmen lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca - a city with a cold climate and architecture that, in December 1999, was named a UNESCO World Heritage Site.

Carmen is 36 years old, married and has two children, aged 15 and 12 years old respectively. They are both studying at one of the city schools while Carmen's husband has migrated to another area in order to find a better future for the family. The family does not have its own house but rents a place to live.

Carmen has been running a bar for three years. She works Monday to Friday and has no fixed timetable. This job gives Carmen the opportunity to improve her financial situation and to help her family to prosper.

Carmen's invested her previous loans in goods for her bar. This new loan will be used to buy cola drinks, chips, sweets and other snacks for her business.

loans.use: to buy cola drinks, chips, sweets and other snacks.

loans.name: Benjamin Group

texts.fr: La cliente Mwadawa est une brave commerçante, présidente et membre d’un groupe solidaire «Benjamin», senior  entrepreneur, âgée de 51 ans, mariée  et mère de 8 enfants  qui 6 étudient et 2 autres sont mariés. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers habillements (Pagnes). Elle étale sa marchandise dans un magasin du quartier commercial. Elle commença ses business avec de fonds reçu de sa grande sœur. Son conjoint est un retraité.   Il y a 22 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 150 pièces de pagnes.  Ainsi, elle souhaite  construire une belle maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Mwadawa is a brave merchant, member and president of the Benjamin business group. An experienced entrepreneur, she is 51 years old, married, and a mother of eight children, of whom six go to school and two are married. Her husband is retired.

Mwadawa sells various clothing (pagnes [bright, colorful fabric]). She displays her goods in a shop in commercial area. She started this business 22 years ago with funds from her older sister.

With this new loan she is going to buy 150 lengths of pagne. 

Mwadawa hopes to build a nice house and educate, feed, and clothe her children.

Finally, Mwadawa strongly thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs, who lack access to traditional financial services, especially during this time of conflict in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy 150 lengths of pagne [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Yalena Del Socorro

texts.es: Yalena del Socorro en una mujer de 42 años de edad muy trabajadora y luchadora, habita en el barrio Las Iguanas, muy alejado de la zona rural. A ella siempre le ha llamado la atención las actividades comerciales por las características de la zona en la cual habita, junto a su esposo desarrollan el proyecto de engorde de cerdos, los cuales son comercializados a buen precio, además comercializan productos lácteos como queso y crema. Yalena solicita el crédito para comprar 8 cerdos, 40 libras de queso y 30 libras de crema, los cuales sus fieles clientes solicitan.
texts.en:
Yalena del Socorro, age 42, is a very hard-working and tenacious woman.  She lives in the Las Iguanas neighborhood, which is very far from the rural area.  The commercial activities that are characteristic of the area where she lives have always gotten her attention.  

She and her husband work together fattening pigs, which are sold for a good price.  They also sell dairy products like cheese and cream.

Yalena is requesting the loan to buy 8 pigs, 40 pounds of cheese, and 30 pounds of cream.  Her loyal customers are requesting these products.

loans.use: to buy 8 pigs, 40 pounds of cheese, and 30 pounds of cream.

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es: El señor Miguel Ángel es una persona que habita en el Barrio San Pedro del departamento de Chontales, a pesar de tener 52 años de edad aun se dedica a las labores de campo como productor, lo que le ha permitido educar a sus seis hijos. Su esposa le ha apoyado siempre y juntos han desarrollado un pequeño negocio en casa, en los momentos que no trabaja en el campo Don Miguel se dedica a su negocio familiar, sus dos hijos menores que aun estudian y están bajo su cargo también apoyan en el negocio. Miguel solicita el crédito para abastecer su negocio, el cual ha crecido su demanda grandemente en estos últimos meses, él necesita comprar granos básicos, jugos, gaseosas, embutidos, carnes y demás productos, los cuales serán ofrecidos a sus fieles clientes del barrio y demás comunidades.
texts.en: Miguel Ángel lives in the San Pedro barrio of the Contales department in Nicaragua. In spite of being 52 years old, he continues to work in the country growing crops. This work allowed him to bring up his six children. Miguel's wife has always supported him and together the couple has started up a small business in their home. When they are not working in the field, Miguel works at the family business. His two youngest children - who are still in school and under Miguel's responsibility - also support him with the business. Miguel is applying for this loan in order to stock up his business as demand has increased in the last few months. Miguel needs to buy basic grains, juices, fizzy drinks, cold meats, meat and other products which he will offer to his loyal local customers, and to other passers-by,

loans.use: to buy basic grains, juices, fizzy drinks, cold meats, meat and other products

loans.name: Judith Isabel

texts.es:
La Señora Judith  forma parte del grupo de crédito Futuro para un Bienestar. Vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es de un clima frió, tiene una arquitectura la que es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad.
La Señora Judith tiene 50 años de edad, está casada pero no ha concebido hijos, su esposo es de profesión chofer y labora conduciendo un camión, la casa en la que viven es propia.
La Doña Judith  se dedica a trabajar en una tienda de abarrotes que es de su propiedad, en este negocio le dedica todo el tiempo posible para crecer más en el negocio. El dinero de su crédito anterior lo invirtió en la compra de víveres para ampliar su negocio, su nuevo crédito también es para comprar víveres para seguir creciendo en su tienda. Su grupo de crédito le gusta por la solidaridad, amistad y unión que existe entre todas las socias.
texts.en:
Judith is part of the Futuro Para Un Bienestar communal bank.  She lives in the outskirts of the city of Cuenca.  This city has a cold climate and architecture that has been a Cultural Heritage of Humanity site since December 1999.

Judith, age 50, is married, but she has no children.  Her husband is a driver and works driving a bus.  They live in their own house.

Judith works in her own grocery store.  She devotes all of the time possible to her business in order to make it grow.  She used the money from the previous loan to buy supplies to expand her business.

Her new loan is also to buy supplies to continue growing her store.  She likes her communal bank because of the solidarity, friendship, and unity that exists among all of the members.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Ubumwe Group

texts.fr: La cliente Nyirabarere est une commerçante et vice-présidente de l’association d’affaires «Ubumwe »,  entrepreneur expérimentée, dynamique, âgée de 43 ans et mère de 6 enfants qui tous étudient. La cliente est  une vendeuse des denrées alimentaires. Elle installe ses marchandises à son domicile tout au long de la rue  dans un quartier  animé. Elle commença ses affaires avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un agent dans une maison de gardiennage de la place. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a plus de 15 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 5 sacs de patates douces, des bananes et de farine de manioc. Ainsi, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique de guerre à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Nyirabarere is a merchant and vice-president of the Ubumwe business group. An experienced entrepreneur, she is 43 years old and a mother of six children, who all go to school. 

Nyirabarere sells foodstuffs. She displays her goods along a road in a busy area. She started this business with funds from her husband, who is a works as a caretaker. Later, she benefited from a loan with Hekima. She has been in this business for 15 years.

This new loan will serve to buy five sacs of sweet potatoes, bananas, and manioc flour.

Nyirabarere hopes to build a house and feed, clothe, and educate her children.

Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs, who lack access to traditional financial services, especially during this time of conflict in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy five sacs of sweet potatoes, bananas, and manioc flour

loans.name: Nuru Group

texts.fr: La cliente Desanges est une brave commerçante depuis 12 ans et membre d’une banque villageoise «Nuru». Senior entrepreneur, âgée de 33 ans, mariée et mère de 3 enfants tous étudient. Elle est couturière et vendeuse de matériels de couture au marché central de la ville et elle s’entraide avec son mari, comme lui aussi est couturier. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle va acheter des matériels de couture (tissus, ficelles, etc.). Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari.
