Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite renforcer son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en  leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflit dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Desanges has been a brave merchant for the past 12 years and is a member of the Nuru banc villageois. An experienced entrepreneur, she is 33 years old, married, and a mother of three children, who all go to school. Desanges is a seamstress and sells sewing materials in a market in the center of town. She started this business with funds from her husband, and they work together because he is also a tailor.

She is seeking a loan from Hekima to expand her business. She is going to buy sewing materials (fabric, string, etc.). 

In the future, she would like to increase her capital, and feed and educate her children. 

Desanges thanks Hekima for having chosen this work of supporting female entrepreneurs, who are excluded from traditional financial services and who lack collateral, especially during this post-conflict period in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy sewing materials (fabric, string, etc.)

loans.name: Lien

texts.en:
Lien, 45, is married and lives in Ho Chi Minh City with her husband and two daughters. Lien and her husband support their family by running a food stall. They started seven years ago, selling noodles with beef to people in their community. 

Lien is requesting a loan to expand her business by buying good-quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall. She hopes that this will enable her to attract more customers and that she will be able to increase the turnover of her business. 

She hopes that through the loan, she will be able to expand her business activities and have money to reinvest in her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy good-quality food and many kinds of soft drinks to stock her stall.

loans.name: Alba Dolores

texts.es: Alba Dolores, quien habita en la ciudad de El Rama, es una mujer muy trabajadora. Por años se ha dedicado a la producción y comercialización de huevos de gallina de granja. Ella ha sido un pilar fuerte en su familia, junto a su esposo han procreados dos inteligentes hijos, los cuales no desaprovechan las oportunidades que les brindan sus padres para estudiar. Los adolescentes en sus tiempos libres apoyan a su mamá a cuidar la granja compuesta por menos de una docena de gallinas productoras. Alba solicita el crédito para comprar 50 gallinas, lo que permitirá incrementar la producción de huevos que comercializa en su casa.
texts.en:
Alba Dolores, a very hard-working woman, lives in the city of El Rama.  For years she has devoted herself to the production and commercialization of eggs from farm hens.  She has been a strong pillar in her family.  She and her husband have two intelligent children, who do not waste the educational opportunity that their parents give them.  In their free time the children help their mother care for the farm, which is comprised of at least a dozen productive hens.

Alba is requesting the loan in order to buy 50 hens.  This will allow her to increase the egg production, which she sells at her house.

loans.use: to buy 50 hens.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is 32 years old and is married with two children, ages 7  and 5 years old.

John has run a general shop for many years. He has applied for his fourth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to enable him buy sugar, fat and flour.

He hopes to improve his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy sugar, fat and flour.

loans.name: Wycliffe

texts.en:
Wycliffe is a 36-year-old man from Kakamega. He is married to Lydia, a business woman in the same town.  They have been blessed with one child who is 4 months old.

He operates a retail shop and earns an average income of 22,400 KES.  

He requests a second loan of 20,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya to buy more goods to sell. 

He will use the anticipated profits to repay the loan and add to his savings
.
His dream is to give his child a very good education.

loans.use: to upgrade his shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her inventory.

loans.name: Tuyet's Group

texts.en:
Tuyet is a 55-year-old married woman ith three children. She lives with her family in Ho Chi Minh City. Her husband is retired. Tuyet has run a coffee shop in front of her house for 16 years. 

Tuyet is the Group Leader of a 7-member loan group that live in Ho Chi Minh City. She is pictured in the first row, wearing a black and white dotted t-shirt. Each of the other group members request loans to fund income-generating activities.

Tuyet requests a loan to expand her business by buying new furniture and coffee to better satisfy her customers.

She hopes that her business will run smoothly and will generate a higher income.  This will help to improve her family's living conditions and send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy new furniture and coffee for her cafe.

loans.name: Xoa

texts.en: Xoa requests a new loan to buy new clothes to sell. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will help her to increase the size of her business and income.  She will also be able to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy many kinds of clothes to sell.

loans.name: Hanh

texts.en:
Hanh requests a new loan to buy rice and quality food to sell to her customers. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. 

Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that the new loan will allow her to increase the size of her food stall and increase sales.  This will help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice and quality food to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip is a 27-year-old married man from Nyandarua South. He has two children who are 4 and 3 years old.

Philip has farmed for many years. He has applied for his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy seedlings and fertilizer. 

He hopes to expand his business in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Adelia

texts.pt:
Mãe de 7 filhos, dos quais 1 maior de idade que voltou do lar, todos na sua responsabilidade, tem 38 anos de idade, vive maritalmente com marido líder comunitário, depende de negocio que faz numa barraca em sua casa.
Esta a tomar pela primeira vez o empréstimo com a Hluvuku e com ele pretende comprar produtos como: açúcar, arroz, feijão, óleo, cebola, farinha, diversas bebidas, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio que é a sua maior fonte de renda, para além do subsidio do marido.
Seu maior sonho é desenvolver o seu negocio e garantir melhores condições para seus filhos.
Diz não ter muitas dificuldades, porque se sente um pouco estável na vida.
texts.en:
Adelia is the mother of 7 children, 1 of whom is of age but lives at home, and all are her responsibility. She is 38 years old, lives with her husband who is a community leader and she is dependent on her business which she conducts out of a stall at her home.

This is the first time she is taking a loan from Hluvuku and with it she intends to buy products such as: rice, sugar, beans, oil, onions, flours, various drinks, etc to expand her business which is her largest source of income, aside from her husband's subsidy.

Her biggest dream is to develop her business and guarantee better living conditions for her children.
She says she doesn't have many challenges as she feels relatively stable in life.

loans.use: buy products such as: rice, sugar, beans, oil, onions, flours, various drinks, etc to expand her business

loans.name: Las Margaritas Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Las Margaritas” La cual  está constituida por 07 socias emprendedoras y entusiastas. Lidivina de 49 años de edad es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de abarrotes como azúcar y fideos. El deseo de Lidivina es ampliar su negocio incrementando el volumen de sus productos. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de harina, aceite, azúcar y fideos. El grupo “Las Margaritas” agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Lidivina es la segunda del lado derecho y viste polo rosado. Giuliana se encuentra en la  parte superior a lado izquierdo, la cual no pudo estar a tiempo por motivo de trabajo.
texts.en: This is the new group 'Las Margaritas', made up of 7 self-motivated and enthusiastic female associates. Lidivina is 49 years old and single. Her work is selling groceries such as sugar and noodles. Lidivina's wish is to expand her business, increasing the volume of her products. She requested the loan to buy flour, oil, sugar and noodles. Lidivina is the second one from the right side in the pink polo shirt. The one in the upper left-hand corner is Giuliana, who could not be on time because of work. The Las Margaritas Group is grateful to all the people that facilitated this loan.

loans.use: to buy flour, oil, sugar and noodles.

loans.name: Albertina

texts.pt:
Vive maritalmente, mãe de 42 anos com 8 filhos 2 dos quais já com seus lares e 6 ainda na sua responsabilidade e 4 com idade escolar se encontram a estudar, vive na casa própria à base de negocio e conta com ajuda do esposo também negociante, para alem do negocio, trabalha nas machambas para aumentar o rendimento mensal na família e também costura roupas de crianças para vender e esta a repetir pela 4ªvez o credito com a Hluvuku.
Com o empréstimo pretende comprar: capulanas, chinelos, calças plásticas de bebés, roupa interior, etc, para ampliar o seu negocio que é feito pelo seu marido como ambulante de bicicleta, que entra ate as zonas longínquas do distrito. 
Ela tem sonho de poder concluir a construção de sua casa, desenvolver mais o seu negocio e construir uma barraca. 
Seu grande desafio é o facto de ter uma família muito alargada, isto é, muitos filhos e com o custo de vida tem dificuldades para sustenta-la e muita concorrência no negócio
texts.en:
Albertina lives with her partner and is a 42 year old mother of 8 children, 2 of whom already have their own homes. 6 are still her responsibility and 4 are of school-going age and are studying. She lives in a house she owns and lives off her business as well as counting on help from her husband who is also a trader. Aside from her business she works on plantations to increase her family's monthly income and also sews children's clothes to sell.

This is her 4th loan with Hluvuku. With it she plans to buy: African cloths, sandals, plastic pants for babies, underwear, etc, to expand her business selling these things with her husband on a bicycle to the far corners of the district.

Her dream is to be able to finish building her home, expand her business and to build a small store.
Her biggest challenge is the fact that she has a large family, i.e., lots of children and with the current cost of living she has difficulty in supporting them. She also has a lot of competition in her business.

loans.use: to buy: African cloths, sandals, plastic pants for babies, underwear, etc, to expand her business

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en:
Lucy is a 30-year-old woman from Nyandarua.  She is married to Ngingi and has two children who are 13 and 5 years old.

Lucy has been a farmer for the past two years. She has applied for her first loan from VisionFund Kenya to buy seedlings and fertilizer to use in her farm.

She hopes to improve her living standards in the near future.

loans.use: to buy seedlings and fertilizer.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en:
Charles is a 35-year-old married man with one child.  He runs a food kiosk in Ngaraiga in the outskirts of Limuru.  He has been in this business for four years and earns a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings.

This will be Charles's third loan with VisionFund Kenya. He plans to use the entire loan to buy items for his business. 

In the future, Charles hopes to expand in business and educate his children.

loans.use: to purchase rice, beans, and sugar.

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose has a tailoring business in Nairobi and provides tailoring and embroidery services. She has been in this business for the last 10 years and her current monthly income is KES 20,000.  

Rose is a 42-year-old married woman with one child. 

She will use this loan to buy  fabric, thread, rings and a new sewing machine. She will use the anticipated profits to start another type of business selling clothes.

This is her fourth loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she has successfully repaid her previous loans. In future, Rose hopes to expand her business and have a good family.

loans.use: to buy fabric and a new sewing machine.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase stocks of dried fish.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for the eight course levels and to buy course materials, which are essential.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy quarried stones, cement blocks, cement, zinc, and to pay for the labor.

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is 43 years old.  He is from Nyandarua South and he is married. He and his wife have four children who are between the ages of 4 and 19 years old.

Harun has been doing farming for many years and has applied for a loan from Vision Fund Kenya. He is planning to use the loan money to buy a shift cutter. He hopes to improve his family's livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: To buy a shift cutter

loans.name: Samson

texts.en:
Samson is 39 years old. He is from Nyandarua and he is married. He and his wife have two children, ages 10 and 14 years old.

Samson has been working at timber cutting for many years. He has applied for his fourth loan from Vision Fund Kenya to help him buy timber to add to his stock. He hopes to improve his livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: To buy timber

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is single and a mother of one child. She operates a tractor, which is used in land plowing, to earn a living and she makes a good living from this. With her generated income from this business, she has provided for their needs, and had successfully paid her previous loan used to purchase the tractor.

To make her business more accessible and to solicit more clients for the services, she took a new loan to repair her motorcycle used for transportation purposes.

In the future, she hopes to expand her business and she also wants to improve her living situation in the near future..

loans.use: to repair her motorcycle used for transportation purposes

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a pig farmer and he also deals in selling firewood.  He has been in business for 13 years. Simon is married and together he and his wife have been blessed with four children. Simon is 51 years old. He currently makes a monthly income of KES 25,000. His wife also provides additional income. 

Simon has successfully repaid all his previous loans, and this is his third loan term. He would like this loan in order to purchase a new motorcycle for transporting firewood and pigs. His future hope is to be successful in his business.

loans.use: To buy a motorcycle for transporting firewood and pigs

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en:
Patrick is a 46-year-old hard working married man with five children, living in Kamwenge, Uganda. His main business is cattle fattening and selling, alongside agriculture, where he earns an extra living. He started this business to increase his income and look after his family.  He has hardships of competition, theft of his cows, and dry seasons that affect his general income. However, his vision is to increase the size of his farm.
 
Patrick is requesting a loan to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.use: to buy more cattle for his farm.

loans.name: Yovan

texts.en:
Yovan is a 39-year-old man living in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He is married and has four children. Yovan has a drug shop (pharmacy) that helps him earn some income to run his home affairs and to get some cocoa produce from his garden, which he sells to supplement his income. 

Yovan hopes to educate his children to higher levels of education, despite being challenged by inadequate capital. He needs a loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: To pay school fees for his children

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs like fertilizer, manure and mulch for his farm.

loans.name: Ramthan

texts.en:
Ramathan used his previous loan to buy cows to sell as meat. He has got a butchery located in a market stall that sells meat. Ramathan started his business in 1993 due to inspiration from his grandfather.

Ramathan hopes to expand his business into new markets, though he faces a challenge of competition and inadequate capital. Ramathan is a hardworking man who needs another loan to buy cows to sell as meat.

loans.use: to buy cows to sell as meat.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah is a forty-seven-year-old single mother living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She owns a retail shop as her main source of income and gets extra income from agriculture. She started up this business so that she could earn herself a living. She has personal goals of expanding the retail shop into a wholesale business and building a permanent house, though she faces a problem of price changes. 

Sarah intends to use the loan to buy more soap, salt, sugar, drinks and other items to sell.

loans.use: to buy more soap, salt, sugar, drinks and other items to sell.

loans.name: Edward

texts.en:
Edward is a hard-working retailer dealing in general merchandise in Hoima, Uganda.He is thirty-eight years old. He is married with three children, two of whom attend school. He earns side income from salary. His clients are residents of his area. He desires to furnish his house only to be challenged by inadequate capital and delays in salary payment. 

Edward is requesting a loan to buy materials like cement and paint for furnishing his house.

loans.use: buy materials like cement and paint for furnishing his house.

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty used her previous loan to buy beverages to sell. The beverages included sodas, milk, and water. Betty started her business so as to earn a living. She wishes to be a self-sustaining woman. However, the challenge of customers who take goods on credit affects her expected monthly income.

Betty is requesting a loan to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.use: to buy soft drinks to sell.

loans.name: Matwopig Group

texts.en:
Proscovia is a 52-year-old woman. She has a gift shop that sells flowers, ribbons, glasses, and plastic chairs on a busy street. Proscovia started her business due to the demand of the community and the expected increase in income. She wishes to buy more chairs and tents for hiring out so as to earn immediate income. However, she is challenged by the competition of new entrants into the business who charge very low prices but offer poor quality items. 

Proscovia wants a loan to buy more stock of ribbons and glasses to sell. She is a member of the Matwopig group, where members guarantee each other in order to acquire loans.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ribbons and glasses to sell.

loans.name: Tabitha

texts.en: This is Tabitha. Her previous loan was a big help in her business. She was able to purchase more feed for her poultry business. Besides the poultry business, Tabitha operates a fruits and vegetables business. She would like to apply for a loan to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and other vegetables for her business. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, onions, tomatoes and other vegetables for her business

loans.name: Emad

texts.en:
This is 22 year-old Emad. He is a single man, living with his family in Taiz, Yemen. Emad studied until secondary school, but he didn't finish his studies. He decided to begin his own business. In 2010, Emad started his own business because he realized that it would be profitable due to a new settlement area. With support from his father, Emad could open a phone and accessories store. His business is located in a good area of town and his main customers are the public. He works six days a week and 10 hours a day and gets support every month.  

Emad warmly thanks Kiva lenders who helped him with his first loan. That loan helped him very much in developing his business and purchasing more goods. His profits also increased since he was able to meet the demands of different types of customers. Having successfully repaid all the installments for the previous loan, Emad is requesting another loan to expand his business more by purchasing more phone accessories. He has applied for a loan of 300,000 YER to strengthen his business. He hopes that this loan will increase his stock, result in more customers, and help him earn a higher profit.

In the future, Emad plans to get a bigger store to supply larger quantities of goods. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase phone accessories and recharge cards for expanding his business.

loans.name: Nuevo Progreso 2 Group

texts.en:
Andrea is the coordinator for “Nuevo Progreso 2” (New Progress 2). She and the other members of her group strive each day to conduct their business activities in their community so that they can improve their incomes. They also motivate other women to engage in their own businesses so that they can help their families get ahead. 

Andrea manages a general store where she sells different products like clothes, shoes, cosmetics and other products. She started her business because she needed to generate income for her family. She is receiving her ninth loan and will invest to increase her inventory by buying miscellaneous products. She is the mother of three children who she raises along with her husband. They live in a modest home in one of the most impoverished and least accessible neighborhoods in the city of Santo Domingo. Andrea is dreaming of having a house that is solid, well-built, and weather-resistant where she can establish her business.

loans.use: To buy miscellaneous products (clothes, shoes, etc.)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a post-graduate course.

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella has managed a printing press business in her community for many years, earning well for the family. She always finds ways to please the needs of her customers. 

With her generated income, she had provided for her family's daily expenditures, and had successfully paid her previous loan used for printing machine repair. 

To improve the business, she wants to buy printing materials like ink, bond paper and other supplies. 

She wants to expand her business and let her children manage it in the near future.

loans.use: to buy printing materials like ink, bond paper and other supplies

loans.name: Genoviva

texts.en:
Genoviva is 53-years-old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, sugar, spices, etc. to sell.

Genoviva has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Genoviva aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, sugar, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Kyegenywa Kolping Group

texts.en:
John is 49 years old. He grows crops like maize and also keeps animals like goats, cows, pigs, and chicken. John collects rental fees from his rentals to add to his income. He started his business so as to earn a living and his major clients are from the general public. 

John hopes to educate his children and to start a transport business. However, he faces challenges of weather changes, inadequate capital, and price fluctuations. He wants a loan to pay for weeding, plowing, and buying chemicals.

John is a member of Kyegenywa Kolping group where members guarantee one another to get a loan, as they do not pledge security.

loans.use: to pay for weeding, plowing, and buying chemicals

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Gilda works hard to support her family.

She has a restaurant business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Gilda is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business for her restaurant.

Gilda has been sustaining her business activities through her past 30 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Swaleh

texts.en: Swaleh lives in Hoima, Uganda. He is married with two children. He deals in the glass-cutting business. He started the business so as to generate family income. He earns side income from salary. His clients are business men and women. He hopes to grow the business but competition is very stiff. Swaleh is getting a loan to finish his house (plastering it).

loans.use: finish his house (plastering it)

loans.name: Flavia

texts.en: Flavia is a thirty-eight-year-old female. She has a restaurant on a busy street and does farming for additional income. Flavia started the business to cater to the family's needs. People with in Bweyale town are her major clients. Flavia hopes to educate her children, being the only bread-winner of her family, but faces a difficulty of limited customers. Flavia wants a loan to buy drinks and generator.

loans.use: to buy drinks and a generator.

loans.name: Wilber

texts.en:
Wilber is a 46-year-old man, married with 6 children. He deals in cattle fattening and selling bananas.

He applied for a loan in UGAFODE Microfinance Limited (MDI) Rukungiri branch. The previous loan has helped Wilber to improve and develop his business. With this current loan he is taking, Wilber is going to pay tuition for his children. Wilber does appreciate UGAFODE and the Kiva family for the financial support.

loans.use: To pay tuition

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a wood carver who specializes in West African masks. He would like to buy raw materials and hire assistants for his workshop. Samuel has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story: "I used to work as a messenger in a bank, but I realized I could do much better things with my life so I decided to go into arts, especially carving. I did not really undergo any actually training, but started carving bit by bit and sometimes sought help from my other colleagues. Sometimes I assisted them too. Eventually I became very skilled in carving and I then decided to settle for full time carving and depend solely on my own ideas to carve. Now I have assistants and I also train other carvers." "I am always grateful for the wonderful help you are giving to me. You enable me to increase my stock for the benefit of my family. Thank you!" Use the link below to view Samuel's hand-carved wood masks and sculptures on the NOVICA site: http://www.novica.com/kiva/2104

loans.use: to buy raw materials for his masks and hire assistants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay up to level eight of an English course and to buy essential materials for the course.

loans.name: Nancy Francisca

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Nancy, tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen 6  hijos, 5  mayores de edad y uno de 16 años el cual aun viven en su casa. Su esposo trabaja en una empresa local.
Doña Nancy es  una  mujer que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para así lograr sus propios ingresos por el bien de su familia, ella tiene una carreta en un centro de la ciudad, este lugar es muy concurrido  todos los días ya que esta frente al palacio de Justica de la ciudad, allí ella vende agua de coco helada y también deliciosas ensaladas de fruta que ella misma prepara en su casa y que es muy apetecida por sus clientes que a diario pasan por el lugar y se refrescan con estas deliciosas bebidas, lleva más de un  año con este negocio el cual le permite ganar algo para el bien de su familia.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar cocos y  frutas para la preparación de la ensalada de frutas. Lleva más de 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los beneficios que recibe de la institución.  Sus sueños son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The "San Patricio" loan group meets every fortnight in the Cuba barrio of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year round. The city is also known for its many tourist attractions and unbeatable beauty.

And it is here that 47-year-old Nancy lives. She is married and has six children. Five of the children are adults while the youngest is 16 years old and still lives at home. Nancy's husband works for a local business.

Nancy has always liked to work in order to earn her own income to look after the family. She has a cart in the city centre and, being opposite the city court, the area is frequented by many people every day of the week. At this cart, Nancy sells frozen coconut water and delicious fruit salads that she prepares herself. Her products are popular with her customers who come by every day to refresh themselves with these delicious drinks. Nancy has had the business for over a year and it allows her to earn an income to look after her family.

This loan will be used to buy coconuts and fruits for preparing the fruit salads. Nancy has been a member of the loan group for over ten years and she likes it because of the benefits that she receives. Nancy's dream is to prosper with her business.

loans.use: to buy coconuts and fruits.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for website upgrades and expansion of marketing.

loans.name: Amy

texts.en:
Amy was pursuing a degree in legal studies when she decided to take her education to the next level. During her final years at NOVA Southeastern University, she founded First Choice Title & Escrow Services, Inc. It has been in business for the past eight years. Amy has steadily seen an increase in her customer base. 

Using her vast experience in the industry, Amy assists banks and mortgage companies with title transfers for properties and recording warranty deeds. While she has the experience and vision to succeed, her student loans inhibit Amy from properly expanding. With this loan, she hopes to increase her marketing efforts and professionally compile a portfolio to distribute to potential clients. 

Amy has a clear vision, and with your support, the resources to turn her business into a thriving success!

loans.use: to obtain working capital and increase marketing efforts.

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business buying and selling used clothes in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock like blouses, shorts, etc. to sell for her business.

Gina has been in this business for six years. Gina earns more income from buying and selling frozen foods.

Gina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like blouses, shorts, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hodari Group

texts.fr: Maneno est une brave commerçante et trésorière d’une banque villageoise «Hodari», senior entrepreneur, dynamique, âgée de 32 ans, célibataire responsable. La cliente est vendeuse des pagnes (métrage). Elle installe sa marchandise sur la rue dans une avenue animée de la ville. Elle commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de sa mère. Plus tard, elle bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 13 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 50 pièces de pagnes. Ainsi, elle souhaite acheter une parcelle et la construire pour une meilleure préparation future. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout; pendant ce moment difficile post conflits dans la région de l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Maneno is a brave merchant and the treasurer of the Hodari banque villageoise. An experienced entrepreneur, she is dynamic and responsible. She is 32 years old and single.

Maneno sells pagnes [bright, colorful fabric] by the meter. She displays her goods along a road in a busy part of town. She started this business 13 years ago with funds from her mother. Later, she benefited from a loan from Hekima.

This new loan will serve to buy 50 lengths of pagnes.

Maneno hopes to buy a piece of land and build a house to prepare for the future.

Finally, Maneno strongly thanks Hekima for their support of small-scale entrepreneurs who are excluded from traditional banking services, especially during this difficult post-conflict time in the eastern part of the country.

loans.use: to buy 50 lengths of pagne [bright, colorful fabric]

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith, aged twenty-seven, lives in Hoima, Uganda. She is single and has a retail shop as her primary business. She gets side income from sugarcane growing. She desires to expand her business into new markets although high rent costs affect her business.

Judith is acquiring a loan to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy general merchandise such as sugar and soap to sell.

loans.name: Etoile Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Yema est une Couturière depuis 20 ans, trésorière et membre d’un collectif d’Affaires «Etoile» âgée de 40 ans, veuve et mère de 3 enfants qui  tous étudient. Elle vendeuse des matériels de couture et sociétaire d’un atelier. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter des nouveaux matériels (Tissus, machine à coudre, ficelles etc). Elle démarra avec de  fonds  reçu de son mari lors de son vivant. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser,  nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle. Il sied de signaler q'une cliente porte dans ses mains son bébé.
texts.en:
Yema has been a seamstress for 20 years and is a member and treasurer for the Etoile business group. She is 40 years old, a widow, and a mother of three children, who all go to school. 

Yema sells sewing materials and is a share owner of a workshop. She started this business with funds from her husband when he was alive. She is seeking a loan from Hekima in order to expand her business.

This new loan will serve to buy new materials (fabric, a sewing machine, string, etc.).

In the future, she wishes to build a house, and feed and educate her children.

Yema thanks Hekima for their support to female entrepreneurs even those who lack collateral.

To note: one member is holding her child in the photo.

loans.use: to buy new materials (fabric, sewing machine, string, etc.)

loans.name: Dunda Mu Yesu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Tatine est une commerçante et membre d’un collectif d’affaires « Dunda mu Yesu », entrepreneur âgée de 32 ans, mariée  et mère de 5 enfants  dont 2 étudient et 3 autres sont encore gamins. La cliente est une vendeuse des divers  matériaux de construction. Elle étale sa marchandise dans un dépôt du quartier animé de la ville. Elle commença ses business avec  de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un technicien charpentier. Il y a 5 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 30 sacs de ciment, 150 sacs de chaux, vernis etc. Ainsi, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. Au finish, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique post conflits à l’Est du pays. Il sied de signaler que certaines clientes portent leur bébés.
texts.en:
Tatine is a merchant and a member of the Dunda Mu Yesu business group. She is an entrepreneur, 32 years old, married, and a mother of five children, of whom two study and the other three are still toddlers. 

Tatine has been selling different types of construction materials for five years. She displays her goods in a warehouse in a busy party of town. She started her business with funds from her husband, who is a technician and carpenter. 

This new loan will serve to buy 30 sacs of cement, 150 sacs of lime, varnish, etc. 

Tatine wishes to increase her capital, and feed, clothe, and educate her children.

Finally, she strongly thanks Hekima for their support to female entrepreneurs who lack access to financial services, especially during this critical post-conflict time in the eastern part of the country. 

To note: some members are holding their children in the photo.

loans.use: to buy 30 sacs of cement,150 sacs of lime, varnish, etc.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a 40-year-old married man with six children living in Fort Portal, Uganda. He has been in the retail business for the last seven years, alongside farming to supplement his income. He ventured into this business because he is not educated and wanted to employ himself and support his family. He faces a difficulty of defaulters but has a dream of buying a tipper lorry (dump truck) for a transportation business.

Jimmy intends to use the loan to buy a groundnut pounding machine and finish payment of his plot of land.

loans.use: to buy a groundnut pounding machine and finish payment of his plot.

loans.name: Regina

texts.en:
Regina is a fifty-four-year-old married woman living in Kamwenge, Uganda. She deals in the selling of second-hand clothes as her main source of income alongside agriculture. She started this business to look after her family and pay school fees for her children. She faces a number of challenges including competition, seasonal customers and high rates of run-away defaulters, but she has hopes that she will become a prominent businesswoman and she will own a wholesale boutique.

She is requesting a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell during this Easter season.

loans.use: to buy more second-hand clothes to sell during this Easter season.

loans.name: Jafali

texts.en:
Jafari, who used his previous loan to buy litres of petrol to sell, is a forty-nine-year-old married man with four children living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He also practices farming alongside petrol selling. He has hopes of expanding his business into a big petrol station, only to be challenged by inadequate capital.

He is requesting a loan to buy more litres of petrol to sell.

loans.use: to buy litres of petrol to sell.

loans.name: Lissette

texts.en:
Lissette owned and operated a successful optical storefront in Ecuador but chose to come to the United States eight years ago in pursuit of opportunities for her two sons. She was able to sell her business and now operates a similar enterprise here in the US. 

She loves the freedom that comes with running one’s own business but acknowledges the risks as well. She struggled during the recession and often runs deficits during the slow seasons; however, thanks to proven tactics and great service, she has secured financial freedom for herself and two children. 

Due to the recession, she is still recovering and hopes to expand. Lissette needs capital in order to increase her inventory and restructure her store front. Help Lissette accomplish her dreams of financial independence for herself and her two children!

loans.use: to increase her inventory and restructure storefront

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Growing up in Cape Cod, Christine always had this vision of owning her own business, and therefore always sought new and innovative ideas. One day, she began to notice the massive amount of summer homes that remained vacant for the majority of the year. She took a chance and founded Lower Cape Caretaking and Property with the purpose of providing maintenance and regular checkups on individual homes during the course of the winter for home owners living in other areas of the country. 

Her business met instant success and rapidly increased in size. Christine has shown unrivaled passion and hopes to continue to expand as quickly as she has been for the past three years. However, she needs to create an office in order to expand and needs working capital to help the business survive the off-season.

Help this mother of two expand her business and fulfill her vision of success for the company!

loans.use: to upgrade her office and have working capital for the off-season

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase cleaning equipment

loans.name: María Marlene

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nueva Kennedy se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene  45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de ellos aún viven con ella. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña María junto al esposo se dedican a la venta de frutas y legumbres en un mercado de Montecristi, ellos muy de mañana se van hasta el mercado a comprar los productos a comerciantes mayoristas y una vez que tienen los productos arman un pequeño puesto en el mercado local en el cual venden los productos a los clientes que a diario llegan hasta este centro de abasto para comprar los alimentos. Llevan más de 11 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual han sacado adelante a sus hijos.	
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar legumbres y frutas para la venta diaria. Es socia fundadora del Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque gracias a los créditos ellos financian su negocio. Sus sueños son tener una gran tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The “Kennedy New Credit Group” gathers each 15 days in Canton Montecristi, known for its rich colonial culture and its artisan crafts, recognized both nationally and internationally. This is where the famous [Panama] hats are made using the local 'toquilla' straw.

Here resides Maria, who is 45 years old and married. From this union sprang 3 children, all now adults, 2 of whom still live with Maria. Her husband is a merchant.

Maria and her husband sell fruits and vegetables in a market in Montecristi. They go to the market very early in the morning to buy their products from wholesale merchants and once they have them, they stock their small post in the local market where they sell these products to customers who came daily to the market center to buy food. Maria and her husband have devoted themselves to this activity for more than 11 years, and have advanced their children with the earnings.	

This loan will be used to purchase vegetables and fruits to sell daily. Maria was a founding member of her credit group and she likes it because, thanks to these loans, they can finance their business. Their dream is one day to have a grand grocery store.

loans.use: buy vegetables and fruits to sell.

loans.name: Joseline Melani

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Joseline, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un  hijo de 3 años de edad. Su esposo trabaja en un  almacén.
Doña Joseline es una joven muy trabajadora ya que aparte de ser una gran madre y esposa ella trabaja en una empresa de la ciudad, pero para lograr más ganancias por el bienestar de su familia también se dedica a la venta de joyas hechas en plata, les vende a sus compañeros de trabajo y también sale a vender en las noches y fines de semana cuando está desocupada.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar joyas hechas en plata. Lleva 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con el primer crédito empezó su negocio. Sus sueños son darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The "San Patricio" loan group meets every fortnight in the Cuba barrio of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches that are visited all year round. The city is also known for its many tourist attractions and unbeatable beauty.

And it is here that 22-year-old Joseline lives. She is married and has a three-year-old son. Her husband works in a wholesale shop.

Joseline is a hard-working young woman who, aside from being a great mother and wife, works at a business in the city. In order to earn more for her family, though, she also works selling gold jewellery to colleagues and. In addition she goes out to sell her goods in the evenings and at the weekend when she is free.

This loan will be used to buy gold jewellery. Joseline has been with the loan group for two years and she likes it because she used her first loan to start her business. Joseline's dream is to give her son the best she can.

loans.use: to buy gold jewellery.

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is 45 years old and married with two children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell.

Jessica has borrowed and repaid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming sugarcane.

Jessica aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, sugar, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is 50 years old and married with six children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Jocelyn is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jocelyn has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Lilia works hard to support her family.

She has a pig fattening business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Lilia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pig fattening business.

Lilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Lolita has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF.  She dreams to save enough to build a house for her family in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Meribeth

texts.en:
Meribeth is 36 years old, married and has two children, who are in school.  

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Meribeth requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Meribeth has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old and has three children.  Marilyn is married and has two children who are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Marilyn requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of feed.

Marilyn has been doing pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Marilyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of feed

loans.name: Genalyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of ten children, Genalyn works hard to support her family.

She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from her general store.  Genalyn is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle for her motorcycle transport business.

Genalyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 12 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle

loans.name: Jeannie Hill

texts.en:
Jeannie Hill is 26 years old and married with three children, who are in school. Jeannie Hill works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, coffee, etc. to sell.

Jeannie Hill has been in this business for four years. 

In the future Jeannie Hill would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, biscuits, coffee, etc. to sell

loans.name: Myra

texts.en:
Myra is 43 years old and married with six children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like oil, soy sauce, spices, etc. to sell.

Myra has borrowed and repaid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years and also earns an income from buying and selling frozen foods.

She aspires to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like oil, soy sauce, spices, etc. to sell

loans.name: Vivian

texts.en:
Vivian is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell rice business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

Vivian has been in this business for five years. She earns additional income from pig fattening.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for a degree course.

loans.name: Cherry Ann

texts.en:
Cherry Ann is 33 years old, living at Buntun with her family. Her spouse is a van driver while she makes and sells peanut butter to her neighborhood and nearby villages, too. 

Cherry Ann is now asking for P5,000 as additional capital for improving her business. She will buy plastic bottles for packaging, peanuts, and cooking oil to use in making and selling peanut butter. 

In the future, Cherry Ann wants to put labels on her products for better marketing; that will help increase her sales capacity.

loans.use: to buy plastic bottles for packaging, peanuts, and cooking oil

loans.name: Elina Cleofa

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Elina, tiene 44 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 21 y 15 años que estudian el mayor en universidad y la menor en colegio. El marido es ebanista. 
Doña Elina y su esposo tienen un taller de ebanistería en el cual trabaja toda la familia, ellos elaboran todos tipo de muebles, mientras su marido y su hijo le dan la forma a la madera ella se encarga de elaborar los tapizados para que sus muebles tengan un bello acabado al gusto de sus clientes. Llevan más de 20 años dedicados a esta actividad con la cual salen adelante.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar madera, pinturas, tapices y muchos otros materiales para fabricar los muebles. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los  créditos mejoran su taller. Sus sueños son seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The San Patricio credit group meets every two weeks in the Cuba neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular during every season of the year.  It is also known for being a city with an unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Señora Elina lives in this place.  She is 44 years old and lives in a common-law relationship.  She has two children, ages 15 and 21, from her relationship.  The older child is a university student and the younger is in high school.  Her partner is a maker of fine furniture.

Doña Elina and her partner have a fine furniture workshop where the entire family works.  They create every type of furniture.  While her partner and child shape the wood, she is in charge of making the upholstery so that the furniture has a beautiful finish matching the customers’ tastes.  They have been doing this for more than twenty years, and it is how they are getting ahead.

She is going to use this loan to buy wood, paints, tapestry fabric, and many other supplies to make furniture.  

She has been a part of the credit group from the beginning and she likes it because the loans improve her workshop.  Her dream is to get ahead.

loans.use: to buy wood, paints, tapestry fabric, and other materials.

loans.name: Leonardo Marcelo

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive don Leonardo, tiene 65 años de edad, hace varios años falleció su querida esposa pero de  esta relación tienen 6  hijos  mayores de edad, el vive en la casa de su hijo con la familia de este.
El señor Leonardo es  una  hombre  que siempre le ha gustado trabajar para así sacar adelante a su familia y ahora que ya está solo lo sigue haciendo, el tiene un pequeño puesto en la ciudadela en la cual vive donde vende periódicos, caramelos y otras golosinas, el también en este lugar vende ropa de todo tipo aunque también sale a ofrecer sus prendas por otros lugares de la ciudad, lleva más de cuatro  años con este negocio el cual le permite ganarse la vida.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar ropa, periódicos, caramelos y otras golosinas. Lleva 3 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del grupo.  Sus sueños son tener buena salud para seguir adelante.
texts.en:
The San Patricio credit group meets every two weeks in the Cuba neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches which are very popular during every season of the year.  It is also known for being a city with an unequaled beauty and many tourist attractions.

Leonardo lives in this place.  He is 65 years old.  His beloved wife passed away a number of years ago, but he has six adult children from that relationship.  He lives with his son and his son’s family, in their home.

Señor Leonardo is a man who has always enjoyed working in order to get his family ahead, and now that he is single he keeps it up.  He has a small stand selling newspapers, candies, and other treats in the neighborhood where he lives.  He also sells every type of clothing there, although he also goes out to offer the clothing in other places around the city.  For more than four years, he has been doing this business, which allows him to earn a living.

He is going to use this loan to buy clothing, newspapers, candies, and other treats.  He has been with the credit group for three loan cycles and he likes it because of the help he gets from the group.  His dream is to have good health so that he can keep going.

loans.use: to buy clothing, newspapers, candy, and other treats.

loans.name: Princess

texts.en:
Princess works hard to support her family. She is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business. She has been in this business for five years now.

In the future, Princess would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Salvacion works hard to support her family. She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening.  Salvacion is borrowing PHP 21,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell for her rice retailing business.

Salvacion has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Clarita

texts.en:
Clarita is fifty-nine years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Clarita's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Clarita has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 6,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials and pay for construction labor to rebuild her family home. 

Clarita is committed to rebuild her devastated life. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Julinda

texts.en:
Julinda is 58 years old and widowed with nine children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Julinda has a buy-and-sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Julinda requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional items like shirts, pants, and other clothes to sell.

In the future, Julinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like shirts, pants, and other clothes to sell.

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly is 59 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell: cigarettes, liqueur, canned goods, etc.

Cherly has been in this business for 20 years. In the future she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell: cigarettes, liqueuer, canned goods, etc

loans.name: Lusell

texts.en:
Lusell is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell mahogany seed business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of mahogany seeds to sell for her business.

Lusell has been in this business for five years. Lusell earns more income from motorcycle transport.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of mahogany seeds to sell

loans.name: Kenzhekul

texts.ru: Кенжекуль 49 лет, замужем, вместе с мужем воспитывает 3 детей. По хозяйству помогает супруг. У Кенжекуль - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи Кенжекуль занимается животноводством, стартовав 31 год назад с покупки скота на 3,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кенжекуль, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова и 10 овец, а также имеется земельный надел, где она выращивает сельскохозяйственную продукцию для собственного потребления и под реализацию. Ежемесячный доход составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кенжекуль обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом на покупку коров для откорма с последующей реализацией на рынке по высокой цене. Доходы от кредита Кенжекуль планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и намерена собрать средства на ремонт дома.
texts.en: Kenzhekul is 49, married, and has three children. Her spouse helps her around the house. She has a vocational education and earns her family's main income raising farm animals. She started 31 years ago when she bought cattle for 3,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, she currently has a milk cow and ten sheep, along with a plot of land where she plants crops for personal use and for sale. She earns about 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her farm, Kenzhekul applied for a loan with the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy cows to fatten and resell for a profit. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save money to repair her house.

loans.use: to buy cows

loans.name: Alleluya Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Safari est une brave commerçante depuis 3 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Alleluya» âgée de 39 ans, mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont 7 étudient et trois sont encore gosses. Elle est vendeuse du carburant. Elle installe sa marchandise sur la route principale de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir pour acheter 330 litres d'essence. Son conjoint, lui aussi est commerçant. Elle avait reçu son premier fonds par le biais de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire une belle maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, en leur accordant de crédit sans garantie matérielle.
texts.en:
Safari is a brave merchant with 3 years of experience, and a member of the business group Alleluya. She is 39 years old and married with 10 children, 7 of whom go to school while the other 3 are still toddlers. 

Safari sells fuel. She conducts her sales on the city’s main street. She initially launched her business with funding from her husband, also a merchant.

Safari is seeking a loan from Hekima to bolster her activity. She plans to buy 330 liters of gas. 

Safari’s plans for the future are to build a nice house and to provide for her children’s needs with respect to food and education. 

Safari wishes to thank Hekima for helping businesswomen who cannot use the traditional banking system by granting them loans without collateral.

loans.use: to buy 330 liters of gas for resale.

loans.name: Jenny Yanet

texts.es:
EL Grupo De Crédito Nueva Kennedy se reúne cada quince días en el Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía, que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.
En este lugar vive la señora Jenny, tiene  34 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 13 y 11 años que estudian en colegio. Su esposo trabaja en un torno, realiza soldaduras en barcos.
Doña Jenny es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo el cual no gana mucho en su trabajo se dedica a la venta de ropa, zapatos y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, ella trabaja dos a tres horas al día más que todo en horas de la mañana que es cuando sus hijos están estudiando y se le hace más fácil salir, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada ocho días. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad con la cual se ayuda para los gastos de estudios de sus hijos.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, zapatos, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Esta desde el inicio en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son que sus hijos tengan una buena educación.
texts.en:
"El Grupo de Crédito Nueva Kennedy" (the New Kennedy Credit Group) meets every fortnight in Montecristi Canton, an area recognized nationally and internationally for its rich precolonial culture and handicrafts. It is the location of the famous Panama hats.

Here lives Mrs. Jenny, who is 34 years old. She is married, and from this relationship has two children aged 13 and 11 who are studying in school. Her husband works on a lathe and welds on ships. 

Doña Jenny is a housewife who works selling clothes, shoes, and Avon and Yanbal products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfumes, and women's accessories), in order to obtain her own resources and help her husband, who does not make much at his work. She sells door-to-door, and she works two to three hours a day, usually in the morning when her children are studying and it is easier for her to leave.  She leaves her products on credit and charges for them every week. She has spent more than 5 years doing this activity, which supports the education expenses of her children.

This loan is to buy clothes, shoes, perfume, creams, cosmetics, and other things to sell. She has been in the Credit Group since its start and likes the help that the loans offer her. Her dream is that her children get a good education.

loans.use: to buy clothing, shoes, perfumes, creams, cosmetics, etc

loans.name: Maryjane

texts.en:
Maryjane runs a general store for a living, while her husband works as a security guard in a private company. Aside from this business, she also has a farm where the family gets their main source of income. 

With her generated income from business, her previous loan was used for buying stock and was successfully repaid. Recently, she took a new loan to purchase additional grocery goods to sell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional grocery goods to sell

loans.name: María Liliana

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora María, tiene 45 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad que aun vive con ella. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña María tiene una tienda de víveres en su casa en la cual vende todo tipo de productos, tanto productos de primera necesidad como también artículos de bazar, medicinas, pescado, carnes por libra, legumbres y helados que no hace mucho implemento en su negocio, allí trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, sus hijos y su esposo le ayudan en su trabajo cuando pueden,  su negocio lo tiene por más de 7  años el cual lo ha ido mejorando gracias a  los créditos.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes y otros productos de primera necesidad. Lleva 10 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos mejora su negocio.  Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio y que su tienda crezca cada día más.
texts.en:
The communal banking group "St. Patrick's credit" meets every two weeks in the Cuban neighborhood of the city of Manta.  The town is known for its beautiful beaches which are visited year round, and it is famous for its unparalleled beauty and many tourist attractions.

María lives in this city.  She is 45 years years old, is married, and has three children who live with her.  Her husband is a chofer.  

María has a grocery store in her home from which she sells all kinds of products, things for basic needs as well as crafts, medicines, fish, meat by the pound, vegetables, ice cream and more.  She works in her business every day from 6am until 8pm, and sometimes even later.  Her children and her husband help her when they are able.  She has had this business for more than seven years and it has been improving thanks to the loans from her communal bank.  

This loan will be used to supply her store.  She is going to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other staples for basic needs.  She has been with the communal bank for 10 years and she likes it because with loans she is able to improve her business.  Her goal is to continue making progress in her business and to help her store grow a bit each day.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, and other staples for basic needs.

loans.name: Felicita Monserrate

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Felicita, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos de  23, 15 y 11 años, las menores  estudian en colegio y escuela, todos sus hijos aun viven en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.
Doña Felicita realiza el crédito para ella y para su marido, ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa interior, CD con música cristiana y bisutería, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta y en su casa.  Su marido también se dedica al comercio él tiene un local en el centro de la ciudad que alquila donde vende cosméticos de todo tipo, ella lleva 11 años con su negocio mientras que su marido muchos años más, esta es la forma que conocen para salir adelante, siempre utilizan los créditos para mejorar su negocio,
Este crédito es para comprar biblias, ropa, CD, cosméticos y bisuterías. Lleva más de 2 años en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda para salir adelante, sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Grupo de Crédito San Patricio (St. Patrick Credit Group) meets every 15 days in the Cuba neighborhood of the city of Manta, a city known for its beautiful beaches and visited year-round and for being a city of beauty without equal with many tourist attractions. In this place lives the lady Felicita. She is 42 years old, is married and has three children aged 23, 15 and 11 from this marriage. The younger children study in primary and secondary school and all of her children live in their house. Her husband is a businessman. 

Doña Felicita is getting the loan for her and for her husband. She has a business selling underwear, CDs with Christian music and costume jewelry. Her methods of selling are door-to-door and in her home. Her husband also makes a living through business. He has a shop in the center of the city where he sells cosmetics of all types. Felicita has 11 years of experience with her business while her husband has many more. This is the way that they know to get ahead. They always utilize loans to improve their business.

This loan is to buy Bibles, clothing, CDs, cosmetics and costume jewelry. She has more than 2 years in the Grupo de Crédito and she likes it because of the help in getting ahead. Her dreams are to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to buy Bibles, clothing, CDs, cosmetics and costume jewelry.

loans.name: Fabiola Esther

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Fabiola, tiene 26 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 6 años que estudian en escuela. El marido trabaja en una empresa.
Doña Fabiola es una mujer que le gusta ganar lo suyo y con sus ganancias ayudarle a su marido a sacar adelante a sus hijos, ella los fines de semana instala una pequeña tercena en su barrio que es muy concurrido, sus clientes la prefieren porque ella vende la carne limpia y el peso correcto, es por eso que siempre vende todo lo que los proveedores le dejan en las mañanas.  Son más de 4 años que esta en este negocio y que le va muy bien.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar carne, hueso, hígado y todo tipo de carnes que vende en su tercena. Lleva 2 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que recibe del grupo.  Sus sueños son tener un gran local estable o un frigorífico.
texts.en:
The communal banking group "St. Patrick's Credit" meets every two weeks in the Cuban neighborhood of the city of Manta.  This city is known for its beautiful beaches that are visited year round and for being a city of unequaled beauty with many attractive tourist sites.  

Fabiola lives in this town.  She is 26 years old and has a life-partner with whom she has two children ages 7 and 6.  They are in school.  Her partner works in a business.

Fabiola is a woman who likes to make her own income and with her earnings she helps her partner to get ahead and to help her children.  On the weekend she sets up a small butcher shop in her neighborhood which is very popular.  Her customers prefer her because she sells fresh meat at the right weight and price.  That is why she always is able to sell everything that her suppliers leave with her in the morning.  She has been working in this business for four years and things are going very well.  She will use her loan to buy meat, bones, liver and all kinds of cuts of meat that she will sell in her small butcher shop.  She has been with this communal bank for two years and she lives the help that the group receives.  Her dream is to have her own stable shop with a cooler.

loans.use: to buy meat, bones, liver and all kinds of cuts of meat that she will sell in her small butcher shop.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 50 years old and married with 14 children, five of whom are in school.

She earns a living by raising cows in the Philippines. Lucia is borrowing 10,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to purchase an additional cow to raise.

Lucia has been raising cows for five years and also earns additional income from farming corn.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow to raise

loans.name: Lelianita

texts.en:
Lelianita is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a livestock raising business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 19,500 PHP (Philippines pesos) through NWTF to buy additional livestock to raise for her business.

Lelianita has been in this business for nine years. Lelianita earns more income from direct selling Avon products.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to raise

loans.name: Utulivu Group

texts.fr: La cliente Kuzanwa est une femme d’affaires et membre d’une banque communautaire «Utulivu», entrepreneur expérimenté, âgée de 35 ans, mariée  et mère de 2 enfants qui tous scolarisés. La cliente est vendeuse des divers médicaments. Il étale sa marchandise dans une pharmacie de la place. Elle commença ses affaires avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint, lui aussi, est un infirmier. Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 10 ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va la servir d’acheter 10 boites médicaments antibiotiques, 10 boites des antis inflammatoires, pommades camphrées, gants, sparadraps, tension mètres, thermomètres, etc. Ainsi, il souhaite accroitre son capital, construire une maison, scolariser, vêtir, et nourrir ses enfants. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des hommes et femmes entrepreneurs non bancables, surtout; pendant ce moment critique, post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Kuzanwa is a businesswoman and member of the business group Utulivu. An experienced entrepreneur, she is 35 years old and married with two children who both go to school.  

Kuzanwa has been selling various medical products and medicines for the past 10 years. She conducts her sales from a local pharmacy. She initially launched her business with funding from her husband, a male nurse. She later turned to Hekima for financial support. This new loan will help her to buy 10 cartons of antibiotics, 10 cartons of anti-inflammatory drugs, some camphor ointments, gloves, plasters, tensiometers, thermometers, etc.

Kuzanwa’s hopes for the future are to bolster her capital, build a house, and provide for her children’s needs with respect to clothing, food and education. 

Kuzanwa wishes to thank Hekima for helping entrepreneurs who cannot use the traditional banking system to become self-sufficient, especially in these post-war times in the Eastern region.

loans.use: to buy 10 cartons of antibiotics, 10 cartons of anti-inflammatory drugs, some camphor ointments, gloves, plasters, tensiometers, thermometers, etc.

loans.name: Tumurtogoo

texts.en: Tumurtogoo, 49 years old, lives with her husband and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. She has been teaching an elementary school class for more than five years. Her husband and son have been making and selling shoes to local people since 2011. The television her family watches has been damaged and malfunctions, so she is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy a new television. By doing so, her family will be able to get information and entertain themselves. During the past two months, her family has had no television and weren't updated on relocation rules of their street. The borrower is very a hardworking individual who wants to improve her family's living standard.

loans.use: to buy a television.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 44 years old, married and lives with her family. She has a farm and is raising pigs for sale, while her husband works as a carpenter.

Violeta is working hard every day in order to provide income for the family in order to give a better education to her children.  

Violeta requested this  loan to buy feeds. She is aiming to develop her business to increase her profits to improve the general living situation of the entire family in the future.

The story of Violeta and her business is just one of the many examples of GDMPC for Economic Development's clients.
