loans.use: to buy feeds

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en:
Sarah plants and harvests corn to earn a living, which she has been doing for many years. With her generated income, her previous loan used for farming was successfully repaid. 

To improve her farm, she took a new loan to purchase organic fertilizer.

In 2004, Sarah joined GDMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. In the future, Sarah wants to make improvements to her house and enable her children to finish their studies.

loans.use: to purchase organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria  owns and operates a transportation services business. While it is not the only means of generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from operating motorcycle-transport services. She also provides manicures and pedicures in her community to earn extra income.  

With her generated income, she successfully repaid her previous loan. Recently, she took a new loan to repair an existing vehicle and renew licenses.

After she joined Gata Daku MPC, her ability to engage in business improved, as did her quality of life. She is hopeful that she will gain more clients and generate more income to have better resources for a better future.

loans.use: to repair an existing vehicle and renew licenses.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida is an entrepreneur who lives in Ozamiz City with her family. She owns and operates a business selling grilled chicken, assorted viands, and a variety of other foods in the city. She earns well from her business, and she was able to support her children as they finished their degree courses. 

Aside form this, she also has a farm where she grows and harvest cassava, corn, and other crops. With her generated income, she has successfully repaid her previous loan used for buying ingredients and pots. To improve her business more, she took a new loan to buy raw ingredients for her cafeteria and a portion will be use to buy fertilizer. She joined GDMPC in the 2009, and it has helped her to improve her business.  She hopes her business expansion into other places in the province will be successful.

loans.use: to buy raw ingredients for her cafeteria and fertilizer for her farm

loans.name: Clara Irlanda

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Clara, tiene 53 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos mayores de edad, dos de sus hijos aun vive con ella junto a sus familias. Su esposo es chofer.
Doña Clara es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganar lo suyo y con esto contribuir a los gastos que genera el hogar, ella en sociedad con uno de sus hijos tienen un taller de mecánica automotriz en el cual además de reparar todo tipo de autos  también venden aceites lubricantes, líquidos de frenos entre otros repuestos de vehículos,  mientras su hijo realiza los trabajos ella se encarga de las ventas de estos productos, parte del crédito también es para comprar varias herramientas que su hijo necesita para brindar un mejor servicio a sus clientes. Lleva más de 10 años con su negocio con el que salen adelante.
Este crédito es para comprar repuestos, aceites y herramientas que necesita para su negocio. Lleva 4 años  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque los créditos le son de mucha ayuda. Sus metas son seguir adelante en su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "St. Patrick's Credit" meets every two weeks in the Cuban neighborhood of the city of Manta. The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited year-round, and also for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.

Clara lives in this town.  She is 53 years old, is married, and she has three grown children, two of whom still live with her along with their families.  Her husband is a chofer.  

Clara is a hard-working woman who likes to earn her own income and with it contribute to household expenses.  She, in partnership with one of her children, owns an automotive repair shop in which, in addition to repairing all likes of vehicles, they also sell engine oil, break fluid, and other vehicle parts.  While her son does the repairs, Clara takes care of selling these other products.  Part of her loan will also be used to buy tools that her son needs in order to offer customers better service.  She has been working in this field for more than ten years and it helps them move forward. 

This loan will be used to purchase repair parts, engine oils, and tools needed for their auto repair business.  Clara has been with the communal bank for four years and she likes it because the credit helps her a lot.  Her goal is to continue making progress with her business.

loans.use: to purchase repair parts, engine oils, and tools needed for their auto repair business.

loans.name: Tania Isabel

texts.es:
El Grupo De Crédito San Patricio se reúne cada 15 días en el barrio Cuba en la ciudad de Manta,  ciudad conocida por sus hermosas playas que son muy visitadas en toda época del año y por ser una ciudad con una belleza sin igual con muchos atractivos turísticos.
En este lugar vive la señora Tania, tiene 32 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre pero aun no tiene hijos. El marido trabaja en una fábrica de la ciudad.
Doña Tania es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto ayudarle a su esposo con los gastos del hogar se dedica a la venta de ropa de la marca Leonisa y productos de Avon y Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja de  dos a tres horas al día ya sea en la mañana o en horas de la noche, a ella le gusta su labor ya que se entretiene y se olvida de lo sola que esta mientras su marido trabaja. Tiene más de 5 años que se dedica a esta actividad en la cual le va muy bien.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas que vende. Lleva 6 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. Sus sueños son tener un bebé.
texts.en:
The communal bank "St. Patrick's Credit" meets every two weeks in the Cuban neighborhood of the city of Manta.  The city is known for its beautiful beaches, which are visited year-round, and also for being a city of unparalleled beauty with many tourist attractions.  

Tania lives in this town.  She is 32 years old and lives with her life partner.  She does not yet have children.  Her husband works in a factory in the city.  

Tania is a housewife who, in order to earn her own income and help her husband with household expenses, works selling brand name clothing (Leonisa), as well as beauty and cosmetic products and accessories (from Avon and Yanbal).  She goes door to door, working two or three hours per day, either in the morning or at night.  She likes her job because it keeps her busy and she forgets about being alone while her husband is working.  She has been working in this area for more than five years and things are going well.  This loan will be used to buy clothing, perfume, cremes, cosmetics, and other items that she sells.  She has participated in 6 loan cycles with her communal bank and she likes the help that is offered through the credits.  Her dream is to have a child.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, cremes, cosmetics, and other items that she sells.

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
This is Rosalie, 43, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Joselito, a driver, and they have children. She and her husband are managing their household while operating the business. They are working hand-in-hand to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Rosalie owns and oversees operations of their jeepney (see footnote) transportation business. She has one jeepney unit (14-16 person capacity), which is paying *boundary (daily quota) each day. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 every day.
				
To help her continue operating her business, she is requesting a PHP 10,000 loan. She will be utilizing the loan to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of her jeepney unit.

Rosalie hopes to expand her business and dreams of having a happy family. She meets up with her co-fellowship** members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

Curiously, jeepneys have purely American origins. Jeeps were first used by American soldiers helping the Philippines throw off the invading Japanese. Filipino ingenuity, however, managed to see this vehicle as an opportunity to earn, and modified the Jeep into a 20-seater jeepney, open enough to provide adequate ventilation, sturdy for everyday travel, and cheap enough to buy and maintain. Now, the jeepneys are one of the things that makes the Philippines truly the Philippines.

*In the boundary system, the driver pays the jeepney owner a fixed amount (the “boundary”) for driving a passenger vehicle for 12 hours. It is as if the driver is renting the vehicle. What he earns from passenger fares above the “boundary,” minus what he paid for the gas and oil, is his take-home pay.

** All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of their jeepney unit.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is 60 years old and married with eight children.

She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Editha is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Editha has been raising pigs for 6 years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 43 years old and single with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a buy and sell cement business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stocks of cement to sell.

Yolanda has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buy and sell cement business for 3 years and also earns an income from food vending.

She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of cement to sell.

loans.name: Jonalyn

texts.en:
Jonalyn is 29 years old and married with six children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

Jonalyn has borrowed and repaid 4 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from a buy and sell rice business.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Minerva

texts.en:
Minerva is 51 years old and married with three children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, salt, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and other groceries.

Minerva has borrowed and paid 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming rice.

She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like snack foods, sugar, soap, salt, shampoo, canned goods, eggs, and other groceries

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
Rosie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from selling vinegar.

Rosie requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now request a new loan to further build her business. In the future, Rosie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle business

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 24,000 through NWTF to purchase items to sell snack foods, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries for her general store business.

She has been in this business for 10 years. Arlene earns more income from farming rice.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell such as snack foods, sugar, salt, canned goods, noodles, and other groceries

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rice-farming business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years. Marivic earns more income from a general store. She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice-farming business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Talangul

texts.ru: Талангул 42 года, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. Двое старших детей- студенты, младшие- школьники. Живут одной большой дружной семьей. Талангул  очень трудолювая, целеустремленная и ответственная. У Талангул - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она с 2000 года занимается полеводством и животноводством. Стартовала с  8,000 сом (KGS), на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве имеет: 1 корову, 3 лошади, 30 овец, а также есть 1,55 ГА земельной доли, где засеян эспарцет, и 2 ГА земли с яблонями. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Талангул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку семян картофеля элитных сортов. Доходы от кредита Талангул планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса, что позволит улучшить жилищные условия.
texts.en: Talangul is 42 years old, married and raising 4 children together with her husband. Two of their older children are college students, and the youngest are school students. They live as one big, happy family. Talangul is very hardworking, driven and responsible. Talangul has a secondary education. To provide the primary income for her family, she has been involved in farming and animal husbandry since 2000.  Having started with 8,000 som (KGS), today she has 1 cow, 3 horses, 30 sheep and also 1.55 hectares of land, where she planted sainfoin and 2 hectares of land with apple trees. The monthly income amounts to 10,000 som (KGS). In order to further develop her business, Talangul requested a loan from the bank "Bai-Tushum" to buy elite potato variety seeds. Talangul plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing her business, which would allow her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Elvira

texts.en: Elvira is 59 years old, widowed and the mother of six children. For the last three years, she has earned a living by raising hogs and earns a net income of PHP 2,000 per hog. She usually spends her profits on her children's school fees. Due to insufficient funds, she would like to borrow PHP 25,000 to buy additional hogs to raise and sell. She's hoping that her loan will be granted so that she can improve her business and earn more profits.

loans.use: to buy additional hogs to raise and sell.

loans.name: Haren

texts.en:
Haren, 32 years of age, is married to a tricycle driver and blessed with two children. 

She manages a transportation business together with her husband. They've been in this business for almost five years, earning a net income of PHP 120 daily. 

Due to insufficient capital for their business, Haren would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 15,000 to pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle. She's hoping that their transportation business will continue to improve and earn more profits.

loans.use: To pay for the repairs and maintenance of their motorcycle.

loans.name: Sarah Joy

texts.en: Sarah Joy is 26 years old and single. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell like noodles, chips, canned goods, eggs, etc. Sarah Joy has borrowed and repaid four loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from pig fattening and food vending. Sarah Joy aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks to sell like noodles, chips, canned goods, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Joy

texts.en: Joy is 26 years old and has one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.  Joy has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for four years and also earns an income from farming rice.  Joy aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like soap, noodles, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Rosemarie works hard to support her family.  She has a buy and sell vegetables business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending and a general store.  Rosemarie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her food stall. Rosemarie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 13 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Otgonbayar

texts.en: Mr. Otgonbayar, 38 years old, lives with his wife, daughter, and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been selling waste materials to a recycling factory since 2005. His wife is a tailor and works at a cashmere products manufacturing company. Their daughter goes to high school while their son studies at elementary class. The house his family lives in has been deteriorated and needs some renovation.  He is requesting a loan of 5,000,000 MNT to buy shingles, bricks, cement, planks, and fiberglass for house renovation. After renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place, where less coal is burned, and then fewer pollutants will be released into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his old house.

loans.name: Telematina

texts.en: Telematina is 35 years old, married and the mother of three children. She earns a living by running a stall in a flea market where she sells many items, including shirts, makeup, handicrafts, and souvenirs. She has been doing this for the last three years, and is requesting a loan to buy more exciting products to sell so that she can improve the quality of her business. She would like to sell bowls, grass skirts, handcrafted bags, traditional men's necklaces, and jewelry. She hopes to use her profits to better support her family and children. She became a member of SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy bowls, grass skirts, handicrafted bags, traditional men's necklaces, and handicrafted jewellery

loans.name: Karen Eliuth

texts.es: Karen es una joven mamá de muy dedica a su trabajo, habita en la zona urbana de Nueva Guinea y junto a su esposo han procreado dos hermosos hijos, quienes les dan fuerza para trabajar y seguir luchando por un futuro mejor. Karen es comerciante y apoya a su esposo con un negocio propio, el cual ha desarrollado con mucho esfuerzo, ella comercializa ropa y zapatos usados en su propia casa, pero la demanda en los últimos meses ha crecido y no cuenta con un diversificado inventario de productos para ofrecer. Solicita su primer en crédito para abastecer de mercadería como ropa y zapatos su fructífero negocio.
texts.en: Karen is a young mother very dedicated to her work. She lives in the urban zone of Nueva Guinea and together with her husband. She has given birth to two beautiful children, who give them strength to work and keep fighting for a better future. Karen is a businesswoman and helps her husband with their own business, which she has developed with much effort. She sells clothing and used shoes in her own home, but the demand in the last months has grown and she does not have a diversified inventory of products to offer. She requests her first loan to stock merchandise such as clothing and shoes for her productive business.

loans.use: to stock merchandise such as clothing and shoes for her productive business.

loans.name: Milena

texts.es:
Milena trabaja en su casa ayudando a su mamá en la despensa de la familia, y su padre trabaja en una empresa, son 3 en la casa.
Ella está estudiando la carrera de enfermería, y cuenta que su objetivo es culminar sus estudios y poder trabajar en algún centro asistencial, seguir estudiando  y obtener mejores ingresos para poder ayudar a su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su universidad.
texts.en:
Milena works in the home helping her mother with the family store, and her father works at a company. The three of them live in the house.
She s studying a nursing course and her goal is to finish her studies and be able to work in a health centre and to continue studying to earn more money so she can help her family.
She is asking for this loan so she can pay her university fees.

loans.use: to pay for university fees.

loans.name: Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es de la ciudad de Carapeguá, está estudiando la carrera de análisis de sistemas, y cuenta que en un tiempo se ve realizándose como profesional, ejerciendo su profesión en una empresa seria donde pueda demostrar sus ganas de triunfar y ser alguien en la vida.
Pide este préstamo ya que quiere pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y también poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte. Agradece por esta ayuda que esta recibiendo.
texts.en: Pablo is from the city of Carapeguá. He is studying for a career in systems analysis. He says that in a time he will become a professional, and carrying out his profession in a company would enable him to demonstrate his desire to triumph and be someone in life. He is asking for this loan since he wants to pay his university tuition, and also to cover his transportation costs. He is thankful for the help he is receiving.

loans.use: to pay for university tuition and transportation costs

loans.name: Evangelyn

texts.en:
Evangelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has al fish-vending business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish-vending business.

She has been in this business for two years. Evangelyn earns more income from selling dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell

loans.name: Charry

texts.en: As a married parent of one child, Charry works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Charry is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fishing materials for her fishing business. Charry has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stocks of fish to dry for her buy and sell dried fish business. Lucy has been in this business for ten years. She earns more income from a general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fish to dry for her dried fish business.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es del Interior del departamento de Ñeembucú, vine a la ciudad de Pilar con aspiraciones de obtener un título profesional y lograr sus objetivos y metas que es el de ser un profesional éxitos.
Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, donde se está esforzando bastante para poder cumplir su meta y crecer no solo como profesional, sino también como persona.
Ella hoy pide este préstamo, ya que quiere pagar sus cuotas, y de esa forma poder seguir estudiando, y luchando por sus sueños. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Liliana is from the Ñeembucú department in the interior.  She came to the city of Pilar with aspirations of getting a professional degree.  She wanted to achieve her objectives and goals of becoming a successful professional.

She is an accounting student.  She is putting forth great effort in order to be able to reach her goal and to grow, not only as a professional, but also as a person.

She is now requesting this loan because she wants to pay her tuition.  This way she will be able to continue studying and struggling for her dreams.  She is grateful for the opportunity that she is receiving to continue studying .

loans.use: to pay university tuition.

loans.name: Tulaisamoa

texts.en: Tulaisamoa is a 43-year-old woman, with four children. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community, and has been doing this for two years. Tulaisamoa has requested a loan to purchase more ingredients for her meat buns business such as bags of flour, pots and pans, sugar, onions, soya, and chicken leg quarters, and also iron roofing for her home improvement. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Tulaisamoa will provide for her family’s daily needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, pots and pans, sugar, onions, soya, and chicken leg quarters, for her business and iron roofing for her home improvement.

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
a señorita Nancy estudia y trabaja al mismo tiempo. Trabaja en el municipio y está cursando el segundo año   de la carrera Análisis de Sistemas, cuenta que por medio de sus estudios quiere poder superarse y el dia de mañana ser una profesional exitosa y reconocida.
Su familia es quien siempre la ha apoyado en todo lo que decide, y quiere poder retribuirles todo. Ella pide este préstamo para sus  gastos escolares, como fotocopias y otros materiales, además de cubrir su matrícula de este año. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe de seguir estudiando.
texts.en:
Nancy studies and works at the same time. She works in the municipality and is in her second year studying for her degree in Systems Analysis. She says that by means of her studies, she wants to be able to improve herself and be a successful and well-known professional in the near future. 

Her family has always supported her in all of her decisions, and she want to be able to pay them back for everything. She is requesting this loan for her school expenses, such as photocopies and other materials, as well as to cover this year’s tuition. She is thankful for this opportunity that she is receiving to continue studying.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses such as photocopies and to pay tuition.

loans.name: Hugo

texts.es:
Hugo es un joven con muchos sueños y anhelos, está estudiando la carrera de obstetricia, ya que comenta que siempre ha aspirado poder traer niños al mundo y poder verlos crecer. Quiere poder ayudar a las embarazadas a tener un mejor trato y cuidado, y que las mujeres sean tratadas dignamente.
Hugo pide este préstamo para poder pagar algunas cuotas de su universidad y también para poder cubrir sus gastos de transporte, que le será de mucha ayuda en busca de su meta.
texts.en:
Hugo is a young man with many dreams and goals. He is studying to be an obstetrician. He tells us that he has always wanted to bring children into the world and watch them grow. He wants to be able to help pregnant women receive better care and he wants them to be treated with dignity.

Hugo requests this loan to pay some university fees and also to pay for his transportation expenses, which will be very helpful as he pursues his goal.

loans.use: to pay university fees and transportation expenses.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es de la ciudad de Encarnación, está en el tercer año de la carrera de farmacia, está trabajando actualmente en farmacias, y cuenta que su mayor sueño es de terminar su carrera y abrir su propio negocio ya que le falta poco para  que se reciba, sus padres le está ayudando para que pueda terminar dicha carrera, y quiere poder retribuirles toda la ayuda que ellos le están dando.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, para poder aligerar un poco las deudas de sus padres. Agradece por esta oportunidad que esta recibiendo.
texts.en:
Maria is from the city of Encarnacion. She is in her third year of studying Pharmacy. She is currently working in pharmacies and tells us that her greatest dream is to finish school and open her own small business. She only has a little bit of school left. Her parents are helping her to finish school and she wants to be able to repay them for all that they have given to her.

She requests this loan to pay university fees so that she can lessen her parents' debt. She is grateful for the opportunity that she has been given.

loans.use: to pay university fees.

loans.name: Luis Alfredo

texts.es: Luis es un joven de 20 años de edad, él vive con  su mamá y 2 de sus 7 hermanos, la menor que tiene 17 años asiste al colegio, Luis se dedica desde hace un año a sembrar papas pero ya tenía experiencia en la agricultura y al trabajo en el campo, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de abono y fungicidas para sus sembríos, la aspiración de Luis es mejorar su negocio que incremente sus cosechas para tener mejores ingresos que le permitan cubrir sus gastos y los de su madre.
texts.en:
Luis is a 20-year-old young man. He lives with his mother and 2 of his 7 brothers, the youngest of whom is 17 years old and attends school. Luis has made a living sowing potatoes for a year, but he already had experience in agriculture and working in the fields.

He will invest this loan in the purchase of fertilizer and fungicides for his sown fields. Luis aspires to improve his business, which will increase his harvests to make a better income, which will allow him to cover his and his mother’s expenses.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and fungicides.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en: Jenelyn is 34 years old with three children, one of whom is in school. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, chips, soft drinks, etc. Jenelyn has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish. Jenelyn aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like soap, sugar, milk, chips, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Calixte Honorine

texts.fr: Calixte  est une jeune femme de âgé 50 ans mariée et mère de 05 enfants dont l'âge varie entre 10 et 25 ans. Elle gère un débit de boisson depuis 05 ans.la demande de ses clients a augmenté et elle n'arrive plus a satisfaire leurs demande et sollicite un crédit afin augmenter son stock de marchandises, ce qui augmentera ses ventes et donc son bénéfice. Bénéfice qui l'aidera à subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Calixte, age 50, is the married mother of five children aged 10 to 25 years old. She has been running a bar for the past five years. 

Unable to meet the growing demand of her customers, she is seeking a loan to increase her stock. 

This will bolster her sales and profits, which will help her to support her family.

loans.use: to stock up on cases of drinks.

loans.name: Mi Dios Es Mi Fortaleza Group

texts.es:
La asociación comunal Mi Dios es mi Fortaleza está conformado por diez integrantes, madres y padres responsables con veinte hijos bajo su responsabilidad. Son originarios de Malpaisillo lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadoras responsables, con ganas de superación personal. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligada a trabajar desde temprana edad, para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad  luchan día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante la coordinadora es Matilde y tiene por actividad económica la venta de pan de forma ambulante y por encargo. Ella dedica a su negocio unas ocho horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Asociación comunal Mi Dios es mi Fortaleza agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank “Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza” (My God Is My Strength) consists of 10 members. They are responsible parents who who must care for 20 children among them. The members are originally from Malpaisillo, a place that is located in the northern part of the region. They are known for being hardworking, responsible, and having the drive to succeed on a personal level. Unfortunately, due to the lack of financial resources, they were not able to study for a degree and were obligated to work at an early age so that they could help with the household expenses. At the moment, they strive each day to provide a better future for their children.

Thanks to her effort and her desire to move forward, Matilde was appointed the group coordinator. She has a business of selling bread as a street vendor and by accepting orders. Matilde devotes about eight hours each day to her business by offering her product. In the near future, she would like to generate more income.

The Communal Bank “Mi Dios es Mi Fortaleza” is grateful for the assistance that Kiva lenders provide to people who have limited resources and come from poor countries, such as Nicaragua, so that they can earn a decent living.

loans.use: to buy various types of baked goods to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to various types of clothing to sell.

loans.name: Chérita

texts.fr: Âgée de 38ans, Chérita vit avec sa famille à Lomé. Pour contribuer aux besoins du ménage, elle revend depuis 1995 des produits d'alimentation générale et des pagnes au marché. Le quatrième crédit qu'elle sollicite l'aidera à acheter plus de marchandises afin de satisfaire les clients. Elle espère entretenir sa famille et augmenter son chiffre d'affaire.
texts.en: Chérita, who is 38 years old, lives in Lomé with her family. In order to help provide for the household needs, she has since 1995 been selling general food products and "pagnes" (brightly coloured pieces of fabric) in the market. She is requesting a fourth loan so that she can buy more goods in order to satisfy customer demand. She hopes to be able to take care of her family and increase her turnover.

loans.use: to purchase "pagnes" and food products.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a dried fish making business in the Philippines and earns additional income from buying and selling fish. Myrna is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase fish to make dried fish for her dried fish making business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to expand her business and to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish to dry

loans.name: Mapatano Group

texts.fr: La cliente Bisiweka est une commerçante depuis 5 ans et membre d’un collectif d’affaires «Mapatano». Senior entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 8 enfants, dont 7 étudient et 1 autre est encore gamin. Elle est vendeuse des matériels usagés. Elle installe son business dans un dépôt de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 5 matelas usagés. Son conjoint est un infirmier. Elle avait débuté avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite construire sa parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
Bisiweka has been a merchant for the past five years and is a member of the "Mapatano" business group. A 36-year-old senior entrepreneur, she is married and the mother of eight children, of whom seven attend school and one is still a child. She sells second-hand items, and has set up her business in one of the city's warehouses.

She is requesting a loan from Hekima to expand her activities. She will buy five second-hand mattresses. Her spouse is a nurse, and she started out with funds received from her husband. In the future she wants to build on her plot of land, educate and feed her children.

She thanks Hekima to have well chosen its target, providing support to women entrepreneurs excluded from the traditional banking system, while granting them loans without collateral, especially during the post-conflict period in the Eastern region of the country.

loans.use: buy five second-hand mattresses

loans.name: Maria Victoria

texts.es:
María, necesita capital para comprar yuca, harina, maíz, aceite, papas, pepinos, condimentos, lociones, cremas, cosmeticos y otros productos para surtir su negocio y recuperar con mejores ganancias lo invertido.
El crecimiento de su negocio y la estabilidad económica con la que cuenta actualmente se debe a la buena utilización de los créditos.
texts.en:
María needs money to buy cassava, flour, maize, oil, potatoes, cucumbers, condiments, lotions, creams, cosmetics and other products to supply her business and make more profit on her investment.
The growth of her business and the economic stability that she currently enjoys is all thanks to the good use to which she has put her loans.

loans.use: to buy items such as cassava, flour, maize, oil, potatoes, cucumbers, condiments, lotions, creams and cosmetics.

loans.name: Wendwaoga Group

texts.fr:
Mme KOULPOKO  RASMATA est responsable du Groupe WENDWAOGA. Veuve, elle est mère de trois (03) enfants. Le plus âgé a 37ans et le moins âgé a 30ans. Personne ne va à l’école. Elle a deux (02)  personnes en charge.
Mme vend des fruits et légumes, de la pate d’arachide et de la farine de maïs  depuis 25ans. Elle s’approvisionne au marché de son secteur.
Elle veut s’acheter 02 sacs d’arachides pour la préparation de la patte d'arachide et 02 sacs de maïs pour la transformation en farine.
Avec ses bénéfices elle compte accroitre son activité en diversifiant ses marchandises pour faire face à la demande de la clientèle. Mme ambitionne trouver un locale ou elle pourra mener  son activité et s’occuper des études de son neveux.
texts.en:
Koulpoko Rasmata is the head of the Wendwaoga Group. She is a widowed mother to three children. Her eldest is 37 years old and the youngest is 30 years old. None of them are currently receiving an education. She has two people under her care.

Koulpoko Rasmata had been selling fruits and vegetables, peanut paste and cornflour for 25 years. She gets her supplies from a local market.

She wants to buy two sacks of peanuts for peanut paste and two sacks of corn to turn into cornflour.

With the profits, she plans on growing her business by diversifying her stock in order to meet customer demand. Koulpoko Rasmata's ambitions are to find  a premises from which she can run her business and to be able to provide for her nephew's studies.

loans.use: buy two sacks of peanuts and two sacks of corn in order to make peanut paste and cornflour

loans.name: Blanca Laura

texts.es: Con 62 años de edad Blanca es una señora Colombiana que reside en Ecuador, ella comenta que se siente contenta ya que  Ecuador es un país tranquilo para vivir y existen muchas actividades a las que se puede dedicar, Blanca es una señora muy dedicada a su familia y pese a su edad tiene muchas ganas de trabajar, el crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de cuyes para criarlos y comercializarlos, ella dice que en verdad necesita el crédito ya que su fuente de ingresos  es la cría de animales menores.
texts.en:
62 years old, Blanca is a Colombian woman who lives in Ecuador. She comments that she is content since Ecuador is a peaceful country to live in and there are many activities to which she can dedicate herself. Blanca is a woman who is very dedicated to her family and despite her age is very willing to work.

She will invest the loan in the purchase of guinea pigs to raise and sell. She says that in truth she needs this loan since her source of income is raising young animals.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs.

loans.name: Djantoyerela Group

texts.fr:
Les  femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA ont en moyenne  41 ans, 4 enfants et vivent toutes dans des familles traditionnelles élargies à YANGASSO/SEGOU (la quatrième région  administrative de la république du Mali).
Ces femmes se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté et font  les activités d’achat et de vente des condiments, des céréales, des savons, des habillements et des produits divers.  Après avoir remboursés correctement leurs prêts précédents, les femmes du groupe DJANTOYERELA sont à leur 5ème  prêt solidaire. KOROTIMI 2ème femme de la gauche vers la droite sur la photo,  compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 cartons de savons, 30 boîtes de pommades et 7 pièces de Wax. Elle s’approvisionne à San. Elle effectue ses ventes, à une clientèle composée de femmes et d’hommes en espèce et souvent à crédit.
Elle envisage réaliser  un bénéfice moyen mensuel de 26 000FCFA qui sera utilisé  dans les dépenses relatives à la santé,  à la nourriture, aux frais scolaires et le reste sera  réinvesti dans les activités.
texts.en:
The women of group Djantoyerela are on average 41 years old with four children. They all live in traditional extended families in Yangasso/Segou (the fourth administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

These women met through family relations. They purchase and sell seasonings, cereals, soap, clothing items, and other diverse products. After paying back their previous loan on time, the women of group Djantoyerela are on their fifth solidarity loan. Korotimi, the second woman from the left to the right in the photo, is planning on using her loan to purchase five boxes of soap, thirty boxes of salve, and seven pieces of Wax fabric. She procures her products in San. She resells to a mixed-gender clientele. She takes cash and often extends credit.

She foresees an average monthly profit of 26,000 XOF, which will be used for expenses relative to health, food, clothing, and school. Anything left over will be reinvested in her business.

loans.use: to purchase five boxes of soap, thirty boxes of salve, and seven pieces of Wax fabric

loans.name: Alfredo Roosvelt

texts.es:
Alfredo vive en un distrito de la ciudad de Huánuco, es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque tiene una familia y con lo cual tiene un hijo de 13 años. Alfredo trabaja muy duro para poder salir adelante, el trabaja como agricultor desde hace 4 años y de esta manera y puede tener ingresos para salir adelante al lado de su familia.

Alfredo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda podrá comprar abono, fertilizantes, así como también poder solventar los gastos de mantenimiento para su cultivo, de esta manera podrá obtener una mejor cosecha y mejorara sus ingresos, lo que permitirá darle un mejor futuro a su hijo y hacer realidad su gran sueño: Darle una buena educación
texts.en:
Alfredo lives in a district of the city of Huánuco. He is a very hardworking person because he has a family, in which he has a 13 year old son. Alfredo works very hard to get ahead. He has been working as a farmer for 4 years and in this way he can have an income to get ahead, along with his family.

Alfredo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because it is thanks to their help to buy manure and fertilizers and also be able to pay the costs of maintaining his crop. In this way he will be able to have a better harvest and improve his income. It will allow him to give a better future to his son and allow him to make his biggest dream a reality: to give a good education

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer and to care for his crop.

loans.name: Ademir Hernan

texts.es:
Hernan vive en la ciudad de Pisco al lado de su familia, es un hombre muy trabajador, sobre todo porque él quiere lo mejor para su familia, es por ello que cada día se esfuerza mucho en su trabajo como chofer de mototaxi, ya que este oficio es la única fuente de ingresos que tiene para poder solventar los gastos de su hogar, lo también le ha permitido poder ir construyendo su vivienda de a pocos y con mucho sacrificio.

Hernan está agradecido con los prestamistas kiva ya que gracias a su apoyo el podrá comprar materiales de construcción para colocar el  piso y los acabados de su vivienda, así  podrá mejorar su calidad de Vida y poder hacer realidad su sueño: Terminar de construir su vivienda.
texts.en:
Hernan lives in the city of Pisco, along with his family. He is a very hardworking person because he wants the best for his family. This is why he works so hard at his job as a motorcycle taxi driver. This business is the only source of income that he has to cover his household’s expenses. It has also allowed him to build his house bit by bit, with a lot of sacrifice.

Hernan is grateful to the Kiva lenders because it’s thanks to their support that he will be able to buy construction materials to finish to install the floor and finishing touches on his house. In this way, he will be able to improve his quality of life and to make his dream a reality: To finish building his house.

loans.use: to install the floor and finishing touches in his house.

loans.name: Senaida

texts.en:
This is Senaida, 47, a resident of Dasmariñas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Wilfredo, a jeepney driver and they have children. She and her husband are working hard to provide for their everyday needs. 

Senaida operates a variety store. In the Philippines, a variety store is a retail store that sells inexpensive items, often with a single price for all items in the store. It is the place to go to buy one sachet of shampoo, a PHP 5-worth of cooking oil, or an egg. She earns by getting supplies at wholesale prices and selling by piece. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 500 in sales every day.

She is requesting a PHP 15,000 loan to help her continue the operation of her business. She will use the loan to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages to expand her product inventory.

Senaida hopes that her business will flourish more and dreams of giving her children a good life and education.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy appliances for his home and school supplies for his children.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 69 years old, married, and lives in Makawa, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao, Philippines. Her husband is a carpenter and the wage that he gets from carpentry work is not enough to meet their needs. 

From her desire to earn an income on her own, Teresita takes in and raises pigs in their backyard. She's been doing this for five years already. 

In 2012, Teresita became an active member of Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) and she enjoys the benefit given by the Cooperative. Through PMPC, she obtained the capital to purchase piglets & feed. 

Now, Teresita requests a loan to buy supplies to sustain the hog-raising business she has. She really hopes and prays that her business will grow and benefit her family, in addition to the income of her husband. Someday, she wants to build a concrete pig cage to easily keep more sanitary conditions.

loans.use: to buy supplies to sustain the hog-raising business she has.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
As a married parent of four children, Gemma works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell of fruits and vegetables business in the Philippines and earns additional income from farming vegetables. Gemma is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF to buy fruits and vegetables to sell in her food stall. 

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now requests a new loan to further build her business.

Gemma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 31 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell

loans.name: Betty

texts.en:
Betty is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy more stocks to sell through her general store business, like soap, eggs, chips, and bread.

Betty has been in this business for ten years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell vegetables and dried fish.

Betty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell like soap, egg, chips, and bread.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
Lea is 40 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Lea is borrowing PHP 29,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy new rice seed and to pay for laborers' salaries.

Lea has been farming rice for six years and also earns additional income from buy-and-sell charcoal.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new rice seed and to pay for laborers' salaries.

loans.name: Jose Eduardo

texts.es:
José, necesita dar mantenimiento al molino nixtamal, comprara fajas, discos, grasa y gasolina para el motor, tendrá en buenas condiciones el equipo para dar un buen servicio a los clientes.
Anteriormente invirtió en repuestos necesarios para continuar trabajando, las nuevas ganancias le han permitido cancelar su deuda y construir un cuarto más en su casa.
texts.en:
José needs to maintain the grain mill that he uses for grinding corn. He will buy belts, disks, grease, and gasoline for the motor. By keeping his equipment in good condition, he will be able to provide excellent service to his customers.

José previously invested in the necessary spare parts so that he could continue working. With the additional earnings, he was able to repay his debt and add another room to his house.

loans.use: to buy belts, disks, grease, and gasoline for the motor of his grain mill.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy items such as tins, butter, flour, sugar, eggs, yeast and raisins.

loans.name: Elias

texts.es:
Elías, con la inversión anterior tuvo un incremento en su producción y en las ganancias, con  lo que ha cancelado su deuda y mejorado el ambiente en que vive su familia a incorporado la venta de verduras.
Como desea continuar fortaleciendo su negocio opta por un nuevo préstamo que lo utilizara para invertirlo en la compra de terneros, aguacates, pepinos, tomates, cebollas, etc., para criarlos.
texts.en:
Elías, from a previous investment, has been able to incorporate selling vegetables in his business and has seen an increase in production and in earnings. He has used these earnings to cancel his debt and to improve the environment his family lives in. 
As he would like to continue strengthening his business, he has decided to apply for another loan that he will use to invest in purchasing and raising calves, avocados, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions etc.

loans.use: purchase calves, avocados, cucumbers, tomatoes, onions etc.

loans.name: Timotea

texts.es: Timotea es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que se dedica a la compra y venta de mercadería como por ejemplo ropa, ella vende la ropa a diferentes personas, amigos, clientes que no dudan en buscarla pues tiene productos de buen material y de buena calidad, ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo casacas, chompas, pantalones, buzos y otras cosas para esta campaña por el dia de la madre, ella participando en el banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo, ella nació en el distrito de Challabamba de la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en el distrito antes mencionada, ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y fruto de esta hermosa relación tiene tres hijos.
texts.en:
Timotea is a hardworking and responsible woman who works buying and selling merchandise such as clothing.  She sells clothing to different people and friends.  Customers do not hesitate to find her because she has products of good material and good quality.  

She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to purchase merchandise such as jackets, sweaters, pants, sweatsuits, and other items for the mother's day season.  She is a member of the "San Martincito" communal bank in the Arariwa Association of the city of Paucartambo.  She was born in the Challabamba district in the Paucartambo province, and lives with her family in the same district.  She is 40 years old, married and has three children from her marriage.

loans.use: para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo casacas, chompas, pantalones, buzos y otras cosas.

loans.name: Luzmila

texts.es:
Luzmila es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que se dedica a la venta de granos secos como por ejemplo habas, trigo, cebada, maíz y otras cosas más por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar granos secos como maíz, trigo y otras cosas. 

Ella nació en la ciudad de Paucartambo y tiene 60 años de edad, ella es viuda pero tiene seis hijos y pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en:
Luzmila is a hardworking and responsible woman who works selling dry grains such as lima beans, wheat, barley, corn and others.  She is taking this opportunity to request a loan to purchase dry grains such as corn, wheat and others.

She was born in the city of Paucartambo.  She is 60 years old, widowed, and has six children.  She is a member of the "San Martincito" communal bank in the Arariwa Association of the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: purchase dried grains like corn, wheat and other items.

loans.name: Bonifacio

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “San Martincito”, tiene 47 años de edad y vive en la hermosa ciudad de Paucartambo, él es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a la venta de carnes como por ejemplo de res, vaca, ovino, chancho, pollo, pescado y otras más. Ya son varios años que le va muy bien en su negocio pero en esta oportunidad requiere aumentar el capital del negocio por lo tanto necesita un préstamo para comprar mas carne. 

El socio agradece y valora el préstamo otorgado mediante este medio y del mismo modo se compromete en cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido
texts.en:
This communal bank member belongs to the "San Martincito" communal bank. He is 47 years old, and he lives in the beautiful city of Paucartambo. He is a hard-working person who sells meats such as beef, lamb, pork, chicken, fish, and other types. His business has already been going very well for him for a number of years, but at this time he needs to increase his business capital and he therefore needs a loan to buy more meat.

He is grateful for and values the loan offered through this means, and in the same way he promises to make his loan payments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy more meat

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es: Marisol es una persona responsable y trabajadora que vive en la ciudad de Paucartambo al sur de la encantadora ciudad del Cusco, ella después de hacer sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la venta de comestibles por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar mercadería como por ejemplo detergentes, arroz, azúcar, pan, gaseosas y otras cosas, ella sigue perteneciendo al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Marisol is a responsible and hard-working person who lives in the city of Paucartambo to the south of the enchanting city of Cusco. After doing her household tasks, she sells groceries, and therefore she now needs a loan to buy merchandise such as detergents, rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks, and other items. She continues belonging to the communal bank "San Martincito" of the Arariwa Association of the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy merchandise such as detergents, rice, sugar, bread, soft drinks, and other items.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en: Lourdes, 58 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with four children. She has been managing a plantation of vegetables in their village for almost six years and earning a net income of PHP 350 when she sells vegetables. Her income from her vegetable plantation usually goes to her savings. Due to a lack of capital, she would like to take a loan of PHP 15,000 to purchase vegetable seedlings to plant and to sell such as string beans, egg plant, squash, and cabbage. She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that her business will continue to grow and become more profitable.

loans.use: To purchase vegetable seedlings to plant

loans.name: Delita

texts.en:
Delita is 53 years old and married with five children.

Delita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy sacks of charcoal to sell. 

She has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the buying and selling of charcoal business for eight years and earns additional income from buying and selling young coconut.

Delita aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en:
Geraldine is a hard-working entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fishing materials for her fishing business.

Geraldine has been in this business for three years. She earns additional income from buy-and-sell dried fish.

Geraldine has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts, with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy fishing materials for her business.

loans.name: Noris

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Noris en su tienda, pues con su credikiva logró tener su negocio más surtido y a una tasa de interés mas baja. Hoy tiene más clientes, mayor rotación de mercancías y está muy feliz pues espera el nacimiento de su nieto.  Noris da gracias a Dios por los financiadores de Kiva porque a través de él ellos han querido compartir sus recursos de apoyo para ayudar a mucha gente con diversas necesidades. En la actualidad Noris está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará mucha mas mercancía como víveres, ranchos, refrescos bebidas, lacteos, para surtir su negocio, con ello las amas de casa tendrán más opciones de compra en su propio barrio y así se planea que la demanda se impacte.
texts.en: Thank you for helping Noris and her store. With her previous Kiva loan she was able to have her business better stocked and at a lower interest rate. Today, she has more customers and a higher turn over rate of merchandise and she is happy because she is waiting for the birth of her grandson. Noris thanks God for the Kiva lenders, because it is through Kiva that these lenders have wanted to share their resources and support in order to help others with diverse needs. Currently, Noris is applying for a loan that she will use to purchase more merchandise like supplies, foodstuffs, refreshments, sodas and milk products in order to stock her store. With new stock, the women in the neighborhood will have more options and Noris will be able to meet customer demand.

loans.use: purchase basic necessities like supplies, foodstuffs, refreshments, sodas and milk products.

loans.name: Marlene Maria

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Marlene en su  negocio de comidas rápidas; ella con el credikiva otorgado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, logró adquirir en mayor volumen, salsas verduras y productos de panadería. Su capital de trabajo se ha fortalecido, aumentando su infraestructura física y sus ventas se incrementaron al igual que las utilidades provenientes del negocio. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una motocicleta para transporte y también invertirá una vez más en insumos como salsas, verduras y harina de trigo, para aumentar su producción. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Mis agradecimientos por su apoyo financiero, espero seguir recibiendo esta financiación para continuar progresando. “
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Marlene in her fast food business. With the Kiva loan granted by the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, she managed to buy sauces, vegetables, and baking products in greater volume. Her working capital has been strengthened, increasing her physical infrastructure. Both her sales and the profits coming from the business have increased.

Marlene is currently applying for a Kiva loan with which she will buy a motorcycle for transportation; she will also invest once again in supplies like sauces, vegetables, and wheat flour to increase her production. 

Her message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Thank you for your financial support. I hope to continue receiving this financing so I can continue making progress."

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for transportation and to invest in supplies like sauces, vegetables, and wheat flour

loans.name: Miguel Angel

texts.es:
Miguel, está planeando los procesos para su próximo cultivo por lo que se ha decidido a solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar abono, semilla, fertilizantes, plaguicidas, pagara mano de obra y alquiler del terreno.
Con ayuda del capital anterior su siembra de pepino dio buenos resultados y con la estabilidad económica que hoy tiene enfrento favorablemente una dificultad familiar pero aun así cancelo con buen record  crediticio su deuda.
texts.en: Miguel is planning for his next harvest, which is why he has decided to seek a new loan to purchase manure, seed, fertilizers, pesticides, pay for labor, and pay the rent for his land.  With the help of his previous loan, his cucumber crops produced good results, and with the financial stability that he gained, he was able to face a difficult family problem and still managed to pay back the loan on time.

loans.use: purchase manure, seed, fertilizers, pesticides, pay for labor, and pay the rent for his land.

loans.name: Mirna Yessenia

texts.es:
Mirna, por medio de amistades aprendió a vender enchape, al poco tiempo se independizo, por la necesidad de mejorar sus ingreso busco empleo, ya tiene 3 años como secretaria y se mantiene vendiendo enchape para ella ha sido fácil sincronizar ambas actividades. Vive junto a su mamá y sus hermanas. Foto due tomada en su trabajo.
Comprará pulseras, aretes, cadenas, dijes, anillos, entre otros accesorios de enchape, surtirá el inventario con nuevos estilos, espera aprovechar la temporada de vacaciones y tener mejores ingresos.
Su visión es continuar trabajando y creciendo con su negocio hasta tener un puesto en el mercado para tener más recursos económicos con los que comprara su casa propia y seguirá apoyando a su familia.
texts.en:
Mirna learned how to sell jewelry through her friends.  After a short time, she went off on her own.  Due to her need to increase her income, she looked for work.  She now has three years of experience as a secretary, and she continues to sell jewelry.  For her, it has been easy to combine both activities.  She lives with her mother and her siblings.  The picture was taken at her job.

She will purchase bracelets, rings, necklaces, pendants, rings, and other accessories.  She will stock her store with new styles, as she hopes to take advantage of the vacation season to increase her earnings.  Her vision is to continue working and growing in her business until she has a stall in the market, so that she can earn a greater income with which she will purchase her own house and continue to support her family.

loans.use: purchase bracelets, earrings, necklaces, pendants, rings, and other accessories.

loans.name: Tamara

texts.ru: Тамаре 39 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей школьного и дошкольного возраста. Супруг помогает по хозяйству. Живут одной большой дружной семьей. Каждый член семьи пытается внести свой вклад в развитие и  благоустройство своей семьи. Сама Тамара по характеру очень трудолюбивая и целеустремленная. У Тамары - среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она занимается животноводством, начав свой бизнес в 1994 году с 12,000 сомов (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Тамары, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 1 дойная корова, 1 теленок, 1 лошадь, 4 козы. Ежемесячный доход составляет 10,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Тамара обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом - на покупку коров, а на оставшуюся часть средств она хочет купить овец. Доходы от кредита Тамара планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, а также в будущем намерена построить большой дом.
texts.en: Tamara is 39 years old, married, and has four school-age children. Her husband helps her with the housework. They live as one big, happy family. Each member tries to contribute and help the family. Tamara is very hard-working and ambitious by nature. She has a high school education and earns the main income for her family raising livestock. She started her business in 1994 with 12,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Tamara now has a dairy cow, a calf, a horse and four goats. She earns 10,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue expanding her farm, Tamara applied for a loan with the bank "Bai-Tushum" to purchase cows and a sheep. She plans to use the profits to invest in additional livestock and to save money to build a big house.

loans.use: To buy cows

loans.name: Ambrocia

texts.es: Ambrocia es una mujer trabajadora y responsable que después de realizar sus actividades del hogar se dedica a la venta de desayunos por lo tanto ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo maca, quinua, azúcar, pan y otras cosas más, ella nació en la Provincia de Paucartambo y vive junto con su familia en la provincia antes mencionada, ella es casada y fruto de esta unión tiene cinco hijos, ella sigue participando al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Ambrocia is a hard-working and responsible woman who after taking care of her household tasks sells breakfasts. Therefore she needs a loan at this time to buy ingredients such as maca (a root vegetable and medicinal herb), quinoa, sugar, bread, and other items. She was born in the province of Paucartambo and lives with her family in the province just mentioned. She is married and from this relationship she has five children. She continues participating in the communal bank "San Martincito" of the Arariwa Association of the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as maca, quinoa, sugar, bread, and other items

loans.name: Tasileta

texts.en: Tasileta is a 30-year-old married woman, with four children. She has a small plantation where she grows yams, taro and bananas to earn a living. She has been doing this for five years. Tasileta has requested a loan to buy fencing wire, and knives for her plantation, cement and window frames for her home renovation, and school stationery for her kids. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.  Tasileta spends her profits on her family’s needs each day, and saves them when it is required for her business.

loans.use: to buy fencing wire, and knives for her plantation, cement, and window frames for her home renovation, and school stationery for her children.

loans.name: Mesepi

texts.en: Mesepi is a 53-year-old married woman, with five children. She operates her BBQ business selling to the public and people around her community.  She has been doing this for four years. Mesepi has requested a loan to buy boxes of mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya, onions, garlic, tomato sauce, plastic plates, foil, gas, and to pay school fees, and school registration. She joined SPBD in 2011 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Mesepi will look at improving her business, and also help her family and kids.

loans.use: to buy boxes of mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soya, onions, garlic,  tomato sauce, plastic plates, foil, and gas for her business, and also to pay school fees and school registration.

loans.name: Juliana

texts.es: Juliana es una mujer responsable y trabajadora que después de hacer sus actividades hogar se dedica a la venta de productos de primera necesidad y ella en esta oportunidad requiere el préstamo para comprar insumos como por ejemplo verduras, carne, arroz, fideos, aceite, papa y otras cosas, ella pertenece al banco Comunal “San Martincito” de la Asociación Arariwa de la ciudad de Paucartambo.
texts.en: Juliana is a responsible and hardworking woman who, after doing her household chores, earns her living selling staple products. At this time, she needs the loan to buy supplies like, for example, vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, and other things. She belongs to Asociación Arariwa's "San Martincito" communal bank in the city of Paucartambo.

loans.use: to buy supplies like, for example, vegetables, meat, rice, noodles, oil, potatoes, and more.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia, 39 years of age, is married to a farmer and blessed with five children. 

She's been in the hog raising business for almost three years and earns a net income of PHP 5,600 for every hog that she sells. Her net income on her business usually is spent on their farming expenses. 

Due to insufficient fund she would like to request a loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase hogs and hog feed.  She's hoping that her requested loan will be granted so that she can able to earn more profits on her business.

loans.use: To purchase hogs and hog feed.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Rowena works hard to support her family. She has a buy and sell dried fish business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling rice.  Rowena is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional dried fish to sell for her dried fish business. Rowena has been sustaining her business activities through her past two loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional dried fish to sell for her business.

loans.name: Sara Joselin

texts.es:
Todos los domingos Sara se despierta con un paso más cerca para convertirse en licenciada en Administración de Empresas. A sus 21 años, ha logrado avanzar rápido con su sueño y ahora está en quinto año de la carrera que le permitirá emprender su propio negocio. Todo esto, gracias a la ayuda de su padre, quien con su esfuerzo en su trabajo en una empresa de metalúrgica, le ha permitido llegar hasta su último año. 
En estos momentos, Sara necesita del préstamo para terminar su carrera y pagar su curso de titulación, pues ella no quiere dejar pasar la oportunidad de graduarse como licenciada en administración de empresas, puesto que este título le permitirá tener mejores oportunidades en el campo laboral. Además, tiene como meta establecer su propio negocio y llegar a ser administradora de este mismo.
texts.en:
Every Sunday, Sara wakes up one step closer to earning her degree in business administration.  At 21 years old, she has been able to advance toward her dream quickly, and now she is in the fifth year of her degree, which will allow her to open her own business.  All of this is thanks to the help of her father who through his effort at his job in a metallurgical company, has allowed her to reach her last year.  

At this moment, Sara is in need of a loan in order to finish her education and pay her tuition.  She does not want to pass up the opportunity to graduate with a degree in business administration.  This degree will allow her to have better opportunities in the work field.  Additionally, her goal is to start her own business and become the manager of said business.

loans.use: to finish her degree and pay for her tuition.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy additional supplies and pay for advertising.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es:
Desde pequeño supo que quería profesionalizarse en una de las ramas de la medicina, odontología fue la elección de Jorge. Tiene 21 años de edad, es un joven inteligente y trabajador, cursa cuarto año de la carrera. Su vocación es brindarle seguridad médica a los que la necesitan. Su mayor soporte son sus padres, quienes día a día lo motivan a seguir adelante y así logré obtener un futuro prospero.
El solicita el crédito para poder comprar los instrumentos que requieren en las prácticas profesionales,  anhela destacarse por el trabajo que realiza, en el que pone todo su empeño y dedicación. Tiene mucha fe en el financiamiento que brinda Kiva y MiCrédito, puesto que le facilitarán cumplir uno de los requisitos de la carrera, que es atender un número específico de pacientes y así concluir satisfactoriamente la carrera. Su plan futuro es establecer su propio consultorio y seguir adquiriendo conocimientos.
texts.en:
Ever since he was little, he knew that he would like to become a professional in one of the branches of medicine. Dentistry was Jorge's choice. He is 21 years old. He is an intelligent and hard-working young man. He is studying in the fourth year of his course. His calling is to offer medical security to those who need it. His greatest supporters are his parents, who day after day motivate him to continue forward, and thus he will have a prosperous future.

He is applying for the loan to be able to buy the instruments that are needed for professional practice. He aspires to stand out for the work that he does, into which he puts all his effort and dedication. He has great faith in the financing that Kiva and MiCredito offer, since they will make it easier to fulfill one of the requirements of the training, which is to care for a specific number of patients and thus satisfactorily complete the program. His future plan is to establish his own practice and continue acquiring knowledge.

loans.use: to be able to acquire the instruments that are required for professional practice.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a laser level for his work.

loans.name: Janette

texts.en: Janette is 22 years old, and married with two children. She runs a small business selling banana chips and pancakes in her community, and has been doing this for one year. Janette has requested a loan to buy tools for her business such as sacks of flour, cooking oil, a wok, and kitchen utensils. She joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Janette will provide for her family's everyday needs.

loans.use: to buy tools for her business such as sacks of flour, cooking oil, a wok, and kitchen utensils.

loans.name: Lafomaalii

texts.en: Lafomaalii is a 41-year-old married woman with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows crops such as taro, yams, and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been in this business for two years. Lafomaalii needs a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, a spade, weed spray, rakes, and chemicals for her garden. She has just joined SPBD in order to gain access to financial assistance. Lafomaalii will use the profits from her sales to support her family.

loans.use: to buy a wheelbarrow, chemicals, knives, a spade, weed spray, rakes, and chemicals.

loans.name: Taivanjargal

texts.en: Mr. Taivanjargal, who is 38 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in a Mongolian traditional ger (portable felt dwelling) in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to the local people since 2004. One month ago, his wife began working as a housemaid. Their daughter goes to high school. Using his previous loan, he and his sister ran a hotel; but, during winter time, it became profitless and closed. Now he is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 MNT to buy spare parts for his car. Using those spare parts, he will update and repair his old car, making it more durable and beneficial.
