loans.use: to repair his old car.

loans.name: Gladis Isabel

texts.es: Gladis tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus dos hijos de 7 años y 11 años de edad. Ella es una mujer trabajadora, responsable y visionaria. Gladis trabaja como empleada en una empresa cercana a su localidad y es así como se asegura de llevar el alimento a su hogar. Su deseo es mejorar las condiciones de la vivienda dado que el techo se encuentra en mal estado y ha decidido repararlo por lo que solicita este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en la compra de lámina galvanizada, madera y clavos para proceder lo antes posible a la mejora del techo y así dar mayor seguridad a su familia.
texts.en:
Gladis is 38 years old and resides in her own home along with her two children, ages 7 and 11. She is a hardworking, responsible, and visionary woman. Gladis is employed at a company near her town, so she is capable of feeding her household.

Her wish is to improve the living conditions at home. The roof is in bad condition, so she has decided to repair it with the loan she is requesting from FUSAI. Gladis will invest in the purchase of galvanized sheets, wood, and nails so that she can proceed with the improvements to the roof as soon as possible. As a result, her family will experience greater security.

loans.use: to buy galvanized sheets, wood, and nails in order to repair the roof of her house.

loans.name: Geraldine

texts.en: Geraldine is 39 years old, married and a resident of Tuyabang Bajo, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao in the Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have four children, three of whom are in school. With only a little capital, Geraldine opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative (PMPC). Aside from the financial assistance given by PMPC, she was able to generate savings and enjoy the other benefits the co-op provides. She has been a member of the co-op since July 2011 and has taken out three loans. Recently, Geraldine applied for a loan to purchase basic commodities for her sari-sari store. She wishes to continue as a good-standing member of the co-op and to be able to manage her finances well. If it weren't for PMPC, she may not have had any savings for her family's future. Geraldine's desires are to live a happy and comfortable life and one day see her children holding their diplomas.

loans.use: to purchase basic commodities for her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Miguel

texts.en:
This is Miguel, age 56, who is a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Maria, his business partner, and they have children. He and his wife manage their own household while operating a business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide for their everyday expenses. 

Miguel manufactures wires used by gardeners with their ornamental plants. These wires can also be used in hanging clothes to dry. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community members. He earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operating his business, he is requesting a PHP 11, 000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy materials needed in making wires such as a cutter and other materials.

Miguel dreams of giving his family a good future. He also hopes that his child will finish his education. He meets with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the word of God, build social capital and pay micro-finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for the materials needed in making wires such as a cutter and other materials.

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa, 54 years old, lives in Oroquieta-Calube, Aloran, Misamis Occidental. She is married and gifted with three children. 

Her husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other agricultural commodities. Elsa has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself helping her husband in plowing the rice field and planting corn and other varieties of agricultural commodities. 

In need of additional working capital, Elsa decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested a loan to buy farm inputs and for paying labor costs for cultivating their land.

Elsa has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful because, if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to have the needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs and to pay labor costs for cultivating their land.

loans.name: Brylle Angele

texts.en:
Brylle Angele is 26 years old, married, and has two children. She is into a direct-selling business, selling clothes, bags, and shoes. She purchases them from a supplier and re-sells them to her friends and neighbors. She has been in her business for a year now and earns PHP 3,000 each month. 

Brylle Angele is now asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to invest in buying more items to sell. She will buy more shoes, bags, cosmetics, shampoo, and accessories to sell.

Brylle Angele will continue selling good and affordable items to her customers and earn more profits in return.

loans.use: to buy more shoes, bags, cosmetics, shampoo, and accesories to sell.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en: Nora is 41 years old, and married with five children, four of whom are in school.  Nora works very hard to provide for them. Nora's business and family home were destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nora has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter. She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor. Nora is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Maricar

texts.en:
Maricar is 22 years old and has one child who is in school.

She and her family survived the super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. As a result, her business and family home was wiped out. 

Maricar is taking out a housing loan amounting to PHP 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Maricar has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her fish-selling business.

With your help, Maricar can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of the super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Cleofas

texts.en:
Cleofas is 52 years old and married. She has four children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.  Cleofas's house was destroyed by Super Typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store, and is committed to regain what she lost.  Cleofas is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Cleofas has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, Cleofas would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Donabel

texts.en:
Donabel works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she could build a house for her family.  In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

With your help, Donabel will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria joined Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative in the year 2010, and she appreciates the programs, services and continuous education of the co-op. She is a member in good standing and very active in attending the various programs and services that the Cooperative offers.
She is requesting a loan  intended to purchase additional ingredients, such as casava, sugar and cooking oil.
Gloria dreams of nothing more than to have a happy, healthy life and an adequate income out of her  business.

loans.use: To purchase additional ingedients, such as casava, sugar and cooking oil.

loans.name: Judilyn

texts.en:
Judilyn is single and 37 years old, and she lives in Polangyuta, Siquijor, Siquijor.

This industrious member finds herself raising pigs to earn a living. 

In need of additional working capital, Judilyn decided to join Paglaum Multi Purpose Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested PHP 50,000.00 for buying additional feed and piglets.

Being a MIGS member (Member in Good Standing) of the cooperative, she has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide her daily needs. Judilyn is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not have any savings at all nor be guided properly in her finances.

loans.use: to purchase additional feed and piglets.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia is forty eight years old and has eleven children.  Eufemia is married and has seven children who are in school.  She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out.  Eufemia is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. 

Eufemia has been an NWTF borrower since 2012.  She plans to recover through retailing gasoline.  With your help, Eufemia can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.

With your help Juliana will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Juliana would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is fifty-one years old and married with five children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Vilma's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Vilma is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Faaiuga

texts.en:
Faaiuga is a 40-year-old widow with five children. She runs a small business selling cabbages, tomato, cucumbers, etc., in her community and has been doing this for three years. 

Faaiuga has requested a loan to buy corn seeds, cooking oil, plastic bags for pop corn business, vegetable seeds and a lawn mower to expand her vegetable garden, school uniforms, and school fees for her children. She joined SPBD in 2013 to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Faaiuga helps out in supporting her children's education and also her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy corn seeds, cooking oil, plastic bags, vegetable seeds, school uniforms, school fees, lawn mower

loans.name: Jose Roberto

texts.es: José tiene 43 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a su compañera de vida y su hijo. José es un hombre carismático, emprendedor y sobre todo trabajador. Muchas personas dan buenas referencias de la integridad de José. Desde hace mucho tiempo se dedica a la prestación de servicios de albañilería dado que es el oficio que aprendió desde muy joven ya que no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar una carrera Universitaria. Con mucha humildad se acercó a FUSAI para solicitar este crédito dado que su vivienda carece de balcones y ventanas y uno de los cuartos necesita una puerta para brindar mayor seguridad a la familia. Esta es la razón por la cual solicita este crédito ya que no puede hacer la inversión por sus medios pero asegura tener la capacidad de pago mensual que el crédito implica.
texts.en:
Jose is 43 and lives in his own home with his life partner and their son. Jose is charismatic, enterprising and a hard-working man overall. A lot of people give good references about Jose's integrity. He has worked as a bricklayer for a long time, this being the trade he learned from a young age, not having the opportunity to study a professional career. With a lot of humility he came to FUSAI to ask for this credit as his home does not have balconies and windows and one of the rooms needs a door to provide added security for the family. This is the reason for requesting this credit since 
he is not able to make the investment through his own means but ensures he has the capacity to make the monthly payments that the credit implies.

loans.use: to buy a door, windows and balconies for his home

loans.name: Sari Mertha Group

texts.en: Ni Luh has succeeded in maintaining her pig business. During this loan period she had five pigs and all were sold. She spent 3,500,000 IDR for feed and she bought piglets with 1,500,000 IDR.  Ni Luh has earned gross profits of 7,000,000 IDR, and after deducting all costs she has 2,000,000 IDR.  She’s very grateful for the profits. She thanks MUK, KIVA and all of the lenders. For the next period, she’ll borrow again and buy new piglets. They expect to increase the loan size to buy more piglets and feed. To increase the business, the Sari Mertha group continues to borrow loans from MUK, and they request a bigger loan size. Each of the members receives 2,000,000 IDR. After succeeding with the last loan, Ni Luh wants to borrow a loan to purchase four superior piglets and sell them for fattening pigs. Now, the price for one superior piglet is 500,000 IDR. All the profits from this business will be saved, and she hopes the business will grow and she will become a successful pig breeder.

loans.use: to purchase four superior piglets.

loans.name: Deggo Group

texts.fr: Le groupement DEGGO qui a comme président Seynabou est composé de 10 personnes. Elles habitent toutes dans le même village et pratiquent la même activité qui est le maraichage. La présidente est reconnue sur la photo par la main qui est levée sur la photo. Elle est mariée et mère de famille. Agée de 45 ans Seynabou a une expérience de plus de 5ans dans cette activité. Elle demande ce crédit pour acheter des semences et intrants cultiver de l’aubergine et l’oignon. Seynabou aide son mari dans la gestion des charges de la famille. Elle quitte sa maison à 8h pour n’y revenir que le soir vers les couts de 19h. Et si l’institution continue de l’aider elle pourra cultiver plus d’hectare dans ses champs et ainsi elle pourra épargner de l’argent à coté.
texts.en: The DEGGO group, whose president is Seynabou, is made up of 10 people. They all live in the same village and are in the same business, which is truck farming. The president is raising her hand in the photo. She is a married mother. At 45 years old, Seynabou has more than 5 years of experience in this business. She is seeking this loan to buy grains and resources to grow eggplants and onions. Seynabou helps her husband in managing her family’s expenses. She leaves her house at 8am not to return before 7pm. And if the institution continues to help her, she will be able to farm more hectares in the fields and thus be able to save money.

loans.use: to buy grains and resources for truck farming

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann, 31 years old, lives in Makawa Oroquita, Misamis Occidental. She is married and gifted with three children.Their family earns a living through farming. In need of additional working capital, Mary Ann decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and has fully repaid the loans in a timely manner.  Recently Mary Ann requested a loan to buy farm inputs. 

Mary Ann has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to cope with the needed working capital. She hopes to buy an additional parcel of land for tilling.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Mike Henry

texts.en:
This is Mike Henry, 23, a resident of Silang, Cavite, Philippines. Single, he lives with his parents, as he is helping them manage their household as well. He works hard to provide for his needs and to also help his family financially.

Mike Henry manages and sells automotive parts. This is his family’s business and they are all helping each other in operating it. He sells different automotive parts and he also sells oil. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community. He earns a minimum of Php 1,000 in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php11,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy automotive parts like clutches, tires, brackets, brakes, wheels and other parts.

Mike Henry hopes that his business will be flourishing and dreams to have a better living. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for automotive parts like clutches, tires, brackets, brakes, wheels and other parts.

loans.name: Jose Balmore

texts.es:
José, vive con su compañera de vida y dos hijas, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos así como también al cultivo de granos básicos, estas actividades le generan alimento y también los recursos económicos necesarios para salir adelante con su familia.
Invertirá en la compra de ganado, fortalecerá el negocio, tendrá mayor producción de lácteos para consumo familiar y comercialización, espera tener resultados positivos con dicha inversión.
Su sueño es ampliar su negocio y mejorar el estilo de vida familiar.
texts.en:
José lives with his life companion and their two daughters. He raises cattle and pigs, but he also cultivates basic grains. These activities provide food, as well as generate needed income so that his family can get ahead.

José will invest in the purchase of cattle so that he can strengthen his business. This will result in greater milk production for both family consumption and to have inventory to sell. He hopes to achieve positive results with this investment.

His dream is to expand his business and improve his family’s lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her 2012 business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family. In the future, Evelyn would like to save money to expand her business.

With your help, Evelyn will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana is forty-seven years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. Susana works very hard to provide for them.

Her business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Susana has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. Susana is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is sixty years old and married and works very hard to provide for her family.

Erlinda's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Erlinda has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.

She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Erlinda is committed to rebuilding her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Matilde Idalia

texts.es:
Matilde de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta 6º grado de primaria, esta casada y su esposo se dedica a la albañilería, tiene tres hijos que estudian. Desde hace 15 años maneja una pequeña pupusería y poco a poco ha ido evolucionando, ahora tiene una pequeña panadería de la cual obtiene más ingresos, ya que dice que gracias a los créditos que ha tenido avanza cada vez más. 

El préstamo que está solicitando a CREDICAMPO, es para comprar más chicharrón, quesillo, frijoles, maíz, aceite y una plancha; ya que esta acercándose la feria en su comunidad y así como ha podido ampliar la panadería ahora quiere extender la pupusería. Ella comenta que le gustaría que sus hijos estudiaran y tuvieran una profesión como abogados por ejemplo.
texts.en:
Matilde is 38 years old and has studied up to the 6th grade.  She is married and her husband is a bricklayer. She has three children who are in school. For the past 15 years she has been running a small tortilla stand which has slowly evolved. She now has a small bakery from which she derives most of her income, and says that her previous loans have made it possible for her to keep advancing.

The loan she is asking CREDICAMPO for is to buy more pork rind, fresh cheese, beans, corn, oil, and a griddle because her community's fair is coming soon.  Just as she has been able to expand her bakery, she wants to do the same with her tortilla stand. 

She states that she would like her children to stay in school and to have a profession such as being lawyers, for example.

loans.use: to buy more pork rind, fresh cheese, beans, corn, oil and a griddle.

loans.name: Orepa

texts.en:
Orepa is a 57-year-old, married woman, with five children. She has a small plantation and grows taro and bananas and also has a vegetable garden to earn a living. She has been doing this for three years. 

Orepa has requested a loan to buy a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, shovels, chemicals, bush knives, rakes, and planting bags. She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2013. With her profit, Orepa hopes to save for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to purchase a wheelbarrow, vegetable seeds, fertilizer, pesticides, shovels, chemicals, bush knives, rakes, and planting bags.

loans.name: Leonardo Antonio

texts.es:
Leonardo de 21 años de edad, casado con un hijo menor de edad, es originario del Sauce lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajador, responsable, con ganas de superación personal.  En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de su hijo. Lamentablemente por falta de recursos económico no pudo cursar una carrera y se vio obligado a trabajar desde temprana edad. Para ayudar con los gastos del hogar. En la actualidad  lucha día a día para brindarles un futuro mejor a sus hijos.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica un cafetin  en su casas de habitacion  con productos como: jugos naturales  gaseosas,  repostería  empanadas, cachos, tortas de piña, picos, pastes de carne, de pina. Dedos, sopa de leche, cosas de horno. El dedica a su negocio unas diez horas diarias ofreciendo su producto, a clientes fijos y por encargo. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra de repostería para que en futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos. Leonardo agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva le brindan  a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Leonardo is 21 years old, married with one young son. He is a native of El Sauce a place in the north of the country. He is hard-working responsible and wants to improve himself. In his spare time he likes to be with his son. Unfortunately due to a lack of financial resources he couldn't study a profession and had to work at an early age to help with the household expenses.

Today he strives from day to day to provide a better future for his children. Thanks to his effort and his desire to improve he runs a cafe in his place of residence with products such as: natural juices, soft drinks, a variety of traditional pastries (with names like empanadas, cachos, tortas de piña, picos, dedos, etc.), sopa de leche (a traditional soup) and baked goods. He spends about 10 hours a day at his business offering his product to regular customers and on order.

The objective of his loan is to invest working capital and stock his business by buying pastries so that in the near future he will generate greater income. Leonardo thanks those lenders from Kiva who offer support to people of low resources in poor countries like Nicaragua to enjoy dignified work.

loans.use: to stock his cafe with soft drinks, natural juices, pastries, empanadas, sopa de leche (a traditional soup), etc.

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es:
Juan Carlos
Don Juan Carlos es originarios de san Martin Jilotepeque, tiene 29 años de edad y desde hace mas de 5 años se ha dedicado a la crianza de pollos y de estas fuentes es que ha logrado obtener sus ingresos para mantener a su familia. Junto a su esposa ha procreado 3 hijos. el sueño de Juan Carlos es hacer otra galera para poder criar mas pollos y está confiado que con el apoyo de Fape y Kiva lo lograra. Este es el tercer crédito que solicita, es una persona responsable.esta solicitando este credito para la compra de gallinas para la crianza
texts.en:
Don Juan Carlos is originally from San Martin Jilotepeque. He is 29 years old and has been raising chickens for more than five years. This business allows him to generate income so that he can sustain his family. He and his wife have three children.

Juan Carlos dreams of having another coop so that he can raise more chickens, so he is confident that he can accomplish this goal with the help of FAPE and Kiva. This is the third loan he is requesting. Juan Carlos is a responsible person and is requesting this loan so that he can buy chickens that he can raise.

loans.use: to buy chickens to raise.

loans.name: Las Brisas Group

texts.es: Este es el nuevo grupo “Las Brisas” La cual  está constituida por 05 socias responsables y entusiastas. Berbelina de 48 años de edad es separada. Ella se dedica a la venta y distribución de comida hace más de 03 años. Gracias a su constante dedicación a logrado salir adelante y así poder darle educación a su único hijo. El anhelo de Berbelina es contar con su propio local de venta. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de arroz, papa y pescado. El grupo “Las Brisas” agradece a todas las personas que facilitaron este crédito. Berbelina es la tercera  del lado posterior derecho y viste blusa negra.
texts.en:
This is the new group "Las Brisas", which is made up of five responsible and enthusiastic members. 48-year-old Berbelina is separated. She has worked in the sale and distribution of food for more than three years. Thanks to her constant dedication she has managed to get ahead and provide her only son with an education. Berbelina's dream is to have her own store. 

Berbelina is requesting this loan to purchase rice, potatoes and fish. The group "Las Brisas" is thankful to all those who made this loan possible. Berbelina is the third person from the right side, wearing a black blouse.

loans.use: to buy rice, potatoes and fish.

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is a resident of Lobogon, Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental, Philippines. She is married and has two children.  They had a little fishing business from which to earn for a living.  With their business they face many challenges, but they realized that it is good to face the challenges rather than get discouraged. 

Luzminda and her husband work hard in selling their catch to the market. Sometimes there are wholesale buyers from other towns and cities who come to buy their fish. With their savings, they welcome the idea of expanding their business.  They have requested from Paglaum MPC a loan to purchase materials and supplies needed for her fishing business.  They feel assured of Paglaum’s help, should there be a need for working capital in the future.

loans.use: to purchase materials and supplies needed for her fishing business

loans.name: Niuia

texts.en: Niuia is a 46 year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small business selling meat buns in her community and has been doing this for two years. Niuia has requested a loan to buy bags of flour, mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, soya, onions, noodles for her business. She has just joined SPBD to gain access to capital. With her earnings, Niuia will provide for family daily needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, mutton flaps, chicken leg quarters, soya, onions, noodles

loans.name: Cherelyn

texts.en:
Cherelyn is 22 years old and has one child. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cherelyn's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost. Cherelyn is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Cherelyn has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.  In the future, Cherelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Isidora

texts.en:
Isidora is fifty-four years old and married.  She has six children. She works very hard to provide for them.  Isidora's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon, Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013.  Isidora has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.  She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Isidora is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Diosdada

texts.en:
Diosdada is 59 years old and married, with four children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Diosdada's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost. Diosdada is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build her a house for her family.

Diosdada has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home.  In the future, Diosdada would like to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Mauitumalo

texts.en:
Mauitumalo is a 49-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have eight children.

To earn a living, she runs a sewing business and sells ice pops in her community. She has five years of experience with this business.

Mauitumalo is requesting a loan to buy various items, including a new sewing machine, additional fabric, threads, sugar, cordials, and plastic bags, for her business. She plans to use profits she expects to generate as a result of the loan to better support her family. She recently joined SPBD to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing various items (e.g., a new sewing machine, fabric, threads, sugar, cordials, and plastic bags)

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a 53-year-old woman. She is married, and blessed with six children. She lives with her husband and children in the small town of Annafunan. Both Cristina and her husband are illiterate, and only know how to sign their names. Due to poverty, they were not able to receive an education. 

Cristina is a housewife, and her husband is a land cultivator. However, he has no land, and so he has to grow vegetables on rented land. Thus, their income is very scant. From the beginning, they have faced many problems. He cannot give sufficient financial sustenance to his family with his small income. Now, the educational expenses and their family expenses are growing day by day.

Cristina is asking a loan amounting PHP 10,000 to buy spare parts for the motorcycle so that they have additional income to sustain the needs of the family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for the motorcycle.

loans.name: Marianita

texts.en: Marianita is 65 years old and married with 1 school-age and 9 adult-age children. She is from Magcamiguing, Calamba, Mis.Occ. She has been engaged in backyard piggery for 10 years.  She earns about Php 8,000 per month doing this type of work.  Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase feeds.  The profit she earns from her business is used to support daily consumption and savings for retirement in Paglaum.

loans.use: to purchase feeds.

loans.name: Taunese

texts.en:
Taunese is a 38-year-old married woman with 5 children. 

She would like to start a small business, selling ie lava lava (traditional skirts) in her community. In order to do this, Taunese needs a loan to purchase carved designs, fabric paint, fabric for her elei business, and cement for her home improvement, and also to pay school fees for her kids' education. 

She hopes to save her profits for family needs and emergencies. She has been a member of SPBD since 2013.

loans.use: to buy carved designs, fabric paint, fabric, and cement, and to pay school fees

loans.name: Elsie

texts.en: Elsie is 38 years old, married, and a resident at Lower Lamac Oroquieta City, Misamis Occidental, Mindanao: Philippines. Her husband is a tricycle driver. They have four children,  three of whom are in school. Starting with capitalization of 14,900.00PHP, she opened a welding shop  and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. Aside from financial assistance, she was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. She became a member last July 2011 and has taken out three loans.  She recently applied for a loan to buy additional materials for her welding business. She wishes to continue as a member in good standing and to be able to manage her finances. If not for PMPC, she might not have any savings for their future. Elsie only wants to live a happy and comfortable life and see her children holding their diplomas someday.

loans.use: to buy additional materials for her welding business

location.town: Oroquieta-Lower Lamac, Oroquieta City, Misamis Occ

loans.name: Marc Anthony

texts.en:
This is Marc Anthony, 27, a resident of Tanza, Cavite, Philippines. He is married to Janelle, a housewife, and they have children. He manages their household while operating the business. At this time, he is working hard to continually provide income for his family’s everyday expenses.  

Marc Anthony operates an LPG business. What he basically does is buy Liquefied Petroleum Gas tanks from wholesalers, sell them per tank with a little profit. LPG tanks can range from small to regular size tank. His regular customers are his neighbors and the local community.  He earns a minimum of 600 Philippine Pesos (PHP) in sales every day.

To help him continue operations of his business, he is requesting a Php 20,000 loan. He will be utilizing the loan to buy more stock of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory.

Marc Anthony hopes his business will grow in the coming years and dreams to give a good future to his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship members to share stories of his work every week and where he can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for more stock of LPG tanks to expand his product inventory.

loans.name: Idalyn

texts.en:
Idalyn is married with three children. She is 36 years old, and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Idalyn is a farmer, and grows bananas and coconuts to earn a living. She has been doing this for seven years. She has requested a loan to buy fertilizers and pesticides .

Idalyn has been a member of PMPC for five years. In the future, Idalyn hopes to save for the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides.

loans.name: Haren

texts.en:
Haren works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon Haiyan.

She has restarted her business and is now requesting a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF for housing purposes. Specifically, she would like to use the loan proceeds to purchase building materials and to pay construction labor costs so that she can build a house for her family.

With your help, Haren will be able to rebuild her devastated life on a quicker timetable. In the future, Haren would like to improve and expand her business to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and to pay construction labor costs

loans.name: Eliza

texts.en:
Eliza is a 33-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have five children, all of whom are in school. Eliza works very hard to provide for her family.

Eliza's business and family home was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines November 8, 2013. Eliza has restarted her business and now needs to provide safe shelter for her family. As a result, Eliza is applying for a loan in the amount of 10,000 PHP through NWTF for housing purposes. Specifically, she would like to use the loan proceeds to purchase materials to rebuild her family home and to pay for construction labor costs.

Eliza is committed to rebuilding her devastated life.

loans.use: to rebuild her family's home by purchasing materials and paying construction labor costs

loans.name: Cherelyn

texts.en:
Cherelyn is a 31-year-old, married woman. She and her husband have four children, two of whom are in school. She explains that she is a very hard-working entrepreneur.

Cherelyn's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. She has restarted her coconut wine business and is committed to regain what she lost in the storm. Cherelyn is seeking a loan in the amount of 9,500 PHP through NWTF for housing purposes. Specifically, she would like to use the loan proceeds to purchase building materials and to pay construction labor costs so that she can build a house for her family.

Cherelyn has been with NWTF since 2011 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to restart her life in a new home. In the future, Cherelyn would like to build and expand her business to secure a better future for her family.

loans.use: to build a new home for her family by purchasing building materials and paying construction labor costs

loans.name: Chammyca

texts.en:
Chammyca is forty three years old, and has two children in school. Chammyca works very hard to provide for them.

Chammyca's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Chammyca has restarted her business, and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.  She has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home.  She is using the this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

Chammyca is committed to rebuilding her devastated life, and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda is fifty-nine years old, married, and has five children.  She and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan, which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home was wiped out.  Erlinda is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.  She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her food vending.

With your help, Erlinda can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica works hard to support her family. On November 8, 2013, her business and home were wiped out by super typhoon, Haiyan.  She has restarted her business and is now requesting a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor so she can build a house for her family.  With your help, Jessica will be able to rebuild her devastated life sooner.

In the future, Jessica would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor

loans.name: Jose Armando

texts.es: José de 56 años de edad, es padre de 3 hijos de 10, 34 y 38 años. Él se dedica a la venta de mercancía al detal desde hace 2 años, cuando residía en Venezuela, un país fronterizo, de dónde provenía la mercancía que vendía al mejor precio del mercado.  Poco a poco ha agregado artículos variados como calzado y productos de la canasta familiar,  artículos deportivos, herramientas semindustriales  etc, con los cuales  ha logrado sostenerse en el mercado, vendiendo a crédito recibiendo  de sus clientes  pagos quincenales. José tiene la meta de hacer crecer su negocio comprando mercancía diversa que rota fácilmente y también instalar su propio taller de electricidad automotriz, oficio técnico que estudió y quiere desempeñarse en él.  En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará calzado deportivo y artículos de primera necesidad, pues sus principales vecinos, amigos y familiares le han encargado y quiere dar una respuesta oportuna. Su mayor desafío ha sido el insuficiente capital de trabajo para comprar los productos, además de que las posibilidades de acceso a créditos que hasta hoy ha solucionado con su credikiva.
texts.en:
José is 56 years old and he is the father of 3 children that are 10, 34, and 38 years old. He worked in dental equipment sales for 2 years, which he started doing when he lived in Venezuela - a bordering country - where he acquired the merchandise and sold it at good market prices.

Little by little he has accumulated various products, such as shoes and basic staples, sports items, semi-industrial tools, etc., which he has been able to sell in the marketplace on credit. He receives payment from his customers every two weeks.

José's goal is to grow his business by purchasing more diverse merchandise and also to start his own shop for electric automobiles. This is a technical skill that he learned when he studied and he wants to put it to use.

He is now seeking a loan, which will be his first from la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will use the loan to buy sport shoes and basic necessities because his neighbors, friends, and family have ordered these things and he wants to respond to them soon. His biggest challenge has been insufficient capital to buy merchandise. This is why CreditKiva is important, to open possibilities of access to financing.

loans.use: to buy sports shoes and other necessities.

loans.name: Carlos Enrique

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Carlos en el mejoramiento de su estudio fotográfico, con su credikiva otorgado por la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, logró adquirir una cámara fotográfica nueva, una impresora y una laminadora. Amplío su negocio  y se encuentra muy contento. Su mensaje a los financiadores de Kiva es el siguiente: “Con Kiva he realizado mi proyecto e trabajo, pues gracias a los créditos he cumplido ese cometido”. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará una impresora a color y otra laminadora, con esta inversión su negocio aumentará los cambios en su ampliación e imagen.
texts.en:
Thank you for supporting Carlos in the improvement of his photography studio.  With his Kiva loan granted by Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he was able to buy a new camera, a printer, and a laminating machine.  He grew his business and he is much happier.  

His message to the Kiva lenders is the following: "Because of Kiva, I was able to complete my project and work.  Thanks to the loan I was able to reach my goal."

He is applying for another loan which he will use to buy a color printer and another laminating machine.  With this investment, his business will grow because he will be able to provide enlargements of images.

loans.use: to buy a color printer and a laminating machine.

loans.name: Erlie

texts.en:
Erlie is 29 years old.  She is married and has four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell.  Erlie has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the charcoal business for three years and also earns an income from fish vending.

Erlie aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Gilberto

texts.es:
Gilberto es un joven muy luchador, esta siguiendo la carrera de medicina, una carrera muy sacrificada y que necesita de mucha dedicación. Él comenta que gracias a su préstamo anterior pudo comprar sus libros del año.
Hoy pide de nuevo un préstamo ya que necesita de más libros, con lo que podrá seguir seguir estudiando.
Gilberto agradece por esta nueva oportunidad que está recibiendo.
texts.en:
Gilberto is a courageous young man. He is pursuing a medical career, something that is demanding and requires a lot of dedication. Thanks to his previous loan, he was able to buy books for the school year. 

Today he is again requesting a loan because he needs more books so he can continue studying. Gilberto is grateful for this new opportunity he is getting.

loans.use: to buy books for university.

loans.name: Fegauiai

texts.en: Fegauiai is 45 years old and married with 6 children. She runs a small business of baking and selling pancakes in her community and has been doing this for 2 years. Fegauiai has requested a loan to purchase more ingredients for her business, such as bags of flour, sugar, baking powder and cooking oil, and also cement for home improvement. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to capital. With her earnings Fegauiai has managed to provide for her family's daily needs.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, baking powder and cooking oil and also cement for home improvement.

loans.name: Putri Sari Group

texts.en:
The Putri Sari group is located in Melaya, in west Bali. After this loan period, most of the members now have a sow and they can breed piglets. Breeding piglets requires expertise to make the piglets grow well and healthy. That’s why they need the loan, so they can purchase high quality feed and renovate the cage.

Ni Made has sold all of her piglets so far and she earns a satisfactory profit. She only needs to maintain them for two months. The profit is used for purchasing eggplant seeds and fertilizer. Ni Made and her husband plan to plant eggplant in their garden in this rainy season. Ni Made and all the members of Putri Sari say thank you for the loan and support they have had. This program has proved to increase their standard of living.

The Putri Sari now decide to continue their loans. Having sows, they need the loan to purchase feed and renovate the cage. But some of the members will  also use the loan to buy a new sow. They want to breed more piglets.

Ni Made will use her loan to purchase a sow again. She plans to sell the piglets outside her village in order to earn more income. She hopes her plan goes well. All the members also expect the same: the business will go well, the sows will give birth safely, and the piglets will grow healthy. Ni Made will use her profit to support her children's education and fullfill her family's daily needs.

Three of the previous members have resigned and been replaced with new members.

loans.use: to purchase a pig and feed.

loans.name: Estrella Marie

texts.en:
Estrella Marie previously accessed a 10,000 PHP loan that she used to buy more doormats to sell in her doormat business. Her earnings were a big help for the education of her children and in her personal, household and business expenditures.
 
She would like to apply for another 20,000 PHP loan for her to buy more doormats to sell in her doormat business. More items to sell will result in better profit. Her profits from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart.

Estrella Marie hopes that her business will be more successful, and dreams of giving her children a good education. She meets up with her co-followship* members to share stories of her work every week, where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to pay for more doormats to sell in her doormat business.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn, 52 years old, lives in Maular-Oroquieta, Misamis Occidental. She is married and gifted with 3 children. Her husband is a farmer who plants rice, corn and other agricultural commodities. 

Evelyn has experienced hardships, especially in raising her family. This industrious member finds herself helping her husband plowing the rice field, planting corn and other crops. 

In need of additional working capital, Evelyn decided to join Paglaum Cooperative. She has received several loans already and recently requested a loan to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs for cultivating their land.

Evelyn has been able to manage her income. She is able to provide for the daily needs of her family. She is very thankful because if it were not for Paglaum, she might not be able to cope without the needed working capital. She hopes to own a farm tractor someday to use for land cultivation.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies and pay labor costs for cultivating the land.

loans.name: Vergilita

texts.en:
Vergilita is married with five children.  She is 66 years old, and lives in Libertad Alto, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Vergilita sells assorted goods to earn a living, and has had this business for seven years. Each month, she earns PHP 2,000 doing this type of work. She has requested a loan of PHP 10,000 to restock her store with basic commodities.

Vergilita has been a member of PMPC for nine years.  In the future, Vergilita hopes to save for the future.

loans.use: to restock her store with basic commodities.

loans.name: Marita

texts.en:
Marita is fifty-three years old and married with nine children, two of whom are in school. Marita works very hard to provide for them. Marita's business and family home were destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her business and now needs to provide her family with safe shelter.

Marita has taken a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase materials to rebuild her family home. She is using this loan to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor. She is committed to rebuild her devastated life and in the future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is thirty-seven years old and has two children.  She is married and her children are in school. Rowena and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

She is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 10,000 purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2013. She plans to recover through her business of buying and selling fish.

With your help, Rowena can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 43 years old with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marilyn's house was destroyed by super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She has restarted her general store and is committed to regain what she lost. 

She is taking out a PHP 10,000 housing loan through NWTF to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family.

Marilyn has been with NWTF since 2012 in her pursuit to rise out of poverty. With your help, she will be able to start once more in a new home. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine works hard to support her family. Josephine is married, and has a fish vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional baskets of fish to sell.  Josephine has been in this business for six years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional baskets of fish to sell.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 43 years old and married, with four children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Josephine is borrowing PHP 25,000 through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Josephine has been farming rice for 20 years and also earns additional income from rice retailing.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to buy more farmland.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Heshima Group

texts.fr: La Cliente Beatrice est une brave commerçante d’une expérience 4 ans et membre d’un groupe d’Affaires «Heshima» âgée de 43 ans et mère de 10 enfants dont 6 étudient et 4 sont gosses. Elle est vendeuse de fruits. Elle étale ses marchandises dans un marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre son entreprise. Elle va acheter 450 tiges de cannes à sucre. Elle démarra avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Son conjoint est un mécanicien expérimenté de la place. Elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et assurer les  mieux êtres de ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour son soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs en leur donnant de  microcrédit sans garantie matérielle et qui sont exclues du système bancaire classique, surtout, dans la période post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
The client Beatrice is a brave saleswoman with four years of experience. She is a member of the business association "Heshima." Beatrice is 43 years old and the mother of ten children, six of whom attend school, and four of whom are young children.

Beatrice is a fruit seller in a market at the center of the city. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to help her business grow. She will use it to purchase 450 stalks of sugar cane. Beatrice started her business with funds she received from her husband. Her spouse is a local experienced mechanic.

Beatrice hopes to increase her capital and pay for the her children's schooling while ensuring a better life for her children. She thanks Hekima for their support of female entrepreneurs (who are excluded from the traditional banking system) by giving them access to micro loans without tangible security, especially in the post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to purchase 450 stalks of sugar cane.

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en:
Lolita is 53 years old and married with seven children. She has worked hard buying and selling rope for the past fifteen years. She also makes money selling charcoal.

Lolita has borrowed and paid off three prior loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 10,000 PHP loan to buy additional rope to sell.

Lolita’s ambition is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional rope to sell.

loans.name: Termutis

texts.es: Termutis de 51 años de edad habita con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 17,18 y 28 años en un barrio cercano a la playa, donde el sol, la brisa el calor y el mar, hacen sentir el sabor del caribeño Colombiano, alegre y extrovertido. Allí se dedica al comercio de productos diversos, mediante guías especializadas o catálogos, desde hace 12 años, cuando inició su experiencia emprendedora, con el fin de generar ingresos autónomos. Para ello empezó vendiendo en temporadas de picos altos sobre la demanda de vecinos, familiares y amigos, y posteriormente se vinculó a las empresas que le proporcionan catálogos y precios de ocasión con la que le ha ido muy bien. Sus ventas las realiza a crédito todos los días, desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde y sus compras de contado sobre promociones y pedidos. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, segundo financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, pues se encuentra entusiasmada porque con el anterior le fue muy bien pues agregó a su lista nuevos clientes ofreciéndole ampliación en las cuotas de crédito. Hoy con su credikiva quiere seguir ampliando su estructura de negocio  por eso comprará artículos como perfumes, cremas y ropa con el fin de tener inventarios suficientes, para responder oportunamente y esto hace que su credikiva sea una exitosa inversión.
texts.en:
Termutis, 51 years old, lives with her partner and their three children, who are 17, 18 and 28 years old. They live in a neighbourhood close to the beach, where the sun, the breeze, the heat and the sea all allow you to feel the extroverted and happy spirit of the Colombian Caribbean. Termutis works selling a variety of items, by way of specialized guides or catalogues. She began her entrepreneurial venture 12 years ago with the goal of generating an independent income. She began to sell at peak times to meet the demand of her neighbours, relatives, and friends. After, she began to work with companies that offer catalogues and competitive prices, which has gone very well. Termutis makes her sales on credit and works every day from 8:00 in the morning until 6:00 in the evening. She makes cash purchases for sales and orders. 

Termutis is currently requesting a Kiva loan, which will be her second loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She is excited because her last loan went very well, as she gained new customers, which expanded her credit quotas. With this Kiva loan, she wants to continue to expand her business structure. She will buy items such as perfumes, creams, and clothes, in order to have a sufficient inventory so that she can respond to demand. This means that her Kiva loan will be a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy items like perfumes, creams and clothes.

loans.name: Secret La Rennaissance Group

texts.fr: Hasivirwa est un commerçant et membre d’une plate forme d’affaires «Secret la Renaissance», entrepreneur, âgée de 30 ans et célibataire responsable. Le client est distributeur des unités pour les téléphones. Il installe sa marchandise dans un shop aux périphéries de la ville  où, il a su gagner sa clientèle. Il commença ses affaires avec le premier capital reçu de ses parents. Plus tard, il bénéficia le prêt de l’IMF Hekima. Il y a 4 ans qu’il exerce cette activité. Ce nouveau prêt va lui servir pour s’approvisionner en cartes d’appel(calling card). Il souhaite se marier, acheter une parcelle et la construire. En définitif, elle remercie fortement Hekima pour l’autonomisation des petits  entrepreneurs exclus du système bancaire classique, surtout ; pendant ce moment difficile  post conflits à l’Est du pays.
texts.en:
Hasivirwa is a merchant and member of the business association "Secret la Renaissance". An entrepreneur, he is single and the representative of the group. The client is a distributor of telephone devices, and has four years of experience in this business. He sells his merchandise from a shop on the periphery of the city, where he has gained a clientele.

Hasivirwa began his business with capital that he received from his parents. Later on, he benefited from an IMF Hekima loan. This new loan will serve to supply him with calling cards for resale.

Hasivirwa hopes to marry, and to purchase a parcel of land on which he can build. Finally, he thanks Hekima for their support of small entrepreneurs who are excluded from the traditional banking system, especially during this difficult post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to purchase calling cards for resale.

loans.name: Mujeres De Fe Group

texts.es:
Mujeres de Fe está en su ciclo número 5 del programa de comité, además de eso están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, donde una de las integrantes la Sra. Adolfina, quien a través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y la aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación de pobreza
Entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que esta trabajando de empleada de hogar, y también se dedica a la venta de bijouterie que hace para la venta. Es una mujer muy sacrificada que lucha por su familia para darles todo lo que ella no pudo tener.
La Sra. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de materiales para su venta de bijouterie, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Mujeres de Fe (Women of Faith) is requesting for their fifth loan as a women's committee. They are also participating in the elimination of poverty survey. One of its members, Ms. Adolfina, is working hard to get out of poverty, never stopping in her way to becoming a successful woman. 
Among her various jobs, she works as a maid, and she also makes jewelry for sale. She struggles every day to provide her family with everything she couldn't have when she was younger. 
She is requesting for this loan to purchase materials to make jewelry, which will help her complete her business plan, which, in time, will increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make jewelry for sale

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es de la ciudad de San Pedro, es estudiante de la carrera de Ciencias Contables, es una persona que se está esforzando por salir adelante y que quiere ayudar a su familia.
Él está luchando por un mejor estilo de vida, ya que quiere poder dar a sus seres queridos todo lo que el no pudo tener.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus gastos de estudios, y de esa forma poder estar cerca de cumplir su meta de ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
texts.en:
Juan is from the city of San Pedro, and he is studying for a degree in Accounting Sciences. 

He is a person who is working hard to move forward, and who wants to help his family.  He is striving for a better lifestyle, as he wants to be able to give his loved ones everything that he was not able to have.

He is requesting this loan so that he can invest it in paying for his tuition, and in this way he will be able to come closer to achieving his goal of being a professional who benefits society.

loans.use: to pay tuition.

loans.name: La Union Group

texts.es:
El grupo La Union está en el ciclo 16, es un grupo muy emprendedor y que fueron creciendo de a poco, todas las señoras son muy emprendedoras y quieren seguir luchando para poder mejorar sus vidas y la de sus seres queridos.
Una de ellas es la Sra. Gladys quien se dedica a hacer y vender comestibles que ella misma sale a vender. Comenta que todos los días empieza su trabajo desde muy tempranas horas del día, ya que se levanta a preparar las comidas ella misma. Su sueño es poder seguir trabajando ya que con ello ayuda a su familia y a sus seres queridos.
Gladys pide este préstamo para poder comprar verduras, carne, pollo, condimentos y demás productos para poder seguir haciendo las comidas que vende. Ella agradece por esta oportunidad que está recibiendo de poder seguir trabajando y ayudando a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
texts.en:
La Union group is requesting for their sixteenth loan. This group has a strong entrepreneurial spirit, that allowed them to grow little by little. They are truly fighters that continue to work hard to improve their lives and their loved ones lives. 
One of them is Gladys, who makes her living making and selling food items. She starts working very early in the morning and she makes all her meals herself. Her dream is to continue working to help her family and her loved ones.
Gladys is asking for this loan to buy vegetables, meat, poultry, spices and other products to keep making the food that the sells. She is grateful for this opportunity to continue working and helping her family through her work.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, poultry, spices and other products

loans.name: Kuña Kyrey Group

texts.es:
Este  comité se llama  Kuña Kyrey se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Santaní. Todas las integrantes son de una zona muy alejada de la ciudad, eminentemente rural y que aún está en crecimiento.
Lucia, una de ellas, se dedica a la cría de animales de corral, un trabajo muy sacrificado, que le ocupa todo su tiempo. Cuenta que cría sus animales y que los vende o faena, y por medio de su trabajo lucha para poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida, y la de su familia.
Ella pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados para sus animales, ya que de esa forma podrá seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en: This group is named 'Kuña Kyrey' and is comprised of several neighbours of the town of Santaní. The members, all women, all live in a very remote part of the city, a very rural area that is still under development. Lucia, one of the members, raises barnyard animals, a very demanding task that takes up all of her time. She sells them or slaughters them. This business gives her the means to do all she can to improve her living conditions and those of her family. She asks for this loan in order to buy balanced feed for her animals, so as to keep in business.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed.

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria es estudiante de la carrera de enfermería, ella es una persona que se esta esforzando bastante para poder cumplir su sueño de ser una enfermera y es por eso que esta luchando.
Ella comenta que su préstamo anterior de kiva lo uso en la pagar las cuotas de su universidad, y así pudo cubrir ese gasto. Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder cubrir de nuevo sus cuotas, y así seguir estudiando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
Maria is studying for a nursing degree.  She is a person who works hard to meet her goal of becoming a nurse, which is what she wishes to become.

She says she used the previous Kiva loan to pay university fees so she could cover expenses.  Now she is requesting a new loan to pay new fees so she can continue her education.

loans.use: To pay unviversity fees.

loans.name: Nuevas Emprendedoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Nuevas Emprendedoras  está en su ciclo número 2, donde ellas están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza, ya que podrán conocer la situación de cada una y conforme a ello poder trabajar.
Hilda entre el trabajo que ella hace cuenta que confecciona sabanas, fundas, ropas para estancias, camisas de oficina, buzo para escuela, colchas, también se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Hilda solicita de este préstamo para la compra de Telas de para poder producir más en cuanto a su actividad, lo que le ayudará a tener a concretar su plan de negocio, el cual le ayudará a mejorar sus ingresos.
texts.en: The group 'Nuevas Emprendedoras' (means 'New Entrepreneurs') is in its second loan cycle with the lending institution. They completed a questionnaire designed to help them determine where they stand with regard to the poverty line so that they can work to remedy the situation. Hilda works as a seamstress and makes sheets, pillowcases, clothing for the great outdoors, shirts for the office, school clothes, and bedspreads. The institution has people advising the group on what to learn, check that the members attend the relevant classes, and encourage the women to fight to overcome poverty. The work of these advisers is very appreciated. Hilda asks for a loan in order to buy cloth so as to make more items. This will help her improve her business plan and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy cloth.

loans.name: La Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité La Esperanza pasa al cuarto ciclo, todas las señoras se dedican a la cría de animales menores como gallinas y cerdos también venden huevos y quesos. Son de una zona eminentemente rural y que aún está en crecimiento.
Lorenza es una de ellas, y cuenta que pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de balanceados, ya que de esa forma ella podrá seguir con la cría de sus animales que hace.
Agradece por la oportunidad que están recibiendo ya que le permitirá seguir trabajando como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
La Esperanza Communal Bank is starting its fourth loan cycle.  All the women earn a living raising small animals such as chickens and pigs, as well as selling eggs and cheese.  They're from an especially rural area that's still growing.

One of the women, Lorenza, said she's requesting this loan to be able to buy balanced feed so she can keep on raising animals.

She's grateful for the opportunity they're getting because it will allow them to continue working, just as they've been doing.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: I Nengah

texts.en:
I Nengah is very happy that his strategy to increase sales at his kiosk and boost his income has been very successful. His income is now sufficient to support his family. He was also able to pay off his prior loan through MUK quickly. He would like to thank all lenders for their support.

I Nengah now has a plan to buy souvenirs to sell to passengers who travel to Bali as well as additional merchandise for his kiosk. He is applying for a 7,000 IDR loan to buy these souvenirs and merchandise. All of his profits will go toward enlarging his business.

loans.use: to buy souvenirs and other merchandise to sell.

loans.name: Vya Renda Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado  Vya renda está en su ciclo número 1 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, pero gracias al trabajo de todas y de las capacitaciones que están recibiendo van mejorando su situación de pobreza.
Juana es una de las que integra este grupo, ella es una persona muy humilde, que lucha por poder seguir ayudando a su familia y a sus seres queridos. Ella se dedica a la venta de remedios naturales, tanto para mate y terere, que son bebidas naturales del Paraguay. Ella pide este préstamo para poder comprar remedios naturales para la venta, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo.
texts.en:
The Vya Renda group is in its first cycle with the women’s committee program.  All of them are working and helping each other to get ahead.  They are completing the poverty elimination survey.  Thanks the work they all do and to the trainings they are receiving, their poverty situation is improving.

Juana is one of the members of the group.  She is a very humble person who struggles in order to be able to continue helping her family and her loved ones.  She sells natural remedies like ‘mate’ and ‘terere’, which are natural drink in Paraguay.

She is requesting this loan in order to be able to buy natural remedies to sell.  This way she will be able to continue with her sales like she is doing.

loans.use: to buy natural remedies to sell.

loans.name: San Roque Group

texts.es:
Las 17 integrantes de este comité cuentan con actividades diferentes y cada una de ellas pone su mayor esfuerzo por ir creciendo y mejorando sus vidas por medio del trabajo en conjunto.
La señora Elisa es integrante del comité, es casada y vive en la ciudad de Caacupé, ella se dedica a la fabricación y venta de dulces,  que ella misma hace y que luego sale a vender. Es una mujer muy luchadora y por sobre todo muy trabajadora.
El préstamo que pide lo quiere invertir en la compra de materiales para la elaboración de dulces y el envasado.
texts.en: The seventeen members of this committee work in different activities and they all put their efforts into growing and improving their lives by working together.  Elisa is a member of this committee.  She is married and lives in the city of Caacupé.  She works making and selling candy.  She is a fighter, but above all else she is a hard worker.  The loan that she is seeking will be used to purchase materials to make and package candy.

loans.use: purchase materials to make and package candy.

loans.name: Eduardo

texts.es:
Eduardo es de la ciudad de Ybycuí, es una persona que desde muy joven empezó a sacrificarse desde los 17 años.
Empezó a  trabajar para poder solventar mis gastos. Hoy está estudiando la carrera de Administración de empresas, y su mayor aspiración es terminar sus estudios y ser un profesional para poder ayudar a sus padres.
Eduardo pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas de la universidad, y de esa forma poder seguir con sus estudios, luchando por cumplir sus metas.
texts.en:
Eduardo is from the city of Ybycuí. He is person who began to make sacrifices when he was very young, as a 17-year-old.
He started working in order to afford his expenses. Today, he is studying for a career in business administration. His highest aspiration is to finish his studies and be a professional in order to help his parents.
Eduardo has asked for his loan to invest in his university fees so he can be able to continue his studies and fighting to reach his goals.

loans.use: to pay university tuition

loans.name: Ceverino

texts.es:
El señor Ceverino, se dedica al servicios de taxi, es casado, tiene casa propia, comenta que su señora es comerciante tiene una pequeña despensa.
Es un señor muy trabajador, responsable y muy honesto, que empezó a trabajar como ayudante en un colectivo después como chofer, su sueño de siempre era de trabajar en forma independiente y  así no depender más de otra persona, luego él a través de su esfuerzo, trabajando con mucha responsabilidad y dedicación   compro para su propio vehículo trabaja y hoy se dedica al servicios taxi.
Ceverino pide este préstamo para la compra de  cubiertas nuevas y mantenimiento general su auto así poder trabajar con mucha tranquilidad y ofrecerle un buen servicio a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ceverino, who is a dedicated taxi driver, is married, has his own house and says that he wife is a vendor that has her own storeroom.

He is a hard worker, responsible, and very honest that began to work  as an assistant in a group, and then as a driver. His life-long dream was to work independently and become less dependent of another person. Then, through his effort working with a lot of responsibility and dedication, he bought his own car and today is dedicated to the taxi services. 

Ceverino seeks this loan for the purchase of new tires and general maintenance of his car so he can work with tranquility and offer good service to his customers.

loans.use: to purchase new tires and do general maintenance of his car

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
Victor es de la ciudad de Pilar, es una persona que está luchando por poder mejorar sus condiciones de vida y la de su familia por medio de sus estudios.
