Está estudiando la carrera de contabilidad, por medio del cual podrá seguir luchando por su objetivo de ser un profesional útil a la sociedad.
Victor pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en pagar sus cuotas, además de poder pagar sus clases de la universidad.
texts.en:
Victor is from the city of Pilar. He is fighting to improve the living conditions of him and his family through his education.

He is studying for a degree in Accounting, which will allow him to continue to pursue his goal of being a useful professional to society.

Victor is asking for a loan to invest in paying fees, in addition to paying for university lectures.

loans.use: to pay university fees and lectures

loans.name: Loma De La Cruz  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El grupo de crédito Loma de la Cruz está formado por 15 mujeres y 2 hombres quienes vive por los alrededores de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad de una belleza sin igual que desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de propios y extraños, su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Las socias son mujeres que luchan el día a día para mejorar la estabilidad de sus hogares para brindarles a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora Jacqueline tiene 41 años de edad, está casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 19 y 17 años, su primer hijo trabaja y le ayuda económicamente, su segunda hija está estudiando en un colegio de la ciudad, su esposo es pintor y la casa en la que viven es arrendada. 
Doña Jacqueline es comerciante de ropa desde hace 2 años, trabaja de lunes a viernes sin un horario fijo, sus productos los vende recorriendo los mercados de la ciudad y también les vende a sus amigos y conocidos. El dinero de su crédito va ha invertir en la compra de ropa. Su meta es de tener su casa propia.
texts.en: The Loma de la Cruz credit group was founded by 15 women and 2 men who live on the outskirts of the city of Cuenca. It is a city of unrivalled beauty which has been listed as a UNESCO World Heritage Site since 1999. The city's food pleases the palates of locals and visitors alike and its friendly and kindly inhabitants still keep alive local culture and traditions. The members of the group are women who strive on a daily basis to improve their families' stability and provide a better future for their children. One of the group's members is 41-year-old Jacqueline, who is married with 2 children, aged 19 and 17. Her older child works and helps her financially, whilst the younger one (a girl) goes to a secondary school in the city. Jacqueline's husband is a painter and they rent the house in which they live. Jacqueline has been in the business of selling clothing for 2 years. She works from Monday to Friday, but with no fixed hours, and sells her goods around the city's markets or directly to friends and acquaintances. She intends to use the money from the loan to buy clothing. It is her ambition to own her own shop.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Loreta

texts.en:
Loreta is 69 years old, and lives in Palilan, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is married with four children, who are now at adult and school age. 

Loreta has a little store, and sells groceries and other consumable products. She is also engaged in operating a mini-sawmill and in fishing activity. Loreta earns approximately PHP10,000.00 each month doing this type of business activity. She has requested a loan to be used to purchase additional fishing equipment. 

Loreta has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future Loreta. hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing equipment.

loans.name: Mirian Yaqueline

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Tosagua cada quince días se reúne el Grupo De Crédito San Cristóbal, este lugar se lo conoce por ser muy dinámico donde la mayoría de sus habitantes se dedican a la agricultura y a la cría de animales, por ser una zona con gran vegetación.
En este lugar vive la señora Mirian, tiene 49 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene tres hijos, dos mayores y la menor de 16 años que estudian en colegio y es la que e  aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es profesor.
Doña Mirian es un ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos y con esto poder contribuir a los gastos que genera su hogar se dedica a la venta ropa de todo tipo y productos de Avon (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Su forma de venta es puerta a puerta aunque la mayor parte de sus ventas las realiza en su casa, ella deja a crédito y cobra cada semana, lleva  más  de 19 años que se dedica a esta actividad la misma que inicio con el primer crédito que recibió del grupo.
Este crédito es para comprar ropa, perfumes, cremas, cosméticos entre otras cosas. Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y confiable. Sus sueños son que su hija sea toda una profesional.
texts.en:
San Cristóbal Communal Bank meets every two weeks in the city of Tosagua.  Tosagua's known as a vibrant place where the majority of the residents work in agriculture and raising animals because there's a lot of vegetation.

Mirian, 49, lives there.  She has a common-law relationship from which she has three children, two adults and one minor, 16, who's still in school and lives at home.  Her husband is a teacher.

Mirian's a homemaker who, to earn her own income and help with the household expenses, sells a variety of clothing and Avon products (beauty products, cosmetics, perfume, and women's accessories).  She sells door-to-door, although she makes the majority of her sales at home.  She leaves merchandise on credit and collects every week.  She has worked in this job for more than 19 years, having started it with the first loan the group received.

This loan is to buy clothing, perfume, creams, cosmetics, and other products.

She has been with the communal bank since the beginning, and she likes it because the group is very close and reliable.  Her dream is for her daughter to be a professional.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfume, creams, cosmetics, etc.

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is fifty-six years old, married, and has three children. Fe and her family survived super typhoon Haiyan which swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013, but her business and family home were wiped out. 

Fe is taking out a housing loan amounting to Php 8,500 to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor to build a house for her family. She has been an NWTF borrower since 2011. She plans to recover through her tailoring business.

With your help, Fe can rebuild her house and rebound from the devastation of super typhoon Haiyan. In the future she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase building materials and pay for construction labor.

loans.name: Marosyl

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marosyl works hard to support her family by selling rice. She also earns money running a sari-sari, or general store, and fattening pigs to sell.

Marosyl has been supported in her businesses through her two previous loans with NWTF. She is now applying for a 15,000 PHP loan to buy additional sacks of rice to sell. She trusts that her hard work will help her save money toward expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Melyn

texts.en:
Melyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to purchase meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc. for her restaurant business.

Melyn has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from fishing.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase meat, vegetables, canned goods, etc. for her restaurant business

loans.name: Ney

texts.en:
Ney is married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ney is 51 years old, and has three children who are in school.

Ney has a food vending business in the Philippines. Ney requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase ingredients like sugar and peanuts, as well as plastic containers, etc.

Ney has been in this business for five years. In the future, Ney would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients like sugar and peanuts, as well as plastic containers, etc.

loans.name: Everlides

texts.es: Gracias por apoyar a Everlides, quien se encuentra muy satisfecha  porque con su tasa de interés, su crédito tuvo menos costos y gastos, porque pudo comprar lavadoras, para aumentar opciones de acceso de este servicio por parte de sus clientes. Sus otros negocios también ameritan inversión, por eso en la actualidad está aplicando a un nuevo credikiva, mediante el cual comprará nuevas lavadoras y además cervezas, gaseosas, nuevos planes a celulares, y con ello impactará sus ventas, pues la oferta de productos o servicios con acceso oportuno es el mayor beneficio que el negocio puede ofrecer a su clientela. Everlides dice a sus financiadores de Kiva: “gracias por la ayuda, que sigan así y muchas bendiciones. “
texts.en: Thank you for supporting Everlides. She is very satisfied because with her interest rate, her loan has lower costs and expenses. She was able to buy washing machines to increase the options of access to this service for her customers. Her other businesses are also worthy of investment and that is why she is now applying for a new Kiva loan. With it, she will buy new washing machines, beer, soda, and new cell phone plans. This will impact her sales by offering products or services with timely access, which is the biggest benefit she can offer her customers. Everlides says to her Kiva lenders: "thank you for the help, please continue and many blessings."

loans.use: to buy beer, soda and new cell phone plans.

loans.name: Teodosa

texts.en:
Teodosa is 65 years old and a widow with six children. For the past twenty years she has worked very hard running a sari sari, or general store, in the Philippines.

Teodosa is applying for a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional goods to sell in her sari sari such as canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional goods to sell in her sari sari

loans.name: Louange Group

texts.fr: La cliente Tulinabo est une commerçante depuis 2 ans, vice-présidente et membre d’un groupe solidaire «Louange». entrepreneur, âgée de 36 ans, mariée et mère de 5 enfants qui tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse de souliers usagés et elle s’entraide avec son mari. Elle installe son business dans le marché central de la ville. Elle sollicite un prêt auprès de Hekima pour accroitre ses activités. Elle va acheter 2500 paires de souliers dames. Elle débuta avec de fonds reçu de son mari. Dans l’avenir, elle souhaite accroitre son capital, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Elle remercie Hekima pour avoir bien choisi sa cible, en apportant un soutien aux femmes entrepreneurs exclues du système bancaire classique, tout en leur accordant des crédits sans garantie matérielle, surtout, pendant, la période post conflits dans la région de l’Est Pays.
texts.en:
The client Tulinabo has been a merchant for two years, and serves as vice president and member in the business association Louange Group. An entrepreneur, Tulinabo is 36 years old, married, and the mother of five children who all attend school. She is a merchant of used shoes, and benefits from assistance from her husband, from whom she received the funds to start her business.

Tulinabo runs her business from the market in the center of the city. She is requesting a loan from Hekima to help her business grow. She plans to purchase 2500 pairs of ladies shoes.

In the future, Tulinabo hopes to increase her business capital, and educate and nourish her children. She thanks Hekima for hitting the mark with their support of female entrepreneurs (who are excluded from the traditional banking system) by granting them loans without the need for tangible security, especially during the post-conflict period in the east of the country.

loans.use: to purchase 2500 pairs of ladies shoes.

loans.name: Maria Orfelia

texts.es: María vive en Santo de los Tsachilas ciudad muy comercial, se encuentra ubicada en una zona cálida húmeda del Ecuador, ciudad que ha crecido mucho en los últimos años porque es el puente entre la costa y la sierra, tiene dos hijos, ellos estudian en un colegio fiscal cerca de su casa. María, hace nueve años, por la necesidad y superación decidió ponerse su propio negocio, ella compra chanchos en pie y vende su carne en un puestito ubicado en una vía principal de la ciudad, su negocio lo atiende cuatro días a la semana, los miércoles, viernes, sábados y domingos, desde las 7 am hasta la 1 pm. María actualmente solicita un crédito para la compra de más chanchitos para la venta de carne, por ello acudió a la institución. María conoció a Fundación Alternativa a través de vecinos quienes le recomendaron por los servicios que la institución ofrece, María se siente muy agradecida porque ya lleva créditos con Fundación Alternativa y Kiva le ha ayudado a mejorar mucho su calidad de vida, porque con estos créditos pudo mejorar sus ventas y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
María lives in Santo de los Tsachilas, a very busy commercial city that is located in a hot and humid area of Ecuador. The city has grown a lot in the last few years because it is the bridge between the coast and the sierra.

María has two children who study in the public school near her house. Nine years ago, María decided to start her own business because she needed to and because she wanted to overcome obstacles. She buys live pigs and sells their meat in a small stall located on one of the city's main streets. She tends to her business four days a week: Wednesdays, Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays from 7 am to 1 pm. 

María is currently asking for a loan to buy more pigs to sell the meat; she came to the institution for this. María learned about Fundación Alternativa through her neighbors, who recommended the institution to her for the services it offers. María feels very grateful because she's already gotten loans with Fundación Alternativa and Kiva, which have helped her improve her quality of life a lot because she was able to improve her sales and improve her home with these loans.

loans.use: to buy more pigs

loans.name: Santos Pablo

texts.es:
El Señor Santos tiene 40 años de edad, es padre de 3  hijos, convive con su esposa , Su actividad es el comercio y la caficultura cuenta con más de 10 años de dedicarse a esta  actividad.
Santos tiene una muy buena clientela siendo estos los vecinos de su comunidad y personas en transito por la zona y corteros de diferentes partes del país, con el crédito que nos a solicitado el podrá comprar una planta solar lo que le permitirá mejorar las condiciones de vida en su hogar y así obtendrá una mejor clientela en su negocio para cubrir los gastos familiares y compromisos financieros contraídos.
Santos su sueños es darle una buena educación profesional a sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de vida de el y su familia, con el apoyo que reciba del préstamo le contribuirá a lograr sus sueños y a tener acceso a la luz solar ya que en la zona no cuentan con el servicio de energía electrica.


                                                                         Trojes, Honduras Febrero 2014
texts.en:
Mr. Santos is 40 years old, a father of 3 children, lives with his wife, and has worked doing coffee production for more than 10 years.

Santos has a very good clientele of neighbors in his community and people in transit through the area and cutters (people employed on farms engaged in cutting coffee per can or bag) from different parts of the country. With this credit he has applied to buy a solar panel allowing him to improve living conditions in his home and to will have a better clientele in his business, which will help him cover family expenses and financial commitments .

Santo' dream is to give a good professional education to his children and improve the lives of himself and his family. The support received from the loan will help him achieve his dreams and have access to sunlight in an area that lacks the service of electrical energy .

                                                                         Trojes, Honduras February 2014

loans.use: to buy a solar panel

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is engaged in a direct-selling business, particularly cosmetic products and underwear for men and women. She has been involved in this kind of business for three years. 

Now, she wants to keep her business profitable and satisfy all her customers' demands. For this reason, Lorna is asking for additional capital of PHP 5,000 to be used to buy stocks of cosmetic products to sell. She knows that this loan will have much to do with the improvement of her sales and profit.

loans.use: to buy cosmetic products to sell.

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle is 34 years old and has two children, two of whom are in school. For the past three years she has raised pigs to sell.

Annabelle has received four prior loans through NWTF. She is now applying for a 17,000 PHP loan to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs. Her aim is to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Estelita

texts.en:
Estelita is 44 years old and married with one child in school. For the past ten years she has worked hard operating a sari sari, or general store in the Philippines.

Estelita is applying for a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. Her aim is to save enough money to be able to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy stock for her store

loans.name: Florita

texts.en:
Florita is 65 years old and married, with 12 children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

Florita has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell, like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Syrga

texts.ru: Сырга, 30 лет, замужем, есть ребенок. У Сыргы высшее образование, она окончила профессиональный лицей по специальности ремонт компьютеров, по второму образованию она экономист. Имеет только положительные отзывы, как о доброй, приветливой, трудолюбивой женщине. Сырга в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, с 2013 года занимается торговлей мыло-моющими средствами, начав этот бизнес с 20,000 сом (KGS). На данный момент в обороте имеет 80,000 сом (KGS). Ежемесячная прибыль в среднем составляет 25,000 сом (KGS), что служит основой для покрытия расходов на питание и бытовые нужды семьи. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Сырга обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом на покупку мыло-моющих средств, что позволит увеличить товарооборот. Также  доходы от кредита помогут Сырге оплатить обучение сына в детском саду, а в будущем приобрести квартиру.
texts.en: Syrga is 30 and married with one child. She has a higher education, having graduated from professional school with a major in computer repair as well as having received an education in economics. She has nothing but positive references as being a kind, friendly and hardworking woman. Since 2013, Syrga has been selling detergent and other cleaning products as the primary source of income for her family, a business she began with 20,000 KGS. At the moment she has 80,000 KGS in turnover with monthly profits of 25,000 KGS, which serves to cover expenses for her family's food and everyday needs. With the goal of further developing her business, Syrga has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan to purchase detergent and cleaning products, which will allow her to increase her turnover. Profits from the loan will also help Syrga to pay for her son's kindergarten education and in the future will go toward acquiring an apartment.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy agricultural ingredients to help and maintain her coffee crops.

loans.name: Adolfina

texts.en:
Adolfina is from Bolinao, where people are mostly engaged in hog-raising. She raises pigs, keeping two heads of pig. She also cultivates crops, but only uses the gathered harvest for family use. 

Adolfina is very enthusiastic about running her farm successfully and gathering enough income for her family. She lives with her husband and children. She has now applied for this loan of PHP 8,000. She will use it to purchase two heads of pig, as well as to enlarge her business. The loan is very important to Adolfina, to increase her income and to address her family's needs.

loans.use: to purchase two heads of pig, as well as to enlarge her business.

loans.name: Husna

texts.en: Husna is a 24-year-old single woman. She describes herself as persistent. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are good and reliable. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to expand within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is 54 years old and lives in Macabayao, Jimenez, Misamis, Occidental. She is widowed with children who are all adults. 
Nelia has been engaged in a hog-fattening business for five years and earns approximately PHP 3,000.00 each month from it. She has requested a loan to buy three sacks of feed for her hogs. Nelia has been a member of PMPC for almost five years. In the future, Nelia hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy three sacks of feed for her hogs.

loans.name: Gilda

texts.en:
Gilda works hard to support her family. Gilda is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs and noodles.

Gilda has been in this business for three years now.

In the future, Gilda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stock to sell like canned goods, chips, eggs and noodles

loans.name: José Jorge

texts.es:
José  de 54 años de edad, no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar, se casó a la edad de los veinte y cinco  años, su esposa es ama de casa, ella es la que se encarga de las labores del hogar, los hijos ya están aparte, cada quien con su hogar. Nadie más vive con ellos. 


Él es agricultor, tiene más de veinte años de realizar la actividad, su padre desde pequeño le enseño que la vida solo se vivía bien, si trabajaba honradamente, cuando alguien lo busca que le ayude a trabajar también lo hace, la distancia que recorre es variable ya que no siempre va al mismo lugar, cuando saca la cosecha una parte la vende y lo demás para el consumo, nadie más se involucra en la actividad, el trabajo lo hace por la mañana de 6:00 am a 12:00 md.


El préstamo que esta solicitando a CREDICAMPO,  es para mejorar  la vivienda que actualmente es de lámina y le quiere invertir en un mejoramiento, le cambiara el techo y lo pondrá de teja, también comprara madera (cuartón, regla, clavos etc.), la necesidad satisfecha será el tener mejores condiciones en su hogar.
 
Los sueños que tiene es poco a poco ir mejorando la infraestructura de su casa, espera que sus hijos sean personas de bien tal como él se los ha enseñado, con la mejora que le haga al  hogar le dará un mejor valor, por lo que sus hijos podrán tener un patrimonio.
texts.en:
José, who is 54 years old, didn't have the opportunity of going to school. He got married when he was 25 and his wife is a homemaker, so she works taking care of the household chores. Their children already live on their own, each in their own home. No one else lives with them.

He has been a farmer for over twenty years. When he was little, his father taught him that life is only well lived when you work to earn an honest living. Whenever someone needs him to help with a job he does that too. The distance he covers varies because he doesn't always travel to the same place. After the harvest, he sells part of his crops and keeps the rest. No one else is involved in his business. He works in the mornings from 6:00 to 12:00.

He will use the loan he is requesting from CREDICAMPO to improve his housing. His house is currently made of sheet metal. He wants to invest in improvements like replacing the roof with shingles. He will also buy lumber (planks, beams, etc.) and nails. By meeting this need he will have better living conditions. 
 
His dream is to improve the infrastructure of his house little by little. He hopes his children will be decent people like he taught them. The home improvement will increase the value of his home, for the future benefit of his children.

loans.use: to buy shingles, lumber (beams, planks, etc.) and nails to repair the roof in his house.

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is 55 years old and lives in Salimpono, Panaon, Misamis, Occidental. She is married with four sons, two married and two single. 
Judith is earning income from farming activity, particularly coconuts and rice, and from a business direct selling cosmetics. She earns approximately PHP 4,000.00 each month from this work. Judith is also working as a treasurer of an NGO. She has requested a loan to purchase construction materials for her house repair and renovation. Judith has been a member of PMPC for two years. In the future, Judith hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy construction materials for her house repair and renovation

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en: Fatuma is a 66-year-old divorced woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 10 to 30 years. She describes herself to be focused and God fearing. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are passersby. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food to sell

loans.name: Nelson

texts.en:
Nelson is 47 years old, married, and a resident of Molatohan, Oroquieta, Mindanao, Philippines. His wife is a housekeeper. They have four children, of whom three are in school. Starting with capitalization of 14,950 PHP, Nelson opened a sari-sari (general store) and was able to expand it with the help of Paglaum Cooperative. 

Aside from financial assistance, he was able to generate savings and enjoys the benefits given by the co-op. He became a member in July 2011 and has taken out previous loans. Now, he has applied a loan to purchase stocks of basic goods. Nelson wishes to continue as a member in good standing and be able to manage his finances. If not for PMPC, he might not have any savings for their future. 

Nelson only wants to live a happy and comfortable life and see his children holding their diplomas someday.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of basic goods for his store

loans.name: Merly

texts.en:
Merly works hard to support her family. Merly is married and has a buy-and-sell rice grains business in the Philippines.

Merly requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase rice grains to sell.

Merly has been in this business for six years now. In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase rice grains to sell

loans.name: Anyelit De La Cruz

texts.es: Cada sábado se levanta con la ilusión de ser una licenciada en contabilidad, es por eso el esfuerzo que día a día pone Anyelith y el apoyo de su padre ha logrado cumplir satisfactoriamente las metas propuestas en sus estudios. Esta joven de 28 años desea terminar su carrera para insertarse en el mundo laboral y obtener una buena experiencia. Solicita el préstamo para pagar su curso de titulación. Su plan futuro es laborar en una empresa de prestigio y aplicar los conocimientos adquiridos.
texts.en: Every Saturday she gets up with the illusion of being a Licensed Accountant. So Anyelit makes an effort day by day with the support of her father to satisfactorily achieve the  proposed goals of her studies. This 28 year old woman wants to finish her studies and enter the working world and get experience. She is requesting a loan to pay for her studies. Her future plan is to work for a prestigious company and apply her acquired knowledge.

loans.use: to pay for her studies.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is married with one child. She is 60 years old and lives in Tipan, Sinacaban, Philippines.

Helen is a farmer and grows fruit and vegetable crops to earn a living. She has been doing this for 10 years. She has requested a loan to buy additional fertilizers.

Helen has been a member of PMPC for seven years. In the future, she hopes to save for future emergencies.

loans.use: to buy additional fertilizers

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 52 años de edad, alquila maquinas lavadoras, ofrece servicios de acceso a internet, de fotocopiaje y de scanner en su propia vivienda, ubicada en la ciudad de Barranquilla. Desde hace 2 años surgió su idea emprendedora, con el fin de responder a las necesidades de aumentar los  ingresos de su hogar, conformado por su cónyuge y tres hijos adultos y también para sentirse muy activa. Por eso observando los requerimientos de su vecinas, respecto a los servicios  que hoy ofrece, decidió ponerle fin a la necesidad , que los habitantes del barrio padecían,  al no contar con ningún tipo de servicio de alquiler de lavadoras, fotocopiaje e impresión.  Hoy todos los días desde muy temprano, da apertura a su instalación para atender la  clientela, que la conforma los vecinos y transeúntes que por allí circulan. Su meta es hacer crecer cada vez más su negocio, por eso se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el fin de obtener un credikva, mediante el cual comprará  2 lavadoras una fotocopiadora y un equipo de cómputos, con ello tendrá más capacidad instalada  para prestar un mejor servicio y obtener mar ingresos, sin que sus clientes tengan que esperar. Superando  con su credikiva su gran desafío de insuficiencia para invertir.
texts.en:
Martha is 52 years old. She rents washing machines and offers internet access, photocopy and scanner services in her own home located in the city of Barranquilla. Two years ago she was inspired by this enterprising idea with the goal of answering the need to increase the income of her household, made up of her husband and 3 adult children. She also wanted to feel busy. So she observed the needs of her neighborhood as far as what services were being offered. She decide to fill the need for washing, photocopying and printing.

Today she gets up very early and opens her shop to attend to her clients which are her neighbors and others passing through the area. Her goal is to expand her business daily. So she has come to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, with the goal of obtaining a loan through Kiva. She will use it to buy 2 washing machines, a photocopier and a computer. She will have more capacity to provide better service, increase her profits and not have her clients have to wait. The Kiva loan will solve her problem of not having enough capital to make this investment.

loans.use: to buy 2 washing machines, a photocopier and a computer.

loans.name: Los Naranjos Group

texts.es: Juan, tiene 43 años de edad, esta casado, tiene dos hijos, reside en el municipio de Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. Siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura, cultivando maíz, frijol y café. Su cultivo principal considerado como su fuente de ingresos es el café. El que vende en el mercado local. En forma grupal a decidido solicitar un préstamo por 6,000 Lempiras con el cual va comprar fungicidas, abonos, pesticidas y otros para darle asistencia al cultivo de café y poder sacar mayor producción. Su meta es mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. El grupo al que pertenece se llama Los Naranjos, que esta integrado por 4 miembros, viven en la misma comunidad y se dedican al cultivo de café. El préstamo grupal es por 24,000 lempiras y lo invertirán en la compra de fertilizantes para dar asistencia al cultivo de café. en la foto esta Manuel con camiseta rayada a la izquierda, sigue Cirilo  camisa roja, Juan con gorra beige y azul y Rodolfo de sombrero a la derecha.
texts.en:
Juan is 43 and is married, with two children. He lives in the town of Azacualpa, Santa Bárbara. He has always worked in agriculture, growing maize, beans and coffee. His principal crop, which affords him his main source of income, is coffee, which he sells in the local market. He has decided to ask for a loan of 6,000 HNL through the group loan. He intends to use it to buy fungicide, manure, pesticide and other items to help with his coffee crop and ensure a bigger harvest. His goal is to improve his family's living conditions.

He is a member of the "Los Naranjos" group, which consists of 4 members. They live in the same community and grow coffee. The group loan is for 24,000 HNL, which they will invest in buying fertilisers to help with their coffee crops. In the photo, manuel is in the striped shirt on the left, Cirilo is in the red short, Juan is wearing beige and blue, and Rodolgo is in the hat on the right.

loans.use: to buy fungicide, manure, pesticide and other items to help with the coffee crop.

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: Luis de 43 años de edad es propietario de un negocio en el municipio de Baranoa, cerca de la ciudad de Barranquilla,  donde habita con su cónyuge y sus 3 hijos en las edades de 14 19 y 21 años. Hace 15 años en el mes de Agosto del año 1998, teniendo en cuenta que familiares y amigos tenían microempresas de confecciones, empezó a trabajar en este arte en el negocio de su hermano y finalmente se independizó dando apertura a su propio negocio.  Sus principales productos son las chaquetas, faldas, shorts jeans, pantalones clásicos que vende a mayoristas de ropa de la ciudad, para la producción Luis  compra su materia prima de contado en almacenes especializados de telas e insumos de confecciones. Su día laboral inicia desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 8 de la noche sin cesar, solo haciendo pausas para alimentarse. Vende a crédito y de contado  especialmente a comerciantes de ropa del sector. Su meta es continuar ampliando su negocio y finalmente comprar su propia casa, pero su mayor desafío es adquirir más maquinarias y contratar operarias eficientes. En la actualidad está aplicando aun credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual , con el fin de incrementar la productividad  y aumentar sus ventas y sus utilidades en dirección al cumplimiento de sus sueños de prosperidad.
texts.en:
Luis is 43 years old; he is the owner of a business in the municipality of Baranoa, close to Barranquilla city. He lives there with his 3 children, of 14, 19, and 21 years of age.  15 years ago in August of 1998, seeing that his family and friends had small businesses in dressmaking, he started to work in this field in his brother’s business and finally became independent and opened his own business. 

His main products are jackets, skirts, jean shorts, and classic pants which he sells to wholesale suppliers in the city. For the production he buys his raw material for cash in specialized textiles and dressmaking supplies warehouses. His work day starts at 8 in the morning until 8 at night stopping only for a break to eat. He sells on credit and for cash especially to clothing merchants of the area. 

His goal is to continue growing his business and to finally buy his own house, but his greatest challenge is in acquiring more machines and hiring efficient operators. Currently he is applying for one CrediKiva, the first financing that he will do with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which he aims to increase his productivity and increase his sales and his utilities in the direction of achieving his dreams of prosperity.

loans.use: to buy textiles, thread and accessories

loans.name: Lisdy Cristina

texts.es:
Lisdy de 22 años de edad, madre soltera con un hijo menor de edad. Es originaria del Sauce, lugar que está ubicado en la zona norte de la región. Se caracteriza por ser trabajadora, responsable, con ganas de superación personal. En sus ratos libre le gusta disfrutar de la compañía de sus hijo, lamentablemente por falta de recursos económicos no pudo cursar una carrera, pero le hubiera gustado estudiar enfermería. En la actualidad lucha para brindarle a su hijo las oportunidades que ella a ella no le brindaron.
Gracias a su esfuerzo y sus ganas de salir adelante tiene por actividad económica una pulpería, es una pequeña tienda que vende productos comestibles en cantidades pequeñas como es: arroz, frijoles, azúcar, leche, pan, huevos, detergente, jugos, gaseosas. Ella dedica a su negocio unas doce horas  diarias ofreciendo su producto. El objetivo del crédito es invertir en capital de trabajo y surtir su negocio en la compra y venta de productos comestibles, para que en un futuro no muy lejano pueda obtener mejores ingresos.  Lisdy agradece la ayuda que los inversionistas kiva les brindan a personas de escasos recursos y países pobre como es Nicaragua para tener un medio de trabajo digno.
texts.en:
Lisdy is 22 years old and the single mother of a young child. She is a native of El Sauce, a place in the north of the country. She is hard-working, responsible and wants to improve herself. In her spare time she likes to be in the company of her son. Unfortunately she did not have the economic resources to study a career. She would have liked to study nursing. Today she strives to provide the opportunities for her son that she never had.

Thanks to her efforts and desire to get ahead she has a small store. She sells grocery goods in small quantities like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice and soft drinks. She spends 12 hours a day in her business offering her product. The goal of the loan is to invest in working capital and stock her store with food products to sell so in the near future she can generate more income. Lisdy is grateful to the lenders at Kiva who support people of low resources in poor countries like Nicaragua so they can have a dignified means of employment.

loans.use: to stock her business with groceries like rice, beans, sugar, milk, bread, eggs, detergent, juice and soft drinks.

loans.name: Mujeres Positivas Group

texts.es: Sonia integrante del grupo “Mujeres Positivas” con 05 integrantes mujeres emprendedoras y responsables, todas ellas vecinas de la zona. Sonia se dedica al alquiler de su vehículo, lleva más de 1 año en esta actividad, este negocio surgió gracias a la motivación de sus padres. Solicitó el crédito para la compra de llantas y mantenimiento de su vehículo. Seguir implementando su negocio es su mayor deseo. Sonia de 39 años es separada con 01 hijo dependiente.  El grupo “Mujeres Positivas” agradece a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito. Sonia se encuentra sentada, es la primera del lado derecho y viste bivirí marrón.
texts.en:
Sonia is a member of the “Mujeres Positivas” group, made up of 5 enterprising and responsible women from the same neighborhood. Sonia rents out her vehicle. She has been doing this for one year and the business came about through motivation from her parents. She is requesting a loan to buy tires and do maintenance on her vehicle. Her greatest desire is to continue running her business. Sonia is 39 years old, separated and has one child who is dependent on her.

The “Mujeres Positivas” group thanks the people who make this loan possible. Sonia is seated in the photo, the first from the left with the brown tank-top.

loans.use: to buy tires and do maintenance on her vehicle.

loans.name: Roy Misael

texts.es:
Roy de 32 años de edad,  estudio 4° grado debido a que murió su padre y quedo solo con su mamá y ya no pudo seguir en la escuela. Esta casado y tienen dos hijos de 6 y un año y medio de edad, su esposa se dedica al cuidado del hogar.

 Roy se dedica a la agricultura desde que tiene 10 años de edad, trabajo que aprendió con su madre y su abuelo. Él siempre se ha dedicado a la agricultura.

Para llegar donde siembra hay que caminar unos 25 minutos, luego trabaja unas 7 horas y regresa a su casa, por la tarde va a  la iglesia, nos cuenta que para aprovechar la mañana, se levanta a la 5:00 am mientras su esposa prepara el desayuno. Él prepara su equipo de trabajo y en el mismo viaje lleva su ganado al potrero, así es su rutina diaria.

El crédito sera invertido en la compra de semilla, abono y pesticidas para sembrar 14,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.


Su sueño es ver graduarse a sus hijos en una profesión, construir su casa de ladrillo ( hoy es de adobe) y pagar el crédito, y dejar puertas abiertas.
texts.en:
Roy is 32 years old; he studied up to the 4th grade because his father died and he was left alone with his mother and could no longer continue with school. He is married and has 2 children of 6 and 1 year and a half of age. His wife is a home maker. 

Roy has been in agriculture since he was 10 years old, work that he learned with his mother and his grandfather. He has always worked in agriculture. 

To get to the place where he plants, he has to walk 25 minutes, he then works for 7 hours and returns to his house and in the afternoon he goes to church. He tells us that to make the most of the morning, he gets up at 5:00 am while his wife makes breakfast. He gets his work equipment ready and on the same trip takes his cattle to pasture. That is his daily routine. 

The loan will be invested in buying seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to plant 14,000 square metres of corn.

His dream is to see his children graduate from a profession, to build his house of out brick (currently it is made out of adobe) and to pay off this loan and leave doors open.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and pesticides to plant 14,000 square metres of corn

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be polite and honest. 

He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His business is located in an area good for business, and his primary customers are car owners. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

He will use the 20,000 Kenya shillings (KES) loan to buy tools and equipment to use in the garage. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards.

loans.use: to buy tools and equipment to use in the garage

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a vibrant place and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be a lack of working capital. She will use the KES 25,000 loan to buy fabric. Her business goal is to have a tailoring school within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will build a permanent house. This is her second loan with SMEP DTM.

loans.use: to buy fabric
